story:
The Dark Heaven Girl Saga

 

What the hell is that? There, I asked the question for you!

The Dark Heaven Girl Saga is a science fiction hybrid story. The format is a combination of a prequel, written as a screenplay, and a 3-part comic that represents the main story. Originally this story was going to be released in separate issues. After careful consideration and thought, this story is best enjoyed all at once, hence, the complete Saga!

 

The story follows a young woman named Hannah. Her past involves a daring escape from an experimental government facility (told in the prequel) and then follows her subsequent unlikely friendship with an alien known as the Red Angel. 

The 3-part comic follows them into deep space, and into a parallel dimension of time. Violent and evil forces are discovered and they may not be as unfamiliar as they first appear. Hannah and the Red Angel embark on a heroic mission to rid the universe of their manic and deadly influence.

 

While this story finds it's hope and joy in Hannah, her struggle is dark and this story is for mature readers only.

If you are a fan of movies like Alien, or other Sci-Fi classics then you will love The Dark Heaven Girl Saga! Get ready for some blood and snappy dialogue (think Tarantino in space!) and buckle up for an amazing ride!

story:
As a child, I often found myself drifting off into the worlds I created in my head. The more I experienced in life, the more my universe expanded, and real these worlds became. I now would like to invite you all into this universe of mine, where you will find new tales and new legends in every world. A new arc for every generation.

Constant Hustle Comics was founded under the simple idea of "story telling inclusion".  We here just want to tell compelling stories that include all and everyone regardless of anything.  But we don't do this simply to catch the latest trend or to appeal to whatever may be popular at the moment.  We do this because as children we all wanted that from the comics we read.  We wanted to feel connected.  We wanted to feel as if our heroes understood us, our background, our stories.  Our heroes and their stories attempt to achieve exactly that.  Enjoy and as always be more than fans, be family

Who is the GRIM HERO!

Every tales of The Grim Reaper have one thing in common, death. Mortals who fear death, fear the Reaper. Resenting the fear of mortals, the Reaper seeks to win their hearts by becoming a symbol of hope. He learns that being a hero for a day will costs him everything, including the souls he saved.

GRIM HERO #1 Variant Covers by Leonardo Vincent

 

Music Inspired by GRIM HERO

The sound of the world of GRIM HERO produced by NOMMXX. GRIM HERO: Thriller Knights will be available digitally for all backers to enjoy. 

 

 

 

The vision was given to one, but couldn't become a reality without a team. There is still work to be done and we need your help. We appreciate you all. Your support matters more than you know.

story:
Thanks for a successful campaign!

Now offered as INDEMAND!

All Luck Comics 1 - 2 Launch Party!

As a DC Comics and comic strip veteran I've worked on dozens of well known comics characters. From Batman to Scooby-Doo, Garfield to The Phantom, Harry Potter to--well, you get the idea.  Now I've got an opportunity to do my own thing with my own characters in my creator owned indie title: All Luck Comics Adventure. Sixty-four pages of action comics! Check out all three video "Trailers" above for a good look at each feature: Captain Luck, Spy 66, and Blast Carson!

FEATURED COVERS!

ISSUE 2 VARIANT COVERS!

Gorgeous Variant Covers by John Royle, Kevin West, and Tim Levins!

What I've been missing in comics is action and high adventure so I've decided to make some of my own! This is an ongoing anthology style comic as in the retro years that allowed you to thrill to a variety of new characters with adventures often with cliffhanger endings that would keep 'em coming back for more! An action comic with comic action! Tired of grim and gritty takes and talking heads standing around? How about some colors other than gray and brown? I think I've got a comic for you!

The prospect of a direct line from creator to audience is one I couldn't be more happy with. And as the saying goes..."I couldn't have done it without you!" Even if you can't contribute dollars in these crazy times, spreading the word is just as valuable! Thanks to each and every one of you!

(Some interior pages shown here are sans dialog to avoid spoilers!)

NEW SNEAK PEEK PAGES FROM ISSUE 2!

 

 

 

Want to know more?

I've picked a simple and streamlined campaign and can guarantee the books will be available via this campaign.  Issue One is completed and Issue Two is nearing completion. I need to cover the costs of printing, shipping and handling, pay my excellent and talented variant cover artists like:

Tim Levins (from the Eisner Award winning Batman Gotham Adventures, Marvel and DC Comics, Archie, and the Scooby-Doo Encyclopedia)!

John Royle (G.I.Joe, Danger Girl, Spider-Man, & much sought after Cover Artist for Dynamite, and Zenescope)!

Kevin West (Guardians of the Galaxy, Justice League, Superboy, currently working on Iron Maiden's Legacy of the Beast Series and Megadeth's Death by Design Anthology for Heavy Metal)!

 AND be able to give you more in the future! In addition to a cover, I was able to secure talented Tim Levins to help me produce a Bonus Full Color Print unique to this campaign available in the All Issues Bundle!

I'm also offering perks with 9x12 original art color commissions and sketch cards (your choice of character).  Producing the book by myself doesn't give me much time to take any commissions on so this is your chance if you want one! Batman animated style is a specialty!

What's the comic about?

CAPTAIN LUCK

Jake Luck and Archie "Wink" Goodwin dive into the Bermuda Triangle and into adventure as freelance troubleshooters operating the Good-Luck Salvage Company from their lighthouse headquarters on the island of Crane Key.  Hired by controversial billionaire Karl Luter to find a mysterious ancient artifact is only the start of their worries. They search for fortune but usually, as luck would have it, find more trouble than treasure in the paranormal region. Captain Luck has a golden age Terry and the Pirates vibe but set in modern times with a supernatural twist.  Mix in a little Jonny Quest and Tintin and you'll get the mood.

SPY 66

April Thunder, Agent 66 of SPYW.A.T.C.H., finds it tough enough being a rookie female agent in the super spy era of 1966, but even harder if you're the daughter of the over protective head of the agency! She'll risk anything to prove herself. Even challenging a rogues' gallery of cold war supervillains in the ultimate danger room test! If she survives she'll be ready for her first mission: "The Island of Dr. 9" (with volcano of course).  Films and TV like Bond, Danger Man, The Avengers, and comics by Steranko and Wood inspired me to return to the adventures of a time when all you needed to fight evil was a code number and an acronym! Gadgets and guns a plus!


 

BLAST CARSON ON MARS: 1,000,000 B.C.

In the year 2053, space travel is dead, until a wave of romantic nostalgia for a bygone era fuels a new rocket age of exploration with the goal of landing a man on Mars via crowdfunding! Blast Carson is about to realize that goal when a mysterious space anomaly sends his ship careening out of control and into a past and dangerous age on Mars! A wet and wild world full of alien dinosaur creatures and a just developing world of little green men with flying saucers! Blast Carson is inspired by features like Flash Gordon and sci-fi comic books like Planet Comics when all you needed was a rocket ship and a raygun and you could Blast off to adventure!

Finally!

There are many more adventures to tell so make some noise and get the word out please! Check out the handy Indiegogo tools to help you share, too!  And finally THANKS! -- 'Cause I really want to get to All Luck Comics Adventure 3 and beyond!

story:
Hello!

For the last 9 months, I have been in deep collaboration with a brilliant graphic artist, Alison Klepatsky. I saw her sketching at a party, we began to talk about art, and before I knew it, she was sending me images from our conversation that blew me away. Each time Alison draws piece of my story I feel a beautiful ache and a knowing that Holy Roller is becoming real because of her acute vision.
Holy Roller is a memoir of my life growing up in the Bible Belt of Dallas Texas. It will be approximately 50 pages in length and heavy in both text and illustration.

What It Costs

  • 7,500 for self-publishing. This will include a website, promotion, design, proofreading, IBSN number, color cover, e-books, marketing to book sellers, and beyond.
  • 2,000 to pay Alison for her incredible artwork that will add exclamation marks to everything I have written. This was an amount that was agreed upon by both parties.
  • The rest will pay for the ability to take time off work to tour, gas and lodging, extra copies of books plus shipping cost (yes we have to pay for each book to get shipped!), and the fees associated with using Paypal, credit cards, and the IndieGoGo cut at the end.
  • Every donation over $25 receives a complimentary paperback book.
  • Every donation over $15 receives a complimentary e-book

Help Me Tell My Story

  • I work with homeless and at risk LGBT Youth. Nearly every day I remind one of them that that they are beautiful and worthwhile. This book is an endeavor to help me follow my own advice.
  • This will be my first solo book. It has been rattling in its cage long enough. 
  • Being an artist is not free. It also makes no money! By funding my book, you give a working class writer the ability to publish and possibly tour in your town!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this on all of your social media networks.
  • Contact local indie bookstores and ask them to carry the book.
  • Support feminist bookstores. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!



"I attended Sunday school for a little while. I would march past my father sitting on the ratty 70’s brown plaid sofa we had. He would usually be in underwear only, freshly high from a doobie, and tomato soup eyed. I would clutch my King James Bible close to my fake Izod polo, as he giggled and said, “Well there goes the Holy Roller everyone.” I ignored him and kept going, the hot summer sun washing me clean of the lazy circles of pot smoke and dust inside." Chapter excerpt -AA

story:
Short Summary

Back in 2011, I (Ramon Rivas) approached a yearly music/arts technology festival about curating a comedy stage there. My only aim was to help bring some up-coming, relevant national acts to town to show them how vibrant and alive Cleveland was becoming. The following year, Accidental Comedy Fest was officially born with shows at venues all over the greater Cleveland area.

Since it's inception, the event has served as a place to catch unknown comedians before they ascend. Seriously. Year 1 alumni Keith and Kenny, the Lucas Bros were sleeping on Cleveland comedian Tim Cornett's couch during their visit, and within a year appeared on Late Night with Jimmy Fallon, Arrested Development, debuted their own animated series on Fox (Lucas Bros Moving Company) and are part of the cast for TruTV's sketch series Friends of the People. They're just the 1st in an impressive list of comics that have come to Cleveland then exploded onto the national comedy scene.


It's a special thing when an emerging city welcomes emerging talent. Just check out Portland's Bridgetown Comedy Festival, which showcased a small, upcoming scene in a cool city and has now grown to become one of the marquee comedy fests in the country.

Accidental Comedy Fest is poised to continue to establish itself as one of the funnest festivals for performers. Everyone leaves with a changed narrative and perspective on Cleveland and that is GREAT.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this happen, we need you folks to help us out!
*Renting of The Cleveland Hostel for traveling artists to stay at
($3,000)
*Hospitality for visiting artists (food, drink)
($500)
*Travel/lodging costs for headliners
($1500)
*Print costs for promotions
($2,000)
*Artist compensation
($remainder)

This years festival is set to include some of the most respected shows and artists from around the country:
TED ALEXANDRO | BARON VAUGHN | DAVE HILL | GREG BARRIS | JIM TEWS | MIKE POLK JR | LAST CALL CLEVELAND | COMEDY AT THE KNITTING FACTORY | ENTERTAINING JULIA | KEEP TALKING |
THE UNDONE SWEATERS | PICTURE SHOW

Noah Gardenswartz | Brendan Eyre | Will Miles | Clark Jones | Kenny DeForest | Megan Gailey | Dave Helem | Reena Calm | Bill Squire | Tiffany & Danielle The Puterbaugh Sisters | Tim Cornett | Zachariah Durr | Adam Richard | Mary Santora | Curtis Cook | Shane Torres | Drew Michael | John Bruton | Jimmie Graham | Nelsin Davis | Nate Fridson | Reid Faylor | Danny Tambereli | Andrew Short | Ben Palmer | Yusuf Ali | Rob Ward | Ramon Rivas II
+ more TBA

more info at www.accidentalcomedy.com/acf2015shows

All performing at MAHALL'S 20 LANES, a concert venue/bowling alley ripe with history in the heart of Lakewood, OH. Mahall's offers tons of nooks and crannies, so in addition to the MAINSTAGE, there will be an intimate upstairs Secondary Stage, a basement VIP/performers lounge with bowling tourneys, karaoke, DJ's and more for artists & pass holders!


Contributors will be able to choose from a myriad of rewards for helping us out
1. Buyout Boca Loca Burrito Factory ($500)
-will go to any location you choose in the greater Cleveland area and provide food for up to 50 people A RIDICULOUS VALUE! Only 1 avail
2. A year of free Accidental Comedy shows ($500)
-Access to any and all ACC produced shows for a whole calendar year, includes ACF. ONLY 9 LEFT
3. HOUSE PARTY comedy show for you and your friends ($300)
-Want to laugh but tired of having to leave your house? This is a great way to throw a gnarly, unforgettable BBQ or childs party (please don't have us do a childs party) complete with a private stand up comedy show.
4. Personalized portrait by www.sketched-comedians.com ONLY 1 AVAIL ($175)
-Alex Kelly is a great artist and he'll do a portrait of you, your fav comic, your fav family member, your enemy, your nemesis, your pet, anything you want.
5. ACF Weekend Pass ($150)
-Lounge and luxuriate with artists and other pass holders all weekend ONLY 7 LEFT
6. Private Be Adventurous tours of Cleveland for 4 people ($100)
-It's like lolly the trolley. Except you can drink on it. And it's a monster truck ONLY 7 LEFT
7. A PAIR of day passes ($80)
-You and your boo can chill for a whole day together at a discounted rate for FRI, SAT, or SUN
8. One day pass + a t-shirt ($65)
-Come solo dolo and get a super dope t-shirt too for FRI, SAT, or SUN
9. Soup + Shirt ($50)
-We'll eat Superior Pho together, my treat, and you'll get a dope t-shirt
10. A PAIR of TICKETS for one show of your choosing during ACF ($30)
-The easiest, simplest way to help out is to just get some tickets and come with a friend.
11. COMIC SUBMISSION FEE ($15)
-Comics wanting to take part in the fest can choose this perk then follow the instructions to submit their packet. Selected performers will stay at Cleveland Hostel.
12. A sticker ($10)
-Put it on whatever you want
13. A hug ($5)
-Upwards of 90 seconds (please, limit it to like a 5 second hug)

The Impact

Establishing comedy as a part of a truly great Cleveland experience is the ambition. Laughter is the goal. Also, probably sandwiches. The Accidental Comedy Fest and other Accidental productions have helped Cleveland establish itself as an emerging comedy scene. Comedy is an art form that helps bring the community together, similar to sports without all of the sweating and sadness. There's still probably some sadness, but it's witty.

Over the years, performers who have come to Cleveland have left with a completely different impression and narrative for the city than before they came.  That is a powerful thing. Entering the 5th year of this endeavor, approaching over 100 alumni that left feeling great about Cleveland. Many of whom are becoming movers and shakers in their respective scenes.

The goal through ACF and other Accidental Comedy productions is to continue proving Cleveland is a relevant location for stand up comedy, and to connect comedy with the narrative and experience of Cleveland in a similar way that Second City is ingrained in the Chicago experience.

Risks & Challenges

If this campaign does not hit it's goal, the outcome could be devastating:
-Jimmie Graham will begin to slowly transition to Slam Poetry
-Brian Kenny will stop trying to control his diabetes and could probably lose a foot
-Mary Santora will immediately become a mother
-John Bruton will spearhead the reformation of the WNBA team Cleveland Rockers
-Ramon Rivas will burn all of his Cleveland related t-shirts, forcing him to roam the streets naked and afraid.
-Comics who plan on coming to Cleveland will think we are weak and non-fun

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Buying individual tickets for shows and planning to attend helps a lot! Visit Mahall's 20 Lanes website at http://www.mahalls20lanes.com after the indiegogo ends to purchase individual show tickets (which will include service charges! Gross!)
  • Spread the word! Let folks know they should be getting excited for this very great weekend of stand up comedy.
  • Volunteer! From September 11-13 we will need a lot of help transporting performers, ushering audience members during shows, ambassadoring artists around Cleveland, DJ's and more. Email info@accidentalcomedy.com to offer assistance.

anything you want. 5. ACF Weekend Pass ($150) -Lounge and luxuriate with artists and other pass holders all weekend ONLY 7 LEFT 6. A PAIR of day passes ($80) -You and your boo can chill for a whole day together at a discounted rate for FRI, SAT, or SUN 8. One day pass + a t-shirt ($65) -Come solo dolo and get a super dope t-shirt too for FRI, SAT, or SUN 9. Soup + Shirt ($50)  -We'll eat Superior Pho together, my treat, and you'll get a dope t-shirt 10. A PAIR of TICKETS for one show of your choosing during ACF ($30) -The easiest, simplest way to help out is to just get some tickets and come with a friend. 11. COMIC SUBMISSION FEE ($15)
 -Comics wanting to take part in the fest can choose this perk then 
follow the instructions to submit their packet. Selected performers will
 stay at Cleveland Hostel. 12. A sticker ($10) -Put it on whatever you want 13. A hug ($5) -Upwards of 90 seconds (please, limit it to like a 5 second hug)
  The Impact Establishing comedy as a part of a truly great Cleveland experience is 
the ambition. Laughter is the goal. Also, probably sandwiches. The Accidental Comedy Fest and other Accidental productions have helped Cleveland establish itself as an emerging comedy scene. Comedy is an art form that helps bring the community together, similar to sports without all of the sweating and sadness. There's still probably some sadness, but it's witty. 
Over the years, performers who have come to Cleveland have left with a completely different impression and narrative for the city than before they came.  That is a powerful thing. Entering the 5th year of this endeavor, approaching over 100 alumni that left feeling great about Cleveland. Many of whom are becoming movers and shakers in their respective scenes. 
The goal through ACF and other Accidental Comedy productions is to continue proving Cleveland is a relevant location for stand up comedy, and to connect comedy with the narrative and experience of Cleveland in a similar way that Second City is ingrained in the Chicago experience.
  Risks & ChallengesIf this campaign does not hit it's goal, the outcome could be devastating:-Jimmie Graham will begin to slowly transition to Slam Poetry-Brian Kenny will stop trying to control his diabetes and could probably lose a foot-Mary Santora will immediately become a mother-John Bruton will spearhead the reformation of the WNBA team Cleveland Rockers-Ramon Rivas will burn all of his Cleveland related t-shirts, forcing him to roam the streets naked and afraid.-Comics who plan on coming to Cleveland will think we are weak and non-fun
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Buying individual tickets for shows and planning to attend helps a lot! Visit Mahall's 20 Lanes website at http://www.mahalls20lanes.com after the indiegogo ends to purchase individual show tickets (which will include service charges! Gross!)
 Spread the word! Let folks know they should be getting excited for this very great weekend of stand up comedy.
Volunteer! From September 11-13 we will need a lot of help transporting performers, ushering audience members during shows, ambassadoring artists around Cleveland, DJ's and more. Email info@accidentalcomedy.com to offer assistance.

story:
Hi all, my name is Barry Duffield. I'm an actor, screenwriter, and graphic novelist. Some of you may know me as Lugo from the TV series Spartacus: Blood and Sand, D.I Dave Woods from Shortland Street, Koryak from Xena, Kazankis from Hercules, or Kevin Rydell from Street legal, many roles but just one easy going guy.

My first graphic novel Deadman's Land has received some pretty impressive critical acclaim and become a quarter finalist in the prestigious Final Draft Big Break and Scriptapalooza screenwriting competitions. I've been hard at work on my follow up graphic novel 'Tandoori Apocalypse'. Issue #1: Bombay Rounding. It has been completed and is a perk on this campaign. Now it's time to launch into issue #2, #3, and #4 of the series and I need your help in getting there.

Tandoori Apocalypse is above all a horror/comedy thrill ride, but it is also a look at the diverse society we live in; with it's two Hindu anti-heroes. It was important for me to tell this story outside of the stereotypical hero archetypes. I'd like to thank my friends Raj and Tarun for opening my eyes to a different world. Without you guys I may have never started this journey.

Each and every contribution you amazing people give will see the fruition of a dream built over decades, so in advance, I thank you from the bottom of my heart. 

  • I need $21,300 to get the artwork, colouring, and lettering completed. 
  • You guys will not only get issue #1, #2, #3, and #4 of the digital graphic novel 'Tandoori Apocalypse', but you'll also get a digital copy of my five star rated graphic novel 'Deadman's Land', and exclusive cover art from both novels.
  • Every dollar raised will go toward the final three issues. 

  • EVERY CONTRIBUTOR WILL GET A THANK YOU CREDIT IN THE NEXT ISSUES!


  • Tandoori Apocalypse celebrates cultural diversity in a unique and fun way. You will fall in love with the wanna-be romantic Raj and the big hearted clutz Vimal, you will laugh and cry at the antics of the other survivors stuck in the corner store only days before the Earths inevitable fall to a Vampire plague.
  • Richard Taylor (Weta Studios) had this to say about my previous graphic novel 'Deadman's Land' "An inventive, blood-soaked horror show; begging to be made into a live action film" ~ Sir Richard Taylor
  • When you decide to help; your decision changes a life for the better.


  • There are always inherant risks when you undertake creative endevours, but I have faced these and overcome them before - This time will be no different..
  • There are no problems; only solutions. With your help I shall succeed in bringing issue #2, #3, and #4 to life.


  • *  If you can't help financially a share would be greatly appreciated.

    •    *  Please use the Indiegogo "share tools" to get the word out.

story:
Who We Are:

Duality: What We Become is a coming of age story about four friends who all wake up one day after having the same dream, realise they have been granted amazing gifts. But what will they become?

The book is written by R. Glenn Atkinson and drawn by Warren Muzak.  We also have multiple guest artists, including  local up and coming artist Moya Ferrigno, Missy Hamilton from Miramichi, Carmen Cameron from Halifax, Moncton's own Veronick Roy, Andre Boulard, David Coates and Kraig Nicol. John Gannon from Dayton, Ohio and Anthony Pugh from Brooklyn, New York! Special guest Matt Mehana of the band I Set My Friends On Fire will also be contributing some guest art for the finished product! Some of the guest art will be shared at the launch of the campaign, some will be released periodically during the campaign and some will be saved until the release of the book! 

It is loosely based off of a story that I wrote in high school that really stuck with me and I felt needed to be perfected and shared! 

This campaign would make a world of difference for us to get this book out to be shared with the public. Self funding this project is just not an option at this time and I would hate to see that hold back something that we are passionate about. 

Our main goal is to put out a story that we love and that we feel you will love as well. 

Donations and Perks:

In order to make this book happen we need to bring in at least 2000$ to cover the bare costs of printing, promoting and releasing this book.

We are offering many great perks in exchange for your generous donations including copies of the book, original artwork, producers credits, a chance to have yourself drawn into the book and many more! 

Backers in the Greater Moncton area can contact us at dualitycomics@gmail.com to set up a local delivery once everything is printed! All other backers will be able to submit a shipping address.

The first person to donate as well as the first person to donate 30$ or more will receive something special along with their order! (If the first person to donate donates at least 30$ the NEXT person to donate 30$ or more will receive something special with their order!)

As well, all backers will all be forever immortalized in book one with your name proudly listed in our thank you section!

If we don't reach our full goal of at least 2000$ your donations won't be wasted, they will be pooled together and used towards the production of the book all the same while we acquire the rest of the funds.

However, if we exceed our goal of 2000$ there will be some extra incentives added in!

2500$ 
All tiers will be upgraded to receive a group print (excluding pdf tier. Print tiers will receive a copy of the book.)! 

3000$
A new print will be created and added to everyone's order (excluding pdf tier)!

3500$
We will be able to manufacture a set of buttons to be available for purchase! As well all orders will include said buttons (Excluding pdf tier)!

4000$
All orders will include an all new variant cover (excluding pdf tier)!

Risks and Challenges:

Of course with this type of venture there are obstacles that we would need to overcome in order to make this a success. The largest of those being the funding which you amazing people have a huge hand in helping us overcome!  

There are also things like gaining an audience which we hope to achieve through our enthusiastic promotion and dedication to a project that we truly believe in. 

Other Ways You Could Help!:

Of course not everybody is able to donate, but you can show your support all the same by sharing our campaign around to people you feel would be interested in such a thing! You can share easily through the social media buttons on this page or through copying the link!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The latest expected release date is May 2016, deliveries of perks will be made as soon as possible, expected to be at latest March/April 2016. Updates on more specific delivery time frames will be given once product is manufactured as different things will be finished at different times.

You can find us on Facebook at:

 https://www.facebook.com/duality.whatwebecome

Or on Twitter at:

 https://twitter.com/Duality_Comics 

Thank you all so much for your interest and support!

This is our group print as mentioned in the 10$ perk drawn by our artist Warren Muzak!

This is the variant group print as mentioned in the 10$ perk drawn by Warren Muzak!




Our "Dualitee" t-shirt!

Page 2! (Unlettered)

Page 3! (Unlettered)

Sketches for an upcoming page done by our artist Warren Muzak!

Concepts for 2 of the 3 Ancient Beings by our own Warren Muzak!

These head shots are the first ever drawings of our characters! Drawn by guest artist Carmen Cameron! In order (Left to right, top to bottom) are: Dean Michaels, Christian Elias, Issac Milcrest, Jenna Greenwood, Collin Banks and Kimmy Fahn!

Here is a pin up of one of our secondary protagonists Jenna Greenwood and her beagle Oscar drawn by guest artist John Gannon! Jenna has the power of zoopathy which allows her to communicate with animals and control their will through touch!


Here is a pin up of one of our secondary protagonists for the series Kimmy Fahn drawn by up and coming Moncton local artist Moya Ferrigno! Kimmy has the power of elemental manipulation!

Pin up of our main protagonist Dean Michaels drawn by our artist Warren Muzak! Dean has the power of speed. 

Pin up of one of our secondary protagonists Jenna Greenwood and her beagle Oscar drawn by our artist Warren Muzak! 

Pin up of our main antagonist Christian Elias drawn by our artist Warren Muzak! Christian has the power of flight!

Pin up of one of our secondary antagonists Issac Milcrest drawn by our artist Warren Muzak! Issac is a teleporter!

story:
UPDATE: Now you can preview the story of Maccabaeus and see for yourself how awesome it is. Read the first chapter here.

Also, scroll down to see all new original Maccabaeus character art. A new hero (or villain) is being added for each day of Chanukah, so keep coming back, and follow us on Facebook!
 

Chanukah — The Festival of Light

It's one of the best known Jewish holidays, and yet, one of the least understood. (We can't even all agree on how to spell it! Hanakah? Chanukah? Channukka?!) Maccabæus, an epic retelling of the Hasmonean Revolt, will change all that. Within its pages, you will find an incredible true story of palace intrigue and holy war, of oppression, defiance, faith, and ultimately redemption.

Meet the Maccabees

Mattathias son of John is the head of the noble House of Asmoneus, and a descendant of the Biblical Aaron, brother of Moses. He and his sons are kohanim (priests), spiritual leaders whose role in Ancient Israel revolved around the Temple in Jerusalem, which represented the very heart and soul of Jewish life.

Standing at the crossroads of Europe, Africa, and Asia, the Land of Israel was conquered and reconquered time and again over the centuries. In the days of the Maccabees, Judea had just fallen under the dominion of the Seleucids, the Syrian-Greek Empire. While the Greeks were usually magnanimous towards the nations they conquered and tolerant of their religions and customs, the Israelites, with their unwavering faith in a singular, incorporeal God, were an exception.  Under the Seleucid occupation, idols were erected throughout the land, and practices central to Jewish spirituality (e.g. keeping the Sabbath, studying the Torah, and the covenant of circumcision) were outlawed on pain of death. As this artist's rendering of events illustrates, Mattathias didn't take the news very well.

In a brazen act of defiance, Mattathias struck down a Greek envoy and a Jewish collaborator by the sword, and sparked an uprising that, under the leadership of his sons, particularly Yehudah, the Judas Maccabaeus of legend, led to the liberation of Jerusalem, the miraculous re-dedication of the Temple (of which Chanukah is a celebration), and the restoration of Jewish sovereignty in their homeland.


About Me

Hi there! My name is Daniel, and I'm a freelance writer from Brooklyn with a B.A. in Middle Eastern history. Once upon a time, I was editor of a local newspaper called the Jewish Voice, and since that time my work, which includes op-eds, hard news, and occasionally fun stuff like this article on Aish HaTorah about the hidden Jewish elements of the Star Wars universe, has appeared in dozens of newspapers, magazines, and online media in both in the U.S. and Israel.

Project Maccabaeus was originally conceived as a blockbuster action movie, and it currently exists in the form of a screenplay. Fun fact: If you don't have connections in the film industry and/or millions of dollars, it is difficult bordering on impossible to get a movie made. Undaunted by reality (Maccabæus is the story of a miracle, after all), I began showing my spec script to colleagues and friends, and I kept hearing the same thing: This would be a crazy awesome graphic novel. It didn't take long for me to realize how right they were. I mean, just look at that battle scene up top. Is that not the most badass thing you've ever seen? And how many of today's great action films (like "300," or as I call it, "Spartan Maccabæus") started out as graphic novels? That said, even if the story of the Maccabees never makes it to the big screen (or even worse, if it makes it to the big screen and is produced and directed by Mel Gibson), this is a book that deserves to be made. If nothing else, it'll make for the coolest Chanukah gift ever. But it is also my hope that the story will serve as a source of inspiration, especially to Jewish youngsters out there who are made to feel ashamed of who they are and where they come from. It really is one of our people's most fascinating, controversial, and exciting stories--and considering we're the same people who gave the world The Bible, that's really saying something!

This is our second attempt to fund Project Maccabæus, which is why the video says coming Chanukah 2016. (We were featured in the Jewish Press last year, the first time around. Check it out and learn more about the project!)  If we raise the necessary funds this time, the book will be ready in time for Chanukah of next year. A year ago on Kickstarter (you can see the original campaign here) we raised nearly half of what we needed in pledges. But since Kickstarter is all or nothing, we received nothing. That kind of uncompromising attitude is good when you're waging a guerilla war for freedom like the Maccabees did. For getting a book made? Not so much. So this time around, we're leaving our options open.

If we reach our goal of $10,000, we'll be able to complete revisions to the script, produce the necessary artwork, and produce a limited edition printing of the graphic novel. If we get halfway there ($5,000), I'll be able to commission Maccabæus as an e-book. Even if we don't reach either goal, we'll still be able to promote the project, entering the script into creative writing competitions, marketing it to publishers and so on. Second fun fact: An earlier draft of Maccabæus made the quarterfinals of the 2015 Courier Awards. So I've got that going for me, which is nice.

And hey, you never know. Project Maccabæus could go viral this time around and raise millions. If it does, we'll publish the book and start working on the film. (I can dream, can't I?)

Bottom line: Anything you contribute to Project Maccabæus can and will be used to move the story forward. And the more we put into it as a community, the more we'll all get out of it. At the very least, you can be guaranteed a copy of the original screenplay--which will no doubt become a collector's item once Maccabæus the Motion Picture sweeps the 2021 Oscars. And if we achieve our funding goals, you can have your own copy of the greatest Jewish graphic novel yet to be made, all in time for next Chanukah.

*Note regarding the perks: To be 100% clear, only items that are guaranteed at the moment are the original screenplay and the commentary. The Maccabæus graphic novel e-book is contingent on us raising enough funds to commission the artwork, roughly $5,000, or 50% of our campaign goal. To actually publish a limited run of the book in hardcopy, we have to meet or exceed our $10,000 goal. If we raise just shy of 50%, or somewhere between 50 and 100%, we'll work out some sort of "consolation prize" for our backers, like signed prints, or possibly commissioning a smaller collection of Maccabee artwork to accompany the script. Also, all contributors entitled to receive copies of the screenplay will receive them, with God's help, within a few weeks of the end of the campaign. All the perks with estimated delivery dates of December 2017, that's just referring to the graphic novel itself.

So please, join us, and just as importantly, tell everyone!

PS: Special thanks to our friend and gentleman poet Joseph Robbins, for producing and narrating the Maccabæus trailer video. He's also the founder of the not-for-profit Artists Fighting Cancer, so go check them out.
 

Chanukah: Heroes and Villains

Artwork by Mark Strauss

Mattathias son of John, Lord of House Asmoneus
(מתתיהו בן יוחנן כהן דגול החשמונאי)

A kohen (priest) from the village of Modi'in, Mattathias is an honest, God-fearing man living under the Seleucid occupation of Judea. Political and spiritual corruption run rampant throughout the land, with the office of High Priest going to the highest bidder. When the invaders establish an idol in the heart of his hometown, inviting one of his countrymen to bring a sacrificial offering, the kindly old sage snaps. Mattathias' violent outburst against the Syrian-Greek envoy and his Jewish collaborator ignites an insurrection, pitting a ragtag band of Hebrew patriots against the vastly superior imperial army.

 

Emperor Antiochus IV Epiphanes
(Ἀντίοχος Δ΄ ὁ Ἐπιφανής)
a.k.a. "Antiochus the Mad"

Behold, the most infamous villain of the story of Hanukkah. Antiochus seized the Seleucid throne when his predecessor (whose rightful heir was at the time a Roman hostage) died under mysterious circumstances, shortly after ordering that the Temple in Jerusalem be ransacked.

His self-bestowed title "Epiphanes" means "God made manifest," but to his Jewish subjects he was known as "Epimanes," "The Madman," an apt description for the notoriously unstable tyrant. So consumed was Antiochus by his hatred of the Jews that he embarked on a campaign of vengeance that would prove disastrous for his empire, and forever shift the balance of power in Near East.


Hanna
(חנה)

At the outset of the Hasmonean Rebellion, those Jews who fled the encroachment of the Imperial Army split into two camps. Hannah and her family pitched their tent in the Negev desert. They were non-combatants, but sought to live as Jews, free from the yoke of the Seleucid government, which had declared the practice of the Jewish faith a crime punishable by death.

Before long, Antiochus' forces track down the Negev encampment. The inhabitants, refusing to fight on the Sabbath, are brutally slaughtered, including Hannah's husband. But Hannah and her sons are rounded up and brought back to Jerusalem, to be made an example of. There they are given a choice, to bend the knee before their emperor and self-proclaimed god (and thereby betray their own faith), or to stand resolute in the face of death--or worse.

 

Demetrius I Soter
(Δημήτριος Α` Σωτήρ)

Emperor Demetrius I spent his early life as a political hostage in Rome. In ancient times, it was common practice among governments to hand over custody of some of their own people (even members of royal families) as a sign of good faith, and ensure the keeping of peace agreements.

Demetrius was the son of Antiochus' predecessor Seleucus IV, and therefore rightful heir to the throne. An utterly debauched sociopath from his upbringing in a gilded cage, the Roman Senate has no desire to see Demetrius claim the Syrian throne. But there are those within the Syrian military leadership who felt Antiochus is leading them on the path to ruin, and that anyone with a claim to the throne would be the lesser of two evils.

They were wrong.


Simon the Wise
(שמעון התרסי)

Simon is the second oldest son of Mattathias, and a born leader. Most people are more familiar with his brother Judah, whose heroic deeds on the battlefield were the stuff of legend. Simon was also courageous but perhaps more level-headed; his surname "Thassi" can be translated roughly to "wise one," "guide," or "man of counsel." As such, he was chosen by his father to serve as the political leader of the Maccabean movement. Simon would go on to become prince of the Hasmonean Dynasty, establishing the first sovereign Jewish state in over four centuries--and the last one before the founding of Israel some 2,000 years later.


Yose son of Yoezer
(יוסי בן יועזר)

Yose ben Yoezer is spiritual leader of the an esoteric (one might say "kabbalistic") sect, the Hasideans, known also as the "mighty men of Israel." The Hasidean Order are the keepers of many secrets, among them a form of martial art said to go back all the way to the Biblical Patriarchs, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. After word gets out of Mattathias' act of defiance, Yose and his disciples seek out the Maccabee rebels and join their ranks, bringing with them knowledge of forging weapons and armor, their archery skills, as well as their system of hand-to-hand combat.
 

Alcimus (Elyakum) the High Priest
(Ἄλκιμος / אליקום)

Sometimes, our own worst enemy comes from within. Alcimus, seen here bestowing his "blessing," was a Seleucid collaborator (a "Hellenizer") whose cruelty and lust for power rivaled that of any of the foreign occupiers.

When Demetrius comes to power, Alcimus swears his undying allegiance (and a hefty sum of gold) to the newly-coronated tyrant in exchange for the office of High Priest, which he swears he will use to crush the rebellion once and for all.

In our telling of the story, Alcimus' father is the first victim of the Hasmonean Revolt, giving him an added personal vendetta against the sons of Mattathias. He is also the nephew of Yose ben Yoezer. That second part is historically accurate. The master of the Hasidean brotherhood--a key ally of the Maccabees, and the traitorous pretender to the high priesthood, were uncle and nephew.


To his people: Judah the Hammer, of House Asmoneus
(יהודה המכבי)

To the Empire: Judas who is called Maccabaeus
(Ιούδας ο Μακκαβαίος)

Yehudah ben Mattityahu--Judah son of Mattathias, is the eponymous hero of our tale. He led the Hasmonean Uprising, wherein a vastly outmatched band of Hebrew patriots fought off one of the ancient world's great superpowers, reclaiming sovereignty over their ancient homeland and rededicating the Holy Temple in Jerusalem. Those miraculous events are commemorated even today in the annual Festival of Light, Chanukah (from the Hebrew word for "dedication").

Here, we see Judah rallying the remnant of the Maccabee rebel army before a decisive engagement against Seleucid forces at Beth Horon. "Victory standeth not in the multitude of a host," he declares, "but strength cometh from heaven!"

He concludes with his people's battle cry: "Am Yisrael ḥai!" ("The Nation of Israel lives!") And the Maccabees roar back in unison: "Od Avinu ḥai!" (Our Father yet lives!)
story_txt:
UPDATE: Now you can preview the story of Maccabaeus and see for yourself how awesome it is. Read the first chapter here.Also, scroll down to see all new original Maccabaeus character art. A new hero (or villain) is being added for each day of Chanukah, so keep coming back, and follow us on Facebook! 
Chanukah — The Festival of Light
It's one of the best known Jewish holidays, and yet, one of the least understood. (We can't even all agree on how to spell it! Hanakah? Chanukah? Channukka?!) Maccabæus, an epic retelling of the Hasmonean Revolt, will change all that. Within its pages, you will find an incredible true story of palace intrigue and holy war, of oppression, defiance, faith, and ultimately redemption.Meet the Maccabees

Mattathias son of John is the head of the noble House of Asmoneus, and a descendant of the Biblical Aaron, brother of Moses. He and his sons are kohanim (priests), spiritual leaders whose role in Ancient Israel revolved around the Temple in Jerusalem, which represented the very heart and soul of Jewish life.Standing at the crossroads of Europe, Africa, and Asia, the Land of Israel was conquered and reconquered time and again over the centuries. In the days of the Maccabees, Judea had just fallen under the dominion of the Seleucids, the Syrian-Greek Empire. While the Greeks were usually magnanimous towards the nations they conquered and tolerant of their religions and customs, the Israelites, with their unwavering faith in a singular, incorporeal God, were an exception.  Under the Seleucid occupation, idols were erected throughout the land, and practices central to Jewish spirituality (e.g. keeping the Sabbath, studying the Torah, and the covenant of circumcision) were outlawed on pain of death. As this artist's rendering of events illustrates, Mattathias didn't take the news very well.In a brazen act of defiance, Mattathias struck down a Greek envoy and a Jewish collaborator by the sword, and sparked an uprising that, under the leadership of his sons, particularly Yehudah, the Judas Maccabaeus of legend, led to the liberation of Jerusalem, the miraculous re-dedication of the Temple (of which Chanukah is a celebration), and the restoration of Jewish sovereignty in their homeland.
About MeHi there! My name is Daniel, and I'm a freelance writer from Brooklyn with a B.A. in Middle Eastern history. Once upon a time, I was editor of a local newspaper called the Jewish Voice, and since that time my work, which includes op-eds, hard news, and occasionally fun stuff like this article on Aish HaTorah about the hidden Jewish elements of the Star Wars universe, has appeared in dozens of newspapers, magazines, and online media in both in the U.S. and Israel.Project Maccabaeus was originally conceived as a blockbuster action movie, and it currently exists in the form of a screenplay. Fun fact: If you don't have connections in the film industry and/or millions of dollars, it is difficult bordering on impossible to get a movie made. Undaunted by reality (Maccabæus is the story of a miracle, after all), I began showing my spec script to colleagues and friends, and I kept hearing the same thing: This would be a crazy awesome graphic novel. It didn't take long for me to realize how right they were. I mean, just look at that battle scene up top. Is that not the most badass thing you've ever seen? And how many of today's great action films (like "300," or as I call it, "Spartan Maccabæus") started out as graphic novels? That said, even if the story of the Maccabees never makes it to the big screen (or even worse, if it makes it to the big screen and is produced and directed by Mel Gibson), this is a book that deserves to be made. If nothing else, it'll make for the coolest Chanukah gift ever. But it is also my hope that the story will serve as a source of inspiration, especially to Jewish youngsters out there who are made to feel ashamed of who they are and where they come from. It really is one of our people's most fascinating, controversial, and exciting stories--and considering we're the same people who gave the world The Bible, that's really saying something!This is our second attempt to fund Project Maccabæus, which is why the video says coming Chanukah 2016. (We were featured in the Jewish Press last year, the first time around. Check it out and learn more about the project!)  If we raise the necessary funds this time, the book will be ready in time for Chanukah of next year. A year ago on Kickstarter (you can see the original campaign here) we raised nearly half of what we needed in pledges. But since Kickstarter is all or nothing, we received nothing. That kind of uncompromising attitude is good when you're waging a guerilla war for freedom like the Maccabees did. For getting a book made? Not so much. So this time around, we're leaving our options open.If we reach our goal of $10,000, we'll be able to complete revisions to the script, produce the necessary artwork, and produce a limited edition printing of the graphic novel. If we get halfway there ($5,000), I'll be able to commission Maccabæus as an e-book. Even if we don't reach either goal, we'll still be able to promote the project, entering the script into creative writing competitions, marketing it to publishers and so on. Second fun fact: An earlier draft of Maccabæus made the quarterfinals of the 2015 Courier Awards. So I've got that going for me, which is nice.And hey, you never know. Project Maccabæus could go viral this time around and raise millions. If it does, we'll publish the book and start working on the film. (I can dream, can't I?)Bottom line: Anything you contribute to Project Maccabæus can and will be used to move the story forward. And the more we put into it as a community, the more we'll all get out of it. At the very least, you can be guaranteed a copy of the original screenplay--which will no doubt become a collector's item once Maccabæus the Motion Picture sweeps the 2021 Oscars. And if we achieve our funding goals, you can have your own copy of the greatest Jewish graphic novel yet to be made, all in time for next Chanukah.*Note regarding the perks: To be 100% clear, only items that are guaranteed at the moment are the original screenplay and the commentary. The Maccabæus graphic novel e-book is contingent on us raising enough funds to commission the artwork, roughly $5,000, or 50% of our campaign goal. To actually publish a limited run of the book in hardcopy, we have to meet or exceed our $10,000 goal. If we raise just shy of 50%, or somewhere between 50 and 100%, we'll work out some sort of "consolation prize" for our backers, like signed prints, or possibly commissioning a smaller collection of Maccabee artwork to accompany the script. Also, all contributors entitled to receive copies of the screenplay will receive them, with God's help, within a few weeks of the end of the campaign. All the perks with estimated delivery dates of December 2017, that's just referring to the graphic novel itself.So please, join us, and just as importantly, tell everyone!PS: Special thanks to our friend and gentleman poet Joseph Robbins, for producing and narrating the Maccabæus trailer video. He's also the founder of the not-for-profit Artists Fighting Cancer, so go check them out. Chanukah: Heroes and VillainsArtwork by Mark StraussMattathias son of John, Lord of House Asmoneus(מתתיהו בן יוחנן כהן דגול החשמונאי)A kohen (priest) from the village of Modi'in, Mattathias is an honest, God-fearing man living under the Seleucid occupation of Judea. Political and spiritual corruption run rampant throughout the land, with the office of High Priest going to the highest bidder. When the invaders establish an idol in the heart of his hometown, inviting one of his countrymen to bring a sacrificial offering, the kindly old sage snaps. Mattathias' violent outburst against the Syrian-Greek envoy and his Jewish collaborator ignites an insurrection, pitting a ragtag band of Hebrew patriots against the vastly superior imperial army. Emperor Antiochus IV Epiphanes(Ἀντίοχος Δ΄ ὁ Ἐπιφανής)a.k.a. "Antiochus the Mad"Behold, the most infamous villain of the story of Hanukkah. Antiochus seized the Seleucid throne when his predecessor (whose rightful heir was at the time a Roman hostage) died under mysterious circumstances, shortly after ordering that the Temple in Jerusalem be ransacked.His self-bestowed title "Epiphanes" means "God made manifest," but to his Jewish subjects he was known as "Epimanes," "The Madman," an apt description for the notoriously unstable tyrant. So consumed was Antiochus by his hatred of the Jews that he embarked on a campaign of vengeance that would prove disastrous for his empire, and forever shift the balance of power in Near East.Hanna(חנה)At the outset of the Hasmonean Rebellion, those Jews who fled the encroachment of the Imperial Army split into two camps. Hannah and her family pitched their tent in the Negev desert. They were non-combatants, but sought to live as Jews, free from the yoke of the Seleucid government, which had declared the practice of the Jewish faith a crime punishable by death.Before long, Antiochus' forces track down the Negev encampment. The inhabitants, refusing to fight on the Sabbath, are brutally slaughtered, including Hannah's husband. But Hannah and her sons are rounded up and brought back to Jerusalem, to be made an example of. There they are given a choice, to bend the knee before their emperor and self-proclaimed god (and thereby betray their own faith), or to stand resolute in the face of death--or worse. Demetrius I Soter(Δημήτριος Α` Σωτήρ)Emperor Demetrius I spent his early life as a political hostage in Rome. In ancient times, it was common practice among governments to hand over custody of some of their own people (even members of royal families) as a sign of good faith, and ensure the keeping of peace agreements.Demetrius was the son of Antiochus' predecessor Seleucus IV, and therefore rightful heir to the throne. An utterly debauched sociopath from his upbringing in a gilded cage, the Roman Senate has no desire to see Demetrius claim the Syrian throne. But there are those within the Syrian military leadership who felt Antiochus is leading them on the path to ruin, and that anyone with a claim to the throne would be the lesser of two evils.They were wrong.Simon the Wise(שמעון התרסי)Simon is the second oldest son of Mattathias, and a born leader. Most people are more familiar with his brother Judah, whose heroic deeds on the battlefield were the stuff of legend. Simon was also courageous but perhaps more level-headed; his surname "Thassi" can be translated roughly to "wise one," "guide," or "man of counsel." As such, he was chosen by his father to serve as the political leader of the Maccabean movement. Simon would go on to become prince of the Hasmonean Dynasty, establishing the first sovereign Jewish state in over four centuries--and the last one before the founding of Israel some 2,000 years later.Yose son of Yoezer(יוסי בן יועזר)Yose ben Yoezer is spiritual leader of the an esoteric (one might say "kabbalistic") sect, the Hasideans, known also as the "mighty men of Israel." The Hasidean Order are the keepers of many secrets, among them a form of martial art said to go back all the way to the Biblical Patriarchs, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. After word gets out of Mattathias' act of defiance, Yose and his disciples seek out the Maccabee rebels and join their ranks, bringing with them knowledge of forging weapons and armor, their archery skills, as well as their system of hand-to-hand combat. Alcimus (Elyakum) the High Priest(Ἄλκιμος / אליקום)Sometimes, our own worst enemy comes from within. Alcimus, seen here bestowing his "blessing," was a Seleucid collaborator (a "Hellenizer") whose cruelty and lust for power rivaled that of any of the foreign occupiers.When Demetrius comes to power, Alcimus swears his undying allegiance (and a hefty sum of gold) to the newly-coronated tyrant in exchange for the office of High Priest, which he swears he will use to crush the rebellion once and for all.In our telling of the story, Alcimus' father is the first victim of the Hasmonean Revolt, giving him an added personal vendetta against the sons of Mattathias. He is also the nephew of Yose ben Yoezer. That second part is historically accurate. The master of the Hasidean brotherhood--a key ally of the Maccabees, and the traitorous pretender to the high priesthood, were uncle and nephew.To his people: Judah the Hammer, of House Asmoneus(יהודה המכבי)To the Empire: Judas who is called Maccabaeus(Ιούδας ο Μακκαβαίος)Yehudah ben Mattityahu--Judah son of Mattathias, is the eponymous hero of our tale. He led the Hasmonean Uprising, wherein a vastly outmatched band of Hebrew patriots fought off one of the ancient world's great superpowers, reclaiming sovereignty over their ancient homeland and rededicating the Holy Temple in Jerusalem. Those miraculous events are commemorated even today in the annual Festival of Light, Chanukah (from the Hebrew word for "dedication").Here, we see Judah rallying the remnant of the Maccabee rebel army before a decisive engagement against Seleucid forces at Beth Horon. "Victory standeth not in the multitude of a host," he declares, "but strength cometh from heaven!"He concludes with his people's battle cry: "Am Yisrael ḥai!" ("The Nation of Israel lives!") And the Maccabees roar back in unison: "Od Avinu ḥai!" (Our Father yet lives!)

story:
the projekt goes on! go to >> facebook.com/senzaconfinietnograficnovel/

*****(italiano e bio sotto)*****(bio in english below)

Senza Confini is the project of a book – an "etnographicnovel" – written and drawn. It comes out from the urgence to tell stories about contemporary nomadism.

Francesca Cogni and Andrea Staid, after 10 years of research and work, melt now their different approaches to social research. Francesca is a videomaker and painter, Andrea is an anthropologist and ethnograph. They started a dialogue where their two research practises melt down and hibrydate themselves. And most of all, they try to experiment a new way to tell to the reader both experiences of researchers and migrants of the new millenium.

We want to start a crouwdfunding campain to stay indipendent.

With this campain we want to cover the production costs (materials, trips, workshops costs, translations...) and part of the drawing and writing work.

We want to find than a publisher, who can distribute the book also in networks that are not already interested in this topic. We would like to use the potential done by drawing, with a special focus on young generations and schools.

We will also organize presentations in Italy and Germany.

The book will be released with a Creative Commons licence.


SENZA CONFINI:

A painter from Congo, setteled in Milan, who dreams and paints Africa; a Gambian journalist, asylum seekers in Italy, activist, co-founder of the African Refugees Union and reporter of refugees' movement in Berlin; a Turkish militant, escaped from jail and tourtures made by a despotic governement; a “double refugee” with a Palestinian background, born Syrian, escaped in Berlin; an American rapper born in Buffalo, grew up in Florida, migrated to California, then to Italy, then to Berlin, who sings the margins of western society; a Romanian girl, volunteering in a Refugees-home in Milan...

A net of stories, interconnections, transnational meetings where texts would not be able to tell us its richness and complexity.

For that reason we decided to experiment another kind of tale, wide and polimorphic: a mix of ethnographic writing and drawings, pictures, frames of our experience “in the field”.

What we tried to do as researchers was to go out from categories, buid by dominant élites: “migrant”, “refugee”, “clandestin”...

We want to deconstruct these categories, because we believe that it is very important in order to understand that we are all humans, beyond cultural, ethnical and biological differencies.

In this “ethnographicnovel” an important focus is about “migrant cosmopolitism”: all the languages spoken by migrants who never studied in the institutional, official educational system but learnt the languages in the street.

We mostly worked on two cities, Milan and Berlin, where we found similarities and differences. What is always the same, is the Lymbus, the eternal waiting and the boredom as part of the daily life of migrants: the impossibility of working  waiting for the asylum status, for example, forced to a daily annihilation.

The deprivation of possibility of “making” is another aspect we wanted to highlight: we understood that many of migrant's riot against the “Fortress Europe”, doesn't ask only for a paper, but they claim the possibility of acting, “making” in order not to be stuck for months, years without any possibility of changing their situation.

In fact, we met many forms of daily resistance, - on a small and wide scale -, political self-organisation, attempts to speak in “first person”, to claim rights, to find strategies and paths to get out of the “Refugee” label and become finally a person.

In this book we don't want to tell just “facts”. For us, it was very important to share political ideas and discussions about emancipation, future and imaginary with the women and men that we met – not forcing them to a frontal interview about the past, the trip or the tragic experience.

We listened, talked, ate, drank, wrote and recorded; shared stories, worked, walked together, drawn and ask them to draw memories, dreams and desires.

We told each other our life, but most of all we imagined together the possibility of a better future, a world where the only stranger would be discrimination and racism.

ps. we support and share this Manifesto:  http://riserefugee.org/10-things-you-need-to-consider-if-you-are-an-artist-not-of-the-refugee-and-asylum-seeker-community-looking-to-work-with-our-community/

************************************************************************
************************************************************************

Senza confini è il progetto di un libro – una "etnographicnovel" – scritto e disegnato, che nasce dall’esigenza di raccontare storie del nomadismo contemporaneo.

Francesca Cogni e Andrea Staid dopo quasi dieci anni di lavoro si sono incontrati con i loro due differenti approcci alla ricerca sociale. Una videomaker e disegnatrice l’altro antropologo ed etnografo hanno cominciato a dialogare ibridando i due approcci alla ricerca, ma soprattutto si sono impegnati per trovare un modo innovativo di restituire al lettore l’esperienza del ricercatore e quella vissuta dai migranti del nuovo millennio.

Vogliamo fare una campagna di crowdfunding per restare indipendenti.

Con questa campagna di crowdfounding vogliamo coprire i costi di produzione del lavoro (materiali, viaggi, costi dei laboratori che stiamo facendo per la ricerca, traduzioni...) e parte delle ore di lavoro di disegno e scrittura.

Vogliamo poi cercare un editore per il progetto, in modo da distribuirlo in circuiti diversi da quelli già interessati al tema, sfruttando anche il potenziale dato dall'uso del disegno, con una particolare attenzione ad adolescenti e alle scuole. Verranno organizzare presentazioni in Italia e Germania.

Il lavoro sarà rilasciato con licenza Creative Commons.


SENZA CONFINI:

Un pittore congolese che sogna l'Africa dalla periferia di Milano; un giornalista gambiano rifugiato politico in Italia, attivista e fondatore del African Refugees Union e reporter del movimento dei rifugiati a Berlino; un militante turco scappato dal carcere e dalle torture di un governo autoritario; un “rifugiato al quadrato” palestinese di famiglia, siriano di nascita, berlinese per necessità; una rapper americana nata a Buffalo, cresciuta in Florida, emigrata in California, poi in Italia e ora a Berlino che con i suoi testi racconta i margini della società occidentale; una ragazza rumena, che fa la volontaria in un casa del rifugiato a Milano...

Una ragnatela di storie, interconnessioni, incontri transnazionali dove la sola forma scritta non sarebbe riuscita a renderne la complessità e la ricchezza. Per questo abbiamo deciso di sperimentare una tipologia di racconto ampia e polimorfa, che ibrida una scrittura etnografica con disegni, foto e frame dell’esperienza vissuta in prima persona sul campo.

Un impegno che ci siamo posti come ricercatori è stato quello di provare a uscire dalle categorie costruite dalle elités dominanti: migranti, rifugiati, clandestini...

Abbiamo voluto nel nostro lavoro decostruire queste categorie perché crediamo che sia una importante tappa per comprendere che siamo tutti umani al di là delle appartenenze e differenze culturali, etniche e biologiche.

In questa “etnographicnovel” c’è un importante focus sul fenomeno del cosmopolitismo migrante, ovvero di tutte quelle lingue parlate dai migranti che non hanno studiato in scuole ufficiali ma hanno appreso il loro saperi nella scuola della strada.

Ci siamo concentrati soprattutto su due città, Milano e Berlino, dove abbiamo riscontrato similitudini e differenze, ma una cosa che ci ha colpito è lo stato di limbo, l’attesa, l'incertezza, la noia come parte integrante dell’esperienza di un migrante, l’impossibilità di lavorare nell’attesa del permesso di soggiorno, per esempio, che porta a uno stato di annichilimento giornaliero.

La privazione della sfera del “fare” è un altro aspetto importante da sottolineare: ci siamo resi conto che molte delle lotte dei migranti scaturite dalla non accettazione della legislazione della “fortezza Europa”, non rivendicano soltanto una carta, un permesso, ma rivendicano la possibilità di agire, di “fare” per non rimanere mesi, anni parcheggiati nell’impossibilità di cambiare la propria situazione.

Abbiamo infatti incontrato tante forme di resistenza quotidiana su piccola e grande scala, auto-organizzazione politica, tentativi di raccontarsi in prima persona, rivendicare i propri diritti, trovare strategie e percorsi per uscire dall'etichetta di “rifugiato” e poter essere finalmente una persona.

Il nostro lavoro non vuole solo narrare i fatti, ci è sembrato importante condividere con le donne e gli uomini incontrati racconti sulle possibilità politiche di emancipazione e gli immaginari in costruzione invece di costringerli ad interviste frontali sul loro passato, il viaggio e la loro esperienza tragica.

Abbiamo ascoltato, parlato, mangiato, bevuto, scritto e registrato; scambiato storie, lavorato, camminato insieme, disegnato e chiesto loro di disegnare ricordi, sogni e desideri.

Oltre a raccontare i vissuti abbiamo immaginato una possibilità di avvenire migliore, un mondo nuovo dove l'unico straniero diventi la discriminazione e il razzismo.

ps. seguiamo e diffondiamo questo Manifesto:  http://riserefugee.org/10-things-you-need-to-co...



who we are

Andrea Staid professor of cultural anthropology at NABA ( new academy of beautiful arts), editor of the publishing house Eleuthera, collaborates with various newspapers. He is the author of The arditi del popolo  (The first Editions, 2007), anthropology of new slavery (Agency X, 2011), Wretched of the metropolis. Ethnographies migrants on the borders of legality (milieu 2014), I Without State. Power, economy and debt in primitive societies. (Bebert, 2015)

Francesca Cogni, video maker and illustrator. I work with drawing, video and animation to produce experimental documentations of places, intimate stories and political topics. Drawing is used as a tool to investigate, create relations, share. The researches and the collected stories become movies, books, series of drawings.
I'm mostly working on migration and asylum, languages, ecology, self-production and self-organization.
I work in parallel in social and educational projects (workshops, lectures, screenings, discussions), where video and drawings are used as collective tools to think and work together.
I work alone and with anthropologists, artists, social workers, musicians, architects…
zebrablu.wordpress.com // vimeo.com/frensis/videos

******************************************************

chi siamo

Andrea Staid è docente di antropologia culturale e di teoria e metodo dei mass media presso la NABA, redattore della casa editrice Elèuthera e collaboratore di numerose testate giornalistiche. Autore di: I dannati della metropoli (Milieu, 2014), Gli arditi del popolo (Edizioni La Fiaccola, 2007-Milieu 2015), Le nostre braccia. Meticciato e antropologia della nuova schiavitù (Agenzia x, 2011) e de I Senza Stato (Bebèrt, 2015).

Francesca Cogni, videomaker e disegnatrice. Con il disegno, il video e l'animazione indaga sui luoghi, gli abitanti, i percorsi e le tematiche della contemporaneità. Il disegno diventa uno strumento di osservazione, di documentazione della realtà e di scambio. Le storie raccolte diventano film, serie di disegni, piccoli libri autoprodotti…
Negli ultimi anni la sua ricerca prevalente riguarda le migrazioni, le lingue, la diversità culturale e la sostenibilità.
La ricerca artistica è accompagnata e nutrita da progetti educativi in ambito prevalentemente sociale (laboratori, corsi, lezioni…), dove il video e il disegno diventano strumenti collettivi per confrontarsi, riflettere, raccontare la realtà e raccontarsi.
Lavora da sola e con antropologi, artisti, danzatori, musicisti, architetti.
zebrablu.wordpress.com // vimeo.com/frensis/videos
