story:
Howdy Ho Folks! We are Red Panda Studio, an independent design studio in Colombia who wants to geek out and make a living from it! We have done several projects seeking to fulfill this dream but certainly the most ambitious one is the Reset project. Inspired by the 80's movies and cartoons, time travel and factual science! Simon (co-founder of Red Panda Studio) created Fots, a character from the future whose powers come from technology, so advanced and beyond our knowledge that is perceived as magic or superpowers by people in the present.

Fots gets stuck in the past by accident, and being disconnected from his natural environment, begins to experience a series of problems affecting his "powers" and slowly starts to die. With the help of two characters out of the ordinary, a homeless child named Tomás and a young pastry called Juno with dreams of becoming a famous Jazz singer, Fots will discover that the past has much more to offer than he imagines, and it will begin a race against time to get back to the future before it's too late!

 

The story begins in a distant future, hundreds of years after the revolution of the 7 colors, as it is called in historical records, when a group of radical idealists discovers that in the world exists the technology capable of solving mankind's problems and promote peace.This group of radicals decided to create and detonate a technological bomb thus ending hunger, diseases, inequality and humanity as we know it. By merging humans with machines, they created a new species with amazing abilities. These beings are known as the Nova, they live in peace and harmony while keeping the balance on planet Earth and exploring the universe to unveil the mysteries of existence, until an accident occurs and one of them is transported to the past, where disconnected from their natural environment starts to die …

So it begins the story and  the adventures of Fots, a Nova stuck in the past, a homeless child (Tomas) and a young singer (Juno), trying to find a way to send Fots back when he came from before it is too late for him and the future he knows …

 

Fots is the hero of the story, and his job is to catalogue and explore the earth. Fots is always looking for new territories,  exploring  caves, waterfalls, rivers, mountains, deserts, etc. Any inhospitable terrain, with some historical value or traces of a past civilization raises Fots’s curiosity.

Powers:  

  • Flight
  • Cromokinesis: project tangible images and videos (like Green Lantern but in technicolor)
  • Telepathy: communicate telepathically with other living things
  • Telekinesis: move objects with his "mind"
  • Psychokinesis: ability to transform matter
  • Energy Blast: generate energy pulses
  • Plasma Blast: generate plasma beams.
  • His Clothing and hair are holograms.

Age: 250 years / Height: 83 cm / Weight: 55kg / Projected Age: 17 years / Projected Height: 170cm / Screened Weight: 65kg / Favorite Food: Chocolate and Guacamole / Fear: clowns / his projected image is always levitating 15 cm from the ground

WIVs are the Nova's fellows and they follow them from birth, storing their memories and experiences. WIVs are amorphous beings with big heads and without arms or legs. They shift shape as needed.

Age: 250 / Height: 40 cm / Weight: 2kg / Favorite Food: 120 volts / Fear: Electromagnetic Pulse / They only work in a range less than 10 km from any Nova.

Dylan Tomás Guevara Arango is a homeless kid who dreams of changing the world. His life is harsh and sad so he’s always in a struggle to see goodness in people. He's a charismatic and funny kid, pretty handy and mentally quick but disparaged for being a street child. He is a perfectionist, creative, skilled and capable of great things. He hates his name and asked to be called only Tomas. He is the one who gives Fots his name and image because he remembers him of his favorite cartoon character. His favorite food is nachos with chicken, which eats rarely because he has no money to buy them. By helping Fots, Tomás will realize that he can have great friends and people to trust and eventually he will change the world in ways that he can't imagine...

Age: 7 years (at the beginning of the series) / Height: 80cm / Weight: 20kg / Favorite Food: Nachos with Chicken / Fear: his boss and piranhas / only has a pair of worn shoes, two shirts and one pant.

Juno is a young girl who works in a bakery, but her real dream is to be a famous Jazz singer. She’s generous and unselfish, always looking after others and helping whenever she can. Although she appears to be extroverted and friendly,  she’s a lonely and depressed person that lives in a small apartment with her cat. Juno is Fots's first true friend, and somehow feels the responsibility to help him find his way back home. She will become Fots's guide in the present and will always seek new adventures to share with him. Helping Fots to return home will become a way for Juno to fulfill her own dreams ...

Age: 16 years / Height: 155cm / Weight: 50kg / Favorite Food: Ajiaco / Fear: Spiders / Changes clothes constantly / she has 17 pairs of shoes and 15 glasses.

The Vante-KX are the Void Novas. Their task is maintaining the balance of the species over the planet. When Fots goes back to the past leaves a portal open behind, and eventually the Vante-KX find this portal. Back in the past The Vante-KX see humans as a species out of control and immediately try to correct this "error" by wiping them out, without noticing how they're changing the future....

The main story is told in three seasons compiled in six 40-page comics. Each season is more exciting than the one before, and has stranger and complex characters as well as new stories of time travel and parallel realities. Volume One is just the beginning of the story and tells the adventures of Fots trying to get back to the future with the help of his friends ...

 

Red Panda Studio:

Simon Vergel is the creator of Reset and main artist. He is responsible for the concept of character and history. His experience as a toy designer and concept designer for children's equipment have shaped this project.
https://www.linkedin.com/in/simon-vergel-44855869

Nicolas Ojeda is the co-founder of Red Panda Studio, besides helping with illustration and image correction, his work is essential to keep Red Panda Studio working
https://www.linkedin.com/in/nicolas-ojeda-villa...

Even Though we would like to do all the work, we can't do everything! so we are supported by a team of experts writers and illustrators.

Go Up Comics is the publisher who works with us on this project. With its long experience in comic books development and incredible team of artists and writers we've been able to keep this project going.

Check out more their job, it’s awesome!

http://www.goup-comics.com

 

The series has potential, we have planned two more seasons and we want to continue telling stories if you like them …In volumes two and three, Fots discovers how to travel freely through time and returns to visit his friends at different times and dates, thus triggering different stories each time he travels to the past.

 

As we said before, this is just the beginning of history, we have many things planned and saved in case we get the answer we seek and if you like our comics, many many more will come, is a promise!

together we can create an entire universe!! We just need your support to make this dream come true.

 

What we need and what you get

Making comic books for living is not easy, even though our moms believe in us and give us food, we still need to pay taxes, on top of that to tell good stories we need a dedicated and talented team.

 

How we will use the resources?

Most of the budget will be used in the production of comics.

54% of the budget will be used in the development of comic, illustrators, writers and the lady who brings the coffee to work nonstop and deliver this project as soon as possible!

21% will be used to print the first two comics series!

20% Perks sweet and amazing Perks! this project makes us happy, but it is for you and the perks are how to thank you for your cooperation!

The last 5% is business stuff! a percentage that goes to Indiegogo for... well business stuff!

 

If we don't get money from the goal, the resources will be used in the production of comics to fulfill the most important rewards.

The Impact

In Colombia, the comic book industry is still small, although every year there are more and more fans and readers, we still have a long way ahead. We want to inspire new generations of Colombian artists to pursue their dreams as we have done. But perhaps most importantly, we want to change the idea of the future we have. We are tired of seeing a chaotic future, where the world is ripped off and humanity has come to destruction!

We strongly believe in a positive future where we will live in community with our planet! Through this series of comics we want to show the harsh reality we live in, not only in Colombia but the entire world, and we want to show that we can change things if we work together! we're still in time to change the future and this is what Reset is all about! 

Risks and Challenges

The main challenge we have is time. Although we estimated dates, these may vary because we depend on many external factors. Another possible risk is comic printing, unfortunately we live in a country where many productive aspects depend on the change in dollar's price, which strongly affects our economy and therefore production prices. As for the challenges we face, we are a small independent team, and although we work with experts and awesome artists who know the comics industry, we know that may be problems when carrying out the project. The way to address these eventualities is hard and constant work.

If is there is something we can guarantee is that we are awesome workers, committed and responsible. In the coming months we will work tirelessly to bring this project forward, not only because it is a commitment to you, but because it's what we love! This is a dream that we have pursued for a long time and be assured that we are giving our 100% to make this possible, even against all odds.

Other ways you can help

We know that there isn't always money to fund projects in development, however there are many ways you can help!

You can help us share this campaign!

Tell your friends and share on social networks! someone else might be interested in helping us. The more people know about this project the higher are the chances of turning this into a reality.

Check out our website!

http://www.redpandastudio.com.co/

Check and share our videos!

Follow us on youtube, we really like toys too and we have lots of content about that.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ9qsIpBUiEurY...

We really want to thank you for taking the time to read all this and help us fulfill this dream!

story:
Origin Story  

 There is a serious lack of girl's clothing centered around the geekery of our favorite fantasy worlds and comic books, and it is from that void that The Tiny Bat was created. Though there are far more accessible clothing options for the little comic and space fans out there then there were in my day, nine out of ten times they are so overtly "girly" that they just aren't fun...well no more! 

The Tiny Bat is a handmade children’s clothing line for every geek girl in the making. We aim bring the fantastical side of geek culture into every piece we create from the party dresses to our very own line of Little Sidekicks. So grab your Sonic Screwdrivers and hop in those invisible jets, because it’s time to bring the dark side to your little fangirl’s wardrobe!


Investors Assemble! 

Every hero has to start somewhere. A madman needs his blue box, a good vigilante needs her mask, a princess needs her blaster, and we need supplies of our own! The Tiny Bat is 100% handmade from unique materials found by our creative team. All funding will go directly into building our vast supply of fabrics, notions, original art work, and charming packing supplies. 

We hope to reach $1,000 as our start up, but anything above that would be fantastic! Our goal will allow a full company launch; above that will allow us to expand our lines and allow us to look into more selling options. Though we do accept the galactic credit standard, federation credits, cubits, galleons, and bells, Earth money is much appreciated! 


The clothing line these girls deserve 

Isn't it time that girls have the chance to fly their geek flags just as high as any boy? Little girls may love ruffles, pastels, and sparkles but they also love having a choice. Most caped crusaders don't flourish emblems of pinks and purples, so why should little girls have to simply because it's "girly"? Moreover, why should they only have the choice of a tee shirt with their favorite comic and literary characters? The Tiny Bat offers these girls a choice, and more importantly offers a cute and stylish choice. 
 

Allons-y! 

"Do you know what is the greatest gift anyone can receive in his lifetime? The greatest gift we can receive is to have the chance, just once in our lives, to make a difference. Do you understand how many times you made a difference? Enough for a hundred lifetimes." - Doctor Strange

Give this clothing line a chance, give these girls a chance, and help us get on our feet! Every dollar counts, and every share on your social media counts; so please help in any way you can! There are also some fun tokens of our gratitude for those who help us reach our monetary goal! We are also offering a special fabric pattern created by one of our fabulous artist to show our appreciation for anyone who donates, even if it's just a dollar!

story:
THE SERIES PREMISE

Walter Malone is a comic book series that follows the exploits and endeavors of Walter Malone: a detective who is also a watermelon. It is both a parody and a tribute to all of my favorite protagonists. It's full of classic film noir tropes and clichés, and is riddled with horrible puns. It's silly while still being gritty, and brooding, and full of pulp... pun intended.


THE PLOT

Walter Malone: A Dame To Peel For is the first installment of the Walter Malone comic book series. 

When the love of his life, a prostitute named Clementine, is found peeled to death in her apartment, Walter Malone seeks retribution. Working off the books, and becoming obsessed with the case, Police Captain Q. Cumber assigns a new partner to Malone, a banana by the name of Potassium Jones. As a natural born lone-wolf, Malone is reluctant to partner up with anyone, especially this rookie banana. But Potassium Jones proves his worth, and together the two team up to hunt down Clementine's killer.


THE BACKSTORY

I (Michael Lorusso) wrote the comic while John Ho illustrated it. John Ho and I have been friends since high-school. We have always bonded over comic books (and nerdy things in general), and have always talked about making an original comic book together. After numerous years of brainstorming and countless ideas, we finally settled on making, and completed Walter Malone: A Dame To Peel For, our first ever comic book. It's both an homage to, and a parody of, all of our favorite movies/books/heroes; from Batman to Sin City, from Casablanca to Escape From New York, the Walter Malone comic book series encompasses the essence of all our favorite stuff and uses humanized food as a vessel to express our love for said "stuff".

It started out as a joke between the two of us and was really just an outlet for making horrible puns. But as we worked on the book, we fell more and more in love with the world, as well as the characters within it, and decided to turn it into an on-going series, with the next two installments coming later this year.


THE GOAL

The comic book is currently available in digital format, but nothing would bring us more joy than to hold a tangible copy of it in our hands... that would be the ultimate reward for us. As the comic book is already complete, all we are looking to do is fund an official printing of it. We plan to raise enough funds to print about 500 copies. This will allow us to supply our supporters with copies, as well as have a a good amount left over with which we can take with us to conventions and such to get our work out there and to hopefully gather a following/fanbase for the book, as we do plan on keeping it going as a series.

This is a passion project for us. Dividing all the work (writing, drawing, planning, inking, text, editing, etc.) is a hefty work-load for two people, but that's how much we love this project. We never went in with the intention of making money off of this, hence why we have a free digital copy available online. Going into this project, all we wanted was to see it all come to fruition and to, hopefully, get our work noticed; having a print copy is crucial for that.


READ IT!

If you would like to check out the digital copy of the comic book to help you decide whether or not you'll be interested in contributing , you can read it for free by clicking HERE.


PERKS

Below are photos of the perks. Some perks have already been made, while the higher rewards will be made upon reaching our goal. For those, we have made some mock-ups of what the final product will look like. Slight variances may occur with those high perk items, as the images below are meant to be used as a reference, and not as an exact display of the finished product.

We never went in with the intention of making money off of this, hence why we have a free digital copy available online. Going into this project, all we wanted was to see it all come to fruition and to, hopefully, get our work noticed; having a print copy is crucial for that.READ IT!If you would like to check out the digital copy of the comic book to help you decide whether or not you'll be interested in contributing , you can read it for free by clicking HERE.PERKSBelow are photos of the perks. Some perks have already been made, while the higher rewards will be made upon reaching our goal. For those, we have made some mock-ups of what the final product will look like. Slight variances may occur with those high perk items, as the images below are meant to be used as a reference, and not as an exact display of the finished product.

story:
Corpseblaster is an epic, action-packed, macabre comic book series and needs YOUR help to rise from the grave. Only donators can get issue #1 of Corpseblaster!  The first issue  will be a limited run and won't be printed again.

  • 24 pages of greasy, grimy undead vanquishment
  • Appropriately inappropriate vulgarity
  • Absurd happenings
  • Over the top pulp horror and action
  • A couple of goofs and/or gags
  • An original bodacious saga (not another reboot or remake..sorry)


OH YEAH, A big thank you for helping support this project. I had a ton of fun creating Corpseblaster this year and I hope you love it as much as I do.  Hard work and a heck of a lot of hours went into making this a reality.  Writing, illustrating, and sharing Corpseblaster was a great way for me to express myself artistically in a zany way.  He's an agent for the Grim Reaper and he's returned to do the impossible.  He's going to reverse the end of the world no matter the cost, and restore the balance between life and death.  I want to give a special thanks to INFERI for letting me use their awesome music.

In addition to self publishing,  100% of donations will cover the costs of printing, shipping, and production.  If the project is successful, there are plans to create a video game prototype too!  Not too many details on this yet as I'm still creating most of the 3d game art, but it will absolutely feature a single player story mode/online multiplayer game mode.   See you all in Spare City!

ESTIMATED SHIP DATE :  Q-1 2016

Check out the free online prologue: CORPSEBLASTER

story:
Hello all from Limitless comics.

My name is Anthony Moore.

Limitless comics is a Boston based company that specialize in creating the best fantasy comics possible. I have been creating fantasy stories and art for over three decades. I'm in the process of putting out my first flagship comic book Realms. This is a 12 issue maxi series that set place in a epic fantasy universe.  The Realms, A young boy who is the ruler of the Realms, but do to his loss of memory in the first battle, he has no recollection of who he is and what transpired in the past war. Now Ulislum the wizard from the Realm of harvest must find away to not only help him in remembering who he is but prepare him for the second coming of Emberge the undying. This massive beast of unimaginative power has set his sights on finishing the job he started. Not only ruling the Realms but destroying all who defy this majestic beast of chaos. Now the wizard has 1 year our earth time to gather as many of the broken, the weak and upstarts to rise to the challenge of this threatening Menace that's that's quickly returning. Witches, Demi gods, Dragons and many more will join forces in the knock down drag out battle that's so epic, it's going to take 12 issues to tell the tale.

The book is 80% finished, but due to low funding I'm looking to gather the rest of the money to complete this awesome fantasy tale.

Here's where you come in. I have already complete the posters for this amazing comic book. 5 posters with the character a that will be in the pages of Realms are layed out on these beautiful 12x18 full glossy heavy stock posters. Drawn by yours truely and painted my the very talented Mr Rudy Ao. What I'm doing is putting these posters up for pledgers to purchase and help me to finish my comicbook. I have only three pledge levels that I hope you will find to your liking. And if you would like to purchase this amazing comic book is will also be available in one of the pledges. 

I would really like to thank each and everyone who took the time to view my campaign. I have put my life into the company so I can bring you fantasy that will leave you limitless.

Now on to what I need to complete this comic book.

500 dollars would be more than enough to not only complete but add more art but to start on coloring number two of this comic.

there's no risk because the posters are 100% completed and waiting for you.

story:
Dear Potential Contributors,

Here's the link where I'm singing the whole song: https://youtu.be/cWpFhKtl7Wo 

And here's the link to the beginning of the animation: https://youtu.be/e7AmZJhL2_k

The animation will be offered to Jewish Federations, Jewish film festivals, temples, Jewish schools, and any non-Jewish groups who want to screen it.

As a comedian/musician I was musical director for 14 Comedy Channel shows and one Showtime Special. As an instrumentalist I play percussion, piano, guitar, Japanese shakuhachi flute, trumpet and shofar. I have a world beat music band. We play "Zen Jazz" which sounds like African, Japanese, Jewish, Latin, Caribbean Bebop. I've produced four music CD's, two comedy CD's and written a book called "The Complete Book of Everything, Part 1, Second Edition." It's a collection of comedy monologues. My soon to be published autobiography is called, "The Joy of Suffering." My one man show, "The Reluctant Jew," was staged at various theaters in Los Angeles and got rave reviews. I've done comedy and played music in temples, prisons, nightclubs, retirement homes, weddings, AA & NA conventions, and one briss.

A few months ago, at a comedy show in temple, I was the opening act for comedian Mark Schiff. Afterwards, he emailed me and wrote, “I loved your set. You have one of the most Jewish acts I’ve ever seen. I respect you going out so openly and singing and talking about the great parts of being a Jew. I’m so glad I got to see you work.”

All the money contributed to this campaign will pay to complete the animation and provide  distribution.

I’m grateful my life led me to write “If There Weren’t Any Jews,” and, with your help, I can make the animated version a success.

Thank you for your contributions!

story:
Echoes of Mutiny is a very rough translation of "Ghadar Di Goonj," the early revolutionary literature of Sikh resistance fighters during the British occupation. This compilation of poetry and war-cries gave rise to generations of revolutionaries that died fighting for the establishment of Khalsa Raj. 

Echoes of Mutiny is the story of a group of revolutionaries trying to fight off and rid the Indian Sub-Continent of the British Occupation. Having occupied most of the region, the Panjab remains one of the last pockets of resistance left. 

We're introduced to this group as they try to recover a lost piece of steam-power technology which they think can help destroy the British and help them reclaim their land. But, having to reconcile the emerging threats of the Brahmin Hindus colluding with the British as they try to cleverly implode the Sikhs from within, the Sikh revolutionaries are in for a long and bloody battle. 

About Myself.

Over the last 10 years I've worked on short films and documentaries, all of which cover the deeply traumatic and embattled history of the Sikh community. We don't have it easy, we never have. Resistance and struggle have always been what defines our existence, so it's no surprise that these would inspire my creative work. 

What We Need 

When I started this project, the last thing I wanted to do is cut corners. We see that a lot and it has a lasting affect for young people looking for creative inspiration. I wanted each page to be captivating and in order to achieve that I know I had to put the right team together. 

We're looking to raise 30k to help bring this book together. This will pay for the art necessary to complete the book: pencil and ink, colouring and lastly, lettering. 

The Book

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can give money and there's nothing wrong with that, so there's other ways you can support this project: 

  • Share on your social media!
  • Guilt trip your friends and family into supporting it! 
  • Anything you can think of to help further this project will go a long way!

We're introduced to this group as they try to recover a lost piece of steam-power technology which they think can help destroy the British and help them reclaim their land. But, having to reconcile the emerging threats of the Brahmin Hindus colluding with the British as they try to cleverly implode the Sikhs from within, the Sikh revolutionaries are in for a long and bloody battle. 
About Myself.
Over the last 10 years I've worked on short films and documentaries, all of which cover the deeply traumatic and embattled history of the Sikh community. We don't have it easy, we never have. Resistance and struggle have always been what defines our existence, so it's no surprise that these would inspire my creative work. 
What We Need 

When I started this project, the last thing I wanted to do is cut corners. We see that a lot and it has a lasting affect for young people looking for creative inspiration. I wanted each page to be captivating and in order to achieve that I know I had to put the right team together. 
We're looking to raise 30k to help bring this book together. This will pay for the art necessary to complete the book: pencil and ink, colouring and lastly, lettering. 
The Book
 






 
Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can give money and there's nothing wrong with that, so there's other ways you can support this project: 

Share on your social media!
Guilt trip your friends and family into supporting it! 
Anything you can think of to help further this project will go a long way!

story:
MINDS OF MY OWN -  

Who we are...

My name is Brian Conoley and I am crazy about comics. 

Ever since I could look at a picture I have devoured sequential art in a frenzy that has fuelled my imagination and filled my book shelves. From spandex clad heroes, to crime noir-pulp  & indie love tales, there is not a genre I have left behind.

I am excited to give back to the medium that has given me so many endless hours of joy.  Mel and I, we, are so excited to show you our story...and boy, it's a doozy. 

My talented illustrator,Melissa and I are trying to raise funds to create and print the first issues of a series we are creating titled: Minds of My Own. The story is thrilling, the art is amazing and we are really proud of our progress thus far. 

Every donation of just five dollars or more will get you a copy of Minds of My Own: Issue 1.  We invite you along for the ride. 

Here's the pitch: Jeremy Kane was a normal, caring boy, being raised by two loving parents; but, after witnessing a traumatic event near his tenth birthday, Jeremy becomes afflicted with Dissociative Identity Disorder (formerly: Multiple Personality Disorder).This is a coping mechanism the brain rarely creates when faced with severe trauma. Jeremy's affliction manifests as a serial killer, born within his own conscious mind, hungry for control.   

After years of being tormented by this tragic disorder, struggling to keep the monster growing inside of him at bay, Jeremy is forced to live his life inside of mental institutions and prisons. Despite years of therapy, isolation and medication, Jeremy can't stop his alternate personality from claiming the lives of three innocent people. His third murder lands him on death row. Jeremy is given a lethal injection and his fight against himself, is ended.

BUT THIS STORY STARTS WHEN JEREMY'S HEART STARTS BEATING AGAIN..!

Fifteen minutes after receiving his lethal injection, Jeremy wakes back up with his original personality, in full control of his mind, for the first time almost fifteen years. The killer that was inside controlling him, is apparently gone. Confused, horrified, and in a state of shock, Jeremy manages to escape from the prison morgue and finds his way to the city’s largest homeless shelter, Clark Hill. As Jeremy gets used to living again, his biggest challenge will be to learn to live with what he has done and pave his own road towards a sense of redemption.

I know, heavy.

I have been telling stories since I could wag my tongue, it is in my blood and my purest source of joy. I am pretty sure Melissa was born with a pencil in her hand and an angel whispering in her ear to "go find some paper". We are asking for your interest and help in telling this story.
With this initial wave of funding, we aim to build our audience and amass enough resources to publish issues 1, 2 & 3. Through our Indiegogo Campaign you can pre order digital and print copies of Issue #1, along with a lot of great swag and collector perk packages. This is a great opportunity to get your own piece of Melissa's beautiful art on your walls at home. 
With issues 1, 2 &3 completed, we will start to approach every comic book publisher in the known universe, see what options we may have to push our story even further: or continue self publishing if that seems to align better with our vision and direction for Minds of My Own. 


When I first put out the call looking for an illustrator I kept my hope very close to my chest, not wanting to dream too big or too loud in case nothing ever came  of it. After the serendipitous wave of events that crashed down upon me in a matter of weeks, I realized that hope is better served shouted from the rooftops than kept to one's self. 

Thank you so much for reading, backing and believing in a story as wild as Jeremy's yarn we are trying to spin here.  We promise, we won't let you down.

B&M

story:
Short Summary

My name is Stephen Hamilton and I am a painter, illustrator and arts educator from Boston Massachusetts.

  • Itan: Part 1 is a graphic novel that is based on the oral literature traditions of the Yoruba people of West Africa. The comic is heavily influenced by Yoruba art and aesthetics, combining traditional West african textile and sculpture traditions with western painting and illustration. Drawing directly from Ifa, the vast corpus of divination poetry used by the followers of the Yoruba Orisa traditions worldwide (as well as other Yoruba verbal arts) I am relaying important narratives rooted in African thought.  
  • People, especially young people want to see themselves in the world, especially in the media that they ingest.  Lack of representation is an serious issue for people of color especially youth. The absence of our narratives in both media and academia contributes to lack of sense of self, and place.  Itan addresses that problem by relaying these important narratives through comics ,an art form that is accessible both physically and conceptually. It is meant to highlight  the often ignored and underrepresented narratives of Africa and the Diaspora through intriguing stories rooted in African thought and aesthetics. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for 250 early adopters to preorder the comic, which is set for completion in November 2017. A total of $5000 is needed to print and distribute a 500 copy run of the graphic novel
  • A $30 investment will earn you a signed copy of the graphic novel along with a 4 pack set of limited edition promotional postcards
  • A $50 Investment will earn you a signed copy of the of the graphic novel, with a 4 pack set of limited edition promotional postcards and a limited edition 18"x24" Promotional poster 
  • A $1000 Investment will  earn you a signed copy of the graphic novel along with a 4 pack set of limited edition promotional postcards, a limited edition 18"x24" promotional poster as well as a signed, framed original hand painted panel from Itan: part 1. 
  • If the goal is not reached all funds will still go towards the comic and will be saved until printing costs can be covered.

The Impact

  • This graphic novel is my way of creating and highlighting empowering narratives created by and depicting people of African descent.  As an artist and educator it is my mission to use my work and teaching praxis to address and help eradicate issues of internalized and institutionalized racism. This graphic novel is a manifestation of that mission. I hope to depict the beauty, complexity and perseverance of one of the richest and most influential, philosophical traditions in Africa, one that survived the horrors of the slave trade and colonialism. This book is meant to be testament to the power, endurance and depth African thought and aesthetics.
  • I was the 2015-2016 Arts Connect International artist in residence. During that time I had the opportunity to learning the traditional weaving, woodcarving and dyeing traditions that I am incorporating into this book at The Nike Centers For Art And Culture In Lagos, Osogbo and Ogidi-Ijumu. I also had the opportunity the learn more about Ifa and other Yoruba religious traditions from members of the West African Orisa tradition in Osogbo. During that time I completed a series of large scale paintings utilizing the same techniques I am using to create Itan: Part 1 , a selection of which can be viewed at www.itanproject.com.  The work from this residency was then exhibited  at the Museum of The Center of African American Artists in Boston, MA.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is  the time and effort it will take to complete the comic. I am creating and incorporating, woodcarving, weaving and dyeing arts into the comic book illustrations. This non traditional comic art technique will require more time and effort to complete. However it is of the utmost importance that I highlight these traditional arts along with these narratives to create a unique piece of sequential art, best representing the Yoruba aesthetic and cultural corpus.   

  • I have 8+ years experience as a professional artists and will do anything in my power to complete this project, which has ben many years in the making.
  • Each chapter of the graphic novel is carefully planned , and I have been careful to calculate and arrange my schedule around a November release date. Although it will be tight I am sure I will complete the project and have it in your hands in November.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute be sure to spread the word!

  • Spread the word by sharing the link to this Indigogo campaign! Be sure to use the #itanpart1 #itancomic hashtags!
  • Be sure to follow Itan: Part 1 on Facebook! and follow my blog dedicated to this and other projects dedicated to African art and aesthetics as a means for cultural empowerment at www.itanproject.tumblr.com!

Thank You

Each chapter of the graphic novel is carefully planned , and I have been careful to calculate and arrange my schedule around a November release date. Although it will be tight I am sure I will complete the project and have it in your hands in November.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute be sure to spread the word!

Spread the word by sharing the link to this Indigogo campaign! Be sure to use the #itanpart1 #itancomic hashtags!

Thank You

story:
Our BIGGEST book ever—in more ways than one! 

Following up successful campaigns for P. CRAIG RUSSELL'S JUNGLE BOOK AND OTHER STORIES and P. CRAIG RUSSELL'S SALOME AND OTHER STORIES, we are proud to present this campaign to fund the publication of our third 12"x17" hardcover Fine Art Edition—this time for P. CRAIG RUSSELL'S THE SELFISH GIANT AND OTHER STORIES!
 



The ULTIMATE FORMAT for original art lovers!

This beautiful 12"X17" oversized hardcover features complete stories scanned from P. Craig Russell's stunning original art! While appearing to be in black & white, each page has been scanned in color to recreate as closely as possible the experience of viewing the actual original art—including blue pencils, notes, art corrections and more. Pages are reproduced at original size on heavy paper stock to provide fans, aficionados and collectors with the best possible reproductions. 

A very special ALL-WILDE edition!

The book includes the following COMPLETE stories—all classic Oscar Wilde fairy tales that have been adapted to comics by acclaimed artist P. Craig Russell:




Praise for P. Craig Russell's Fairy Tales of Oscar Wilde

"Russell's sensitive, Belle Époque-inspired artwork brings the story to life with a matched sensibility that makes other comics adaptations look clumsy."  — Publishers Weekly

"Russell matches Wilde's literary skills with his estimable artistic talent. His colors are brilliant and pure; his linework sure and fluid, at once cartoonlike and elegantly representational, reflecting both his art-nouveau and pre-Raphaelite influences and the inherent charm of Wilde's material." — Publisher's Weekly

"In elaborate underground 'comix' style, Russell reintroduces the tales with an accessible if nontraditional approach to picture-book illustration and better-than-average adaptations of the original texts." — Booklist

"Russell catches this mood perfectly, not trying to overshadow Wilde but merely helping him do his disturbing work. Russell's exquisite art has a supple ink line that's never fussy."  — Publisher's Weekly

"Russell's vivid artwork and graphic-novel style open Wilde's tragic stories to a new audience while remaining true to his thoughtful, moral prose." - School Library Journall
 

Sample pages from the book:


 

Featuring newly-restored lettering by Galen Showman

The Young King, The Remarkable Rocket, The Devoted Friend and The Nightingale and the Rose were originally lettered digitally—and separately—from P. Craig Russell's original art boards. 

For this special Fine Art Edition, we are hiring talented artist/letterer Galen Showman to hand-letter all four stories on Craig's original art board, allowing for a more enjoyable reading experience—and even more beautiful art. 

This is a major extra expense for this book, but we feel that it is worth it to properly preserve these wonderful stories for posterity.
 

Available in three different hardcover editions

  • Standard Edition
  • Signature Edition: Limited to only 100 copies that come with a bookplate that is personally signed & numbered by P. Craig Russell.
  • Sketch Edition: Limited to only 50 copies that come with the signed and numbered bookplate plus an ORIGINAL Fairy Tales of Oscar Wilde-related sketch by P. Craig Russell! Sketch Edition sketches are in pen and ink on a separate board that is approximately 8" X 5". The sketches can be kept in the book or displayed separately.

ABOVE: The pictured hand-drawn artwork is a representative example of the type of Fairy Tales-related original sketch that you might get with The Selfish Giant and Other Stories Sketch Edition. P. Craig Russell will be creating 50 uniquely different original pieces of art for the 50 Sketch Editions. The artwork you receive is one of a kind and may not exactly match the image shown in this scan, which is provided as a sample.
 

About the Artist

A graduate of the University of Cincinnati with a degree in painting, P. Craig Russell has run the gamut in comics. After establishing a name for himself at Marvel on Killraven and Dr. Strange, he went on to become one of the pioneers who opened new vistas for this underestimated field with, among other works, adaptations of operas by Mozart ("The Magic Flute"), Strauss ("Salome") and Wagner ("The Ring of the Nibelung:). Russell is also known for his graphic novel adaptations of Neil Gaiman’s MURDER MYSTERIES, CORALINE and AMERICAN GODS.


A note about Priority Mail International 

Because of their size and weight, our Fine Art Editions must ship via USPS Priority Mail to all non-US customers, which is expensive. Keep in mind that we lose a substantial percentage of what customers pay for shipping before we even see those funds due to campaign and credit card processing fees. Plus, there are additional costs for heavy-duty outer boxes, packing materials, shipping labels, etc. Because of this, we are actually partially subsiding foreign shipping ourselves because we have to make up the difference in what is lost due to those fees and the costs of shipping supplies.

That said, we greatly appreciate our foreign backers and we hope that you will understand why the international shipping is so expensive. Especially in the case of the 7+ pound Fine Art Editions, International Priority is pretty much our only option to get the books to you safely and securely.

Also, orders shipped outside of the United States will almost always be charged customs fees when they arrive. These fees may include taxes, duties, processing fees, brokerage fees, etc. We have no control over the amount or assessment of these fees. If you are not familiar with the customs laws and fees in your country, please check with your local customs office for more information.

It is possible that the delivery of your order could be delayed due to customs processing. If your order does not arrive in a reasonable amount of time, you should check with your local customs office to see if they are holding the package for payment of fees.

story:
“A work of art is the trace of a magnificent struggle.”

—Grace Hartigan, American abstract expressionist painter

Making History. Virtual History.

When Ethan Lewis, founder of Starry Sky Entertainment, first conceived of the idea to create an original English language (OEL) manga back in late 2016, it seemed like a flight of fancy. Aware of the oftentimes negative connotation surrounding international manga, Ethan wondered whether it was possible to create masterpieces of manga outside of Japan that would be taken seriously. Looking closely at the industry, he found that purists often compared the works of the great Japanese masters to vastly inferior, sub-par works. There were obviously many legendary comic book creators in the West, but at a time when international Japanese manga sales are higher than they've ever been, why weren't more artists and writers trying their hand at global manga? His upbringing richly steeped in a nerdy stew of comics, anime, manga, science-fiction and fantasy adventure, Ethan believed that if the right artistic talent could be connected to the right literary vision, it was possible to create a manga masterpiece outside of Japan in the same way that Marvel and DC comics both first built their empires. By contributing to this campaign, you'll help make history by proving it!

Welcome to Yotta

Welcome, User! Make sure your biosoft's up to date, and you'll always be solid state!

Imagine you're in the year 2025. Overpopulation and resource privation has forced mankind to cram into densely-packed micro-cities owned by big corporations, operating within governmental wards. For most ordinary citizens, food, drink, and utilitarian items are carefully rationed. The world is bleak, claustrophobic, and choking to death on its own iniquity and shame.

With alcohol and drugs nearly completely off the table as forms of recreation,The Neuropolis takes its place. Gigantic virtual reality farms where people flock from near and far to plug into a reality far better than their own, Neuropoli rise out of the shadows and dust of old-world cities like pillars of the Gods, jealously guarded by neuronet cartels and grayhosts that sell access to the Neuropolis at exorbitant rates. The police of this virtual paradise are the Waifucom Girls, avatars designed by the creators of the neuronet, Waifucom Systems. Chosen exclusively from a female pool of candidates (only one-in-one-million males can experience biosynergy with the system's core), the young women of Waifucom are international celebrities, often seen as living lives of extreme luxury, completely ignoring ration restrictions. They, unlike everyone else, are designed to be able to bend, and in some cases, break the rules if necessary to keep the system safe from netheads who get a little too rowdy within the system, or in the worse case scenario, viruses.

Shousuke Hirata was just your average half-Japanese teen living in one of the nameless tech ghettos surrounding the Fujisama Neuropolis. He, with his two friends, comprised a completely unnoticeable hacker group called The Script Kiddies. Only one day, Shousuke accidentally discovered a highly-illegal backdoor into Waifucom's quantum servers, and inadvertently triggered a cyber prophecy that could very well lead to the destruction of the neuronet itself—and everyone plugged into it. Shousuke will have to overcome all of his insecurities and find the strength within himself to save the virtual world of Yotta from a virus hellbent on a complete system crash. But first, he'll have to learn to deal with being a girl.

Plug-in and Join Yotta!

Come join us on our incredible journey in getting Yottapocalypse made by contributing money which, for the purposes of our virtual world, we'll call bytes! Every byte we receive through your contributions will help alleviate the costs of both paying our artists for all their hard work and covering the distribution end of the paperback graphic novel itself, when it is released. First, we'll show you exactly how your contributions are going to be put to best use:

Distribution Schedule

As mentioned above, the main goal of this campaign is to completely fund the release of Yottapocalypse—Level One: Installation, the first 120-page tankōbon. Every contribution we receive is guaranteed a digital, high-quality PDF of the complete book in digital format when it is complete. However, we will run this campaign progressively, meaning that as contributions roll in, we will use the money to distribute digital chapters of the book as it is made at certain perk levels. Fans and contributors will be brought aboard the journey, from storyboard-to-printed-page as the book is made, granting them early access to a wide variety of insider content, Indiegogo exclusive artwork and creator's  blog.

The softcover graphic novel will be printed by the good folks over at PrintNinja, regular printers of OEL with an extensive client list. (www.printninja.com)

Any apparel we produce will be handled by the wildly successful, indie upstart Threadbird, geniuses who make quality printing at lower quantities a reality. (www.threadbird.com)

Any paper-based merchandise we produce such as bookmarks, posters, pamphlets or scrolls will be done through the eco-friendly crew over at PrintLeaf, who offer environmentally-safe and recycled paper products for virtually any paper-based need. (www.printleaf.com)

You Give, You Get

Starry Sky Entertainment acknowledges just how much of a big deal it is that you contribute to not only making our dream a reality, but making OEL history in the process. To show you exactly how much we care and appreciate your willingness to take the journey with us, we've put together some irresistible perk packages for our contributors. Check it out!

$5 Donation (Byte Donation)—Even at the smallest contribution available, you’re still making dreams come true. Let us thank you for being part of our grand adventure by putting your name on our Thank You page, featured in both digital and print copies of Yottapocalypse!

  • Name feature on the Thank You page of both digital and print copies of Yottapocalypse—Level One: Installation complete tankōbon.
  • Name feature on our Creator’s blog.

$10 Donation (Kilobyte Donation)—If you came because you love comics and manga and you want to be a part of them, a $10 contribution will earn you a digital copy of Yottapocalypse—Level One: Installation. The digital version will be sent to you as a high quality PDF and will include all Indiegogo exclusive content.

  • Name feature on the Thank You page of both digital and print copies of Yottapocalypse—Level One: Installation complete tankōbon.
  • Name feature on our Creator’s blog.
  • PDF of the Yottapocalypse—Level One: Installation digital manga.
  • Exclusive bonus content from the Indiegogo release of the book.

$15 Donation (Megabyte Donation)—If you’re like us, then oftentimes there’s no substitute for having a printed book in your hands, running your fingertips across richly and meticulously-illustrated pages while you go on an adventure. If that’s the case, this option is for you, and includes all of the rewards for the Kilobyte Donation plus a print copy of Yottapocalypse—Level One: Installation. 

  • All of the rewards and features from the kilobyte donation package, plus:
  • A first printing of the Level One: Installation graphic novel in paperback 5" x 7.5" format featuring full-color cover by artist Indy-K.

$20 Donation (Gigabyte Donation)—For those of us who simply can’t get enough of our favorite fandom and need all the merchandise to go with it, the $20 contribution level includes everything from all the previous levels as well as official Yottapocalypse stickers, character bookmarks and high quality A4 character print of your choice.

  • All of the rewards and features from the megabyte donation package, plus:
  • Yottapocalypse stickers
  • Yottapocalypse bookmarks
  • 3x High quality A4 character prints (you select which)

$30 Donation (Terabyte Donation)—The deluxe merch package features all of the gigabyte donation package rewards as well as extra merchandise only available during our crowdfunding initiative. These include:

  • All of the rewards from the gigabyte donation package, plus:
  • High quality A4 character prints (all available prints)
  • Official Yottapocalypse mouse pad (or equivalent available merch)
  • Yottapocalypse full character poster (or equivalent available merch)

$50 Donation (Petabyte Donation)—At this level of contribution, you are truly entering the big leagues of Starry Sky Entertainment’s manga production workshop. A $50 donation will see you receive a digital copy of each chapter as it is released, storyboards, interviews, and will receive a signed copy in the first batch of full digital tankōbon when the entire four-chapter book is released and shipped. Additionally, you will receive the electronic addition of our official art book featuring page after page of high quality artwork for you to enjoy.

  • All of the rewards featured in the terabyte donation package, plus:
  • First group to receive the completed digital tankōbon chapters and production notes and extras
  • Yottapocalypse official artbook PDF (only available through this Indiegogo campaign)

$100 Donation (Exabyte Donation)—Like Shousuke himself, at this level and above you are a true hero to us, a lifelong supporter and somebody that made the dreams of so many come to life. To thank you for your support you will receive everything featured in the Petabyte donation along with a print copy of the official art book and a Team Waifucom t-shirt!

  • All of the rewards from the petabyte contribution, plus:
  • Print copy of the Yottapocalypse art book in high-quality gloss printing
  • Team Waifucom t-shirt

$250 Donation (Zettabyte Donation)—Well if you aren’t a master of VR simulations yet, you will be with a contribution of $250. With this level of donation, you will receive all of the rewards from the previous contribution levels, plus the first edition print of the graphic novel will be signed by both the comic artists and the writer, inscribed with a personal thank you message from the creator. Additionally, we will draw for you a custom high quality photo of your favorite Yottapocalypse character, just to your specifications (within reason, of course!). 

  • All of the rewards from the Exabyte contribution package, plus:
  • Signed version of the complete graphic novel (both comic artists, the writer, and the creator).
  • Custom Yottapocalypse artwork drawn by the artists themselves

$500 Donation (Yottabyte Donation)—Become a guardian yourself and get completely immersed in the world of Yottapocalypse, becoming a Waifucom Girl or a VRV (virtual reality virus) yourself! With a $500 donation, you will receive everything in the previous contribution levels plus a character you create will be featured as a minor, supporting, or background character in our actual manga! For those who want to become intimately involved in our company and our universes, this is the most absolutely awesome option for you. During the creation process, our artists and creators will communicate with you directly and figure out a reasonable way to bring your character into the adventure. In addition, your copy of the print art book will also be signed by the staff here at Starry Sky Entertainment, and we will add your name to the list of regular producers on all of our social media websites and here at our local offices as well.

  • All of the rewards from the zettabyte contribution level, plus:
  • Signed print art book
  • Your original character featured in our manga!
  • An opportunity to work directly with our artists and creators
  • Extra merchandise and bonuses
  • Premium mentions across all of our social media, interviews, book signings, and more!

So What Are the Risks?

As stated, this campaign will be flexible and progressive, continuing on until we either run out of funding or there's no identifiable interest in the book and hence no marketability. Nevertheless, Starry Sky Entertainment will ensure that the book will see both a digital and a paperback print of the 120-page book in its entirety, ensuring all artists get paid and all contributors rewarded to their satisfaction. The book will simply not continue past the first volume until we are able to secure additional funding from other means such as outside investment, however our promise is that everyone will receive a completed digital copy of the manga regardless of whether or not our goals are met, and everyone who donated $100 or more will be guaranteed a limited print of the first volume run even in the event we do not meet financial goals. Starry Sky Entertainment has already demonstrated its stake in the project by paying artist salaries, translation services, branding, graphic design and social media marketing. We will also attend several of the biggest anime conventions in the northeastern United States region (Anime Boston, Another Anime Convention, Portcon Maine, Katsucon, and Rhode Island Comiccon) where we plan to operate booths to sell the manga to further reinforce the backbone of the profit and increase market visibility.

We thank you from the bottoms of our hearts for considering contributing your hard-earned bytes to our cause, and for your desire to come make history with us! On that note, we'll leave you with one of our favorite quotes:

"More than ever before in human history, we share a common destiny. We can master it only if we face it together."

—Kofi Annan, 17th Secretary General of the United Nations

 

 

SPECIAL THANKS TO KEVIN SMITH

I'd like to take a moment to extend a very special and heartfelt thanks to American filmmaker, comic book writer, author, and podcast pioneer Kevin Smith without whom none of this would be possible. Whether it be through his prolific, diverse, and fearlessly-creative body of work, his myriad Q&A sessions and interviews, or through his books, Smith has always been the voice in my ear encouraging me to see my creative vision to a finished product. Though I'd practically grown up with many of his films, it wasn't until I read his book Tough Sh*t: Life Advice from a Fat, Lazy Slob Who Did Good  back in 2013 that really lit the fire under my backside and got me putting plans in motion and sharpening my skills to make all of this happen. Kevin has said innumerable times before, that sometimes if you want to see something out there in the world that you want to see, read, experience or enjoy, sometimes you have to go out into the world and make it yourself, because nobody is going to make it for you. These words have forever stuck with me as he helped me to find the confidence, direction, means and impetus to develop my creative abilities and business acumen to the point where I was able to make this fundraiser a reality. For all the inspiration, the drive, the perseverance, and the hope he has instilled within me, I am forever in the debt of Mr. Kevin Smith, without whom the world of Yottapocalypse would certainly not exist beyond the periphery of my own mind.
story_txt:
“A work of art is the trace of a magnificent struggle.”—Grace Hartigan, American abstract expressionist painterMaking History. Virtual History.When Ethan Lewis, founder of Starry Sky Entertainment, first conceived of the idea to create an original English language (OEL) manga back in late 2016, it seemed like a flight of fancy. Aware of the oftentimes negative connotation surrounding international manga, Ethan wondered whether it was possible to create masterpieces of manga outside of Japan that would be taken seriously. Looking closely at the industry, he found that purists often compared the works of the great Japanese masters to vastly inferior, sub-par works. There were obviously many legendary comic book creators in the West, but at a time when international Japanese manga sales are higher than they've ever been, why weren't more artists and writers trying their hand at global manga? His upbringing richly steeped in a nerdy stew of comics, anime, manga, science-fiction and fantasy adventure, Ethan believed that if the right artistic talent could be connected to the right literary vision, it was possible to create a manga masterpiece outside of Japan in the same way that Marvel and DC comics both first built their empires. By contributing to this campaign, you'll help make history by proving it!Welcome to YottaWelcome, User! Make sure your biosoft's up to date, and you'll always be solid state!Imagine you're in the year 2025. Overpopulation and resource privation has forced mankind to cram into densely-packed micro-cities owned by big corporations, operating within governmental wards. For most ordinary citizens, food, drink, and utilitarian items are carefully rationed. The world is bleak, claustrophobic, and choking to death on its own iniquity and shame.With alcohol and drugs nearly completely off the table as forms of recreation,The Neuropolis takes its place. Gigantic virtual reality farms where people flock from near and far to plug into a reality far better than their own, Neuropoli rise out of the shadows and dust of old-world cities like pillars of the Gods, jealously guarded by neuronet cartels and grayhosts that sell access to the Neuropolis at exorbitant rates. The police of this virtual paradise are the Waifucom Girls, avatars designed by the creators of the neuronet, Waifucom Systems. Chosen exclusively from a female pool of candidates (only one-in-one-million males can experience biosynergy with the system's core), the young women of Waifucom are international celebrities, often seen as living lives of extreme luxury, completely ignoring ration restrictions. They, unlike everyone else, are designed to be able to bend, and in some cases, break the rules if necessary to keep the system safe from netheads who get a little too rowdy within the system, or in the worse case scenario, viruses.Shousuke Hirata was just your average half-Japanese teen living in one of the nameless tech ghettos surrounding the Fujisama Neuropolis. He, with his two friends, comprised a completely unnoticeable hacker group called The Script Kiddies. Only one day, Shousuke accidentally discovered a highly-illegal backdoor into Waifucom's quantum servers, and inadvertently triggered a cyber prophecy that could very well lead to the destruction of the neuronet itself—and everyone plugged into it. Shousuke will have to overcome all of his insecurities and find the strength within himself to save the virtual world of Yotta from a virus hellbent on a complete system crash. But first, he'll have to learn to deal with being a girl.Plug-in and Join Yotta!Come join us on our incredible journey in getting Yottapocalypse made by contributing money which, for the purposes of our virtual world, we'll call bytes! Every byte we receive through your contributions will help alleviate the costs of both paying our artists for all their hard work and covering the distribution end of the paperback graphic novel itself, when it is released. story:
The Oswald Chronicles: My Time with Clive 1-2

As Oswald wanders through Dream, he finds himself rescuing a giant angel babe that will lead him to one of his greatest and bizarre adventures to date.

We are also offering up a chapbook (prose story) featuring a story called “What My Eyes See I Cannot Tell” where Oswald sees a face from his long lost past that drives him to speak about his time as Emperor of the Mar and his long lost love and wife, Belinda.  

llustrations for THE OSWALD CHRONICLES: “What my eyes see I cannot tell.” a 64 page illustrated chap book.  Illustrated by Daphne Lage, are available.

Note: There are only six illustrations available and it will be on a first come first serve basis, so the first person to pledge for this will have the first choice in for the illustrations and then #2, will get the second etc.

Note: These are original inks over printed blueline sketches on 300 Series Strathmore Bristol with the exception of the "Chef Oswald" piece which is an actual redline sketch inked on Strathmore 60lb Sketch paper

story:
Overview

The continuation of Iron Skies - Awakening, "Recruitment" is a 40 page comic that finds the crew of the Fallen Hope beset by pirates - and too shorthanded to manage their airship. If they want to have any chance of leaving Letka's skyport alive, they will need to find a pilot - but does the backwater town have anyone capable of taking on the challenge?

 

What We Need & What You Get

Iron Skies #2 has an incredible team putting out some gorgeous work. We've learned quite a bit about shipping and all of the behind the scenes costs and expectations from our first project and are in a much better position to deliver a quality project in a timely manner.

Risks & Challenges

Our only real risks at this point are in not funding. If we can fund, we can ship! I have a much better understanding of the costs associated with producing a comic than I had with issue 1.

 


Stretch Goals

$10,000 - Cover art done by the incredible Rob Willis!

story:
A Magical girl adventure from Tyrant comics! Now on Indiegogo!  

Starfree comic cover

Starfree is an Action/Adventure comic. Featuring Alice on her debut adventure! Now on Indiegogo! The story of a girl with god like powers! Alice will take on the forces of darkness! and even save the world!

Starfree poster

About the Author

Starfree was created by Chris Ryahn, Who also created  Tyrant, Doomtrain and The Savage Swordsman and many others! Comics that have been independently published in print in bookstores and is now available on Indiegogo. You can see more about the comics on twitter. https://twitter.com/ChrisRyahn

Alice concept artwork by Kris TJ

Reviews for Starfree! 

Comic Bastards "Starfire is a amazing and inspirational book" 

Comic book review club "I was amazed and entrained, The story is a fantasy book in the mix of Alice in Wonderland and Japanese manga,  Alice is every sexy and respectable for a heroin something that was handled well. I would give it 5 out of 5 stars”

Looking for more Artwork? You can see more on Twitter Twitter.com/Tyrantcomics 

 

Stretch goals

The campaign funding goals are set very low. help us continue Starfree!  

$1500 Starfree #2 -Locked- 

At this point we will make a second issue with Alice and it will be free for everyone who has backed the $20 and up tiers! 

- Starfree vs the world unlocked 

-More Character cards unlocked

-Plus more stuff 

$3000 Animated short -Locked-

-Starfree animated short (See more here) 

Plus more stuff. 

$5000 -Locked-

It takes a lot of money - Help us with Starfree!  

At this point the campaign would be completed but would remain open for new backers to order from. and we might even add a new goal! Based on what you want! 

Reward Tiers explained. 

When making rewards for this campaign. I wanted to make rewards that I would want to have. This campaign is not only for the Starfree comic will encompass all issues of the Studio has so far. Along with extra rewards and comics. Just ask for what comic you want and we will see what we can do! 

$5 PDF basic tier 

  • 40+ pages of comics. Sent to your email address. Others would charge over $20 dollars for this many comics! 
  • PDF copy Starfree delivered to your email address. No waiting for shipping involved.
  • Plus PDF of Epitome of A Hero. 
  • Savage Swordsman game demo. 

$10 Double PDF tier 

  • 60+ pages of comics. Sent to your email address. 
  • PDF copy of Starfree delivered to your email address no waiting for shipping involved.
  • PDF copy of the Lady Swordsman (Or a comic of your choice!) 
  • Plus PDF of Epitome of A Hero.
  • Savage Swordsman game demo. 

$15 Starfree physical copy tier 

  • 60+ pages of comics. Sent to your email address. With a physical copy shipped. And a  Starfree logo button. 
  • Get a physical copy of Starfree 
  • PDF copy of the Lady Swordsman (Or a comic of your choice!) 
  • Plus PDF of Epitome of A Hero.
  • Starfree logo button
  • Tyrant CCG Starfree playing card
  • Savage Swordsman game demo. 

$20 Starfree physical + tier 

  • 80+ pages of comics. Sent to your email address. 
  • Get a physical copy of Starfree 
  • PDF copy of the Lady Swordsman (Or a comic of your choice!) 
  • Plus PDF of Epitome of A Hero.
  • Plus PDF of Tyrant Party! 
  • Starfree logo button
  • Tyrant CCG Starfree playing card
  • Savage Swordsman game demo. 
  • Plus goals 

$25 Starfree physical signed copy tier 

  • 80+ pages of comics. Sent to your email address. 
  • Get a signed physical copy of Starfree 
  • PDF copy of the Lady Swordsman (Or a comic of your choice!) 
  • Plus PDF of Epitome of A Hero.
  • Plus PDF of Tyrant Party! 
  • Starfree logo button
  • Tyrant CCG Starfree playing card
  • Savage Swordsman game demo. 
  • Plus goals 

$50 Starfree collectors tier 

  • 100+ pages of comics. Sent to your email address.

The story of a girl with god like powers! Alice will take on the forces of darkness! and even save the world!Starfree posterAbout the AuthorStarfree was created by Chris Ryahn, Who also created  Tyrant, Doomtrain and The Savage Swordsman and many others! Comics that have been independently published in print in bookstores and is now available on Indiegogo. You can see more about the comics on twitter. https://twitter.com/ChrisRyahnAlice concept artwork by Kris TJReviews for Starfree! Comic Bastards "Starfire is a amazing and inspirational book" Comic book review club "I was amazed and entrained, The story is a fantasy book in the mix of Alice in Wonderland and Japanese manga,  Alice is every sexy and respectable for a heroin something that was handled well. I would give it 5 out of 5 stars”Looking for more Artwork? You can see more on Twitter Twitter.com/Tyrantcomics  Stretch goalsThe campaign funding goals are set very low. help us continue Starfree!  $1500 Starfree #2 -Locked- At this point we will make a second issue with Alice and it will be free for everyone who has backed the $20 and up tiers! - Starfree vs the world unlocked -More Character cards unlocked-Plus more stuff $3000 Animated short -Locked--Starfree animated short (See more here) Plus more stuff. $5000 -Locked-It takes a lot of money - Help us with Starfree!  At this point the campaign would be completed but would remain open for new backers to order from. and we might even add a new goal! story:
After successfully telling the origin story of the Drexciyans in Volume One, we continue to expand on these stories in Volume Two.  We plan a 68 to 84-page anthology that will contain several stories focusing on the continuing development of the Drexciyan world and its civilization. This novel will be the second in a series that will tell the Drexciyan storyline in its entirety. From the origin story of being cast into the ocean to five hundred years after the founding of the Drexciyan Empire and their expansion into space. 

We plan on telling at least five more stories in Volume Two. Bringing visual life to the concepts and ideas of the greatest electro group of all time, Drexciya. The story of how women slaves that were cast into the ocean and gave birth underwater to the greatest warriors and scientists ever known! The Drexciyans!

Once again we have brought together the same team of artists that worked on Volume One. In our opinion, some of the best comic artists outside of DC and Marvel. We also hope to work with such fine writers such as Dai Sato, who helped us with the first volume. We consider him to be one of the greatest writers in anime and manga. The main artist and writer being Abu Qadim Haqq. 30 year visual artist of the electronic music community. 

Having learned many lessons from the release of the first volume, we plan on improving our fulfillment and getting the novel out on time for Volume Two. Everything will be based from our headquarters in the Great Lakes region of North America. We would like to thank Tresor for shipping out the first volume. For the second volume, it will all ship from Michigan, USA.

We hope to have Volume Two completed in one year, September 2021. Please support our cause once again!

story:
The Story

 Dominic Lombardi, aka Dragon Fly, gets sucked into the criminal underworld of Baltimore when he has a chance encounter with a charismatic jazz singer named Cana. Dominic can't help to be smitten when they first meet but soon finds out the club Cana performs at is run by the local mafia that were responsible for the death of his father. The Cusanelli mob has hired a gang of dirt bikers to retrieve and bring them a mysterious metallic box. The bikers shoot up the city streets in the process and to complicate matters further, two special agents from a secret military program are after Dom and the Dragon Fly armor. Dominic has long been anticipating the day he can bring down mob boss Atano Cusanelli and free Baltimore of his criminal empire. Could that time be now or is he unprepared for a battle of this magnitude?

 

 

O.W.L. (Organic Weapons Legion) is a secret military program that was created by DARPA and the Warfighter Performance Department (code 34). O.W.L. Special Agents Reyes & Williams apprehend Dominic for interrogation. They have a special interest in the Dragon Fly armor, but why? How do they know he's Dragon Fly and will they take the armor suit away from him?

 

Dragon Fly is a 22 page full color standard sized comic book. This book is completed and will go to print in a week. We expect to have the printed copies back and ready to ship out to our backers by early May.

 

Preview Pages

 

Cover Options

Cover A by series artist Flavio Rodrigues

 

cover B by Stan Yak

 

Indiegogo Exclusive Cover

This cover features art by series artist Flavio Rodrigues and is ONLY AVAILABLE HERE ON INDIEGOGO!

 

Add these items to your comic experience!

And if you missed our other comics you can grab copies of those as well!!!

story:
Matt Guerra had no choice; they forced him into this fight. Los Valientes, the most dangerous gang in Orange County, thought he would cower at the sight of the gun, he didn't. They thought he would run away with his tail between his legs when a small, armed mob rushed to his direction, he didn't. Then, they thought he'd back down when they attacked his family. He doesn't. Now, they've awakened something deep within him, something angry, powerful, and righteous!

They've awakened....

 

What We Need & What You Get

GREAT NEWS! BOOK ONE is complete, in the bag! You're essentially contributing to first print run! There will be no need to wait a year for your copy! Imagine that? Back it today and by March of 2021 and beyond you'll receive your copy of the Ghetto Dragon Book 1: No Good Deed. Where can you go wrong?

Another upside to this campaign, there is no set goal, meaning that whomever backs a perk, you WILL receive your copy of the Ghetto Dragon NO MATTER WHAT! It's a win-win for everyone involved as it should be.

As a bonus, if you help me reach the stretch goal of 5k, I'll be able to add goodies to the perks for ALL backers (yes, this includes those who backed the PDF perk or donated to the campaign) as a token of my gratitude:

5k+ will help me produce extra small goodies like stickers, and prints of the covers by Kim Jacinto and Steven Seven, plus other goodies that may arise if you help me reach this goal.

10k+ and beyond. Damn! I wouldn't know what to add at that point. I would be forever grateful if that were to happen and definitely would think of producing  something worthwhile for all of you!

Overall, no matter what I end up with I will forever be grateful to you, the reader for helping make my dreams of being a published comics writer a reality!

The Impact

Customer satisfaction is my top priority.

I plan on delivering the product I offer you here today in a timely manner as well as in pristine condition. That's a guarantee.

Given that this is my second attempt at crowdfunding, I learned a lot about my first failed campaign. This has left a great impact on my understanding of what crowdfunding is and how it should never be taken lightly. I fully understand that I'm selling a product to you, the reader and contributor, and you deserve every bit of respect for believing in my me as a creator of a comic book story. Now, armed with the new information I've acquired, I'm ready and willing to step up to the plate to take my chance to swing the bat to hit the ball out of the park.

Help me get there!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk I face is brand recognition as well as distribution. Not many people know of my work or of my struggles to get one of my comic book projects published, let alone distributed to you. Now, it's my chance to show you what kind of skills I possess as a comic book writer as well as a publisher and distributor. At the moment, I am a one man team, but I do have volunteers ready to and willing to help me fulfill this campaign.

Make no mistake that this is a business venture and reputation is everything in the comic book game. Trust is a major factor for customer loyalty and I hope that this campaign proves my worth that I belong among the long list of creators who have delivered to their fans in the age of crowdfunding campaigns.

The road up ahead will be tough and ardous, but I'm ready to face the obstacle head on!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If The Ghetto Dragon isn't up your alley, but you know of someone who may enjoy this kind of story, please, by all means, point them to my direction!

Follow me on Twitter and You Tube for the latest updates.
