story:
And They Lived Ever After (ATLEA)

-THE BOOK-

Is “THE END” really The End? Is that all there is to the story? Once you close the book after reading your favorite fairy tales to your kids or grand-kids have you ever wondered what happens once you put the book down?

Rapunzel owns a weave salon and is the prince’s mistress, Jack is jail for breaking into the Giant’s home one too many times now he’s in jail with his girl Red Riding Hood 8 months pregnant with his child.  The Pigs and the Hunter are both being sued by wolves and that’s just the tip of the iceberg!

"And They Lived Ever After" is currently slated to be a 3 issue color 24 page fairy tale/drama for young adults and older. It will make you do a double take!  THIS IS NOT YOUR GRANDMA’S FAIRY TALE! (Go to the Extras Section for a look at some of the characters.)


What We Are Asking for & What You Get Back

We at SILVERBACK Comics are looking to raise approximately $800.00 for the printing of the 2nd issue in this amazing 3 issue series.  Your pledges also go towards paying the creative team a fair page rate for their work.

    We have some sweet rewards planned for our backers. 

    • First and foremost...the book! Whether you choose to go totally digital or old school and prefer the feel of the pages between your fingertips, you can get your hands on the next ATLEA Chapter before it's available to the rest of the world.
    • Like art? We've got you covered! We will be providing character prints to accompany your copy of ATLEA Chapter 2. Is original art more your thing? You're in luck because ATLEA artist SILVERBACK will have signed pages from the book available to a limited amount of backers!
    • Also have you always wanted to be in a comic? Now you can! A limited number of backers (1st 3) will be in the book with a major speaking role the remaining (5) will have minor roles in Issue 3.

WHY ATLEA?

  • The short answer? 

Because it’s a one of a kind page turner.

  • The long answer? 

I'm a father with a thirteen year old son named Devante. Devante loves comics, superheroes and video games. He's my heart and truth be told it’s an honor to run SILVERBACK COMICS with him.

They was a moment in time where I had 2 loves of my life before my son Devante there was my daughter Aaliyah (For who the Golden Kingdom in the story is named after) I loved her more than life itself and she was the first one to ever hear the tale of ATLEA. When she passed away my world ended and so did this story that I am now so proud of today!  I want my story, her story “OUR STORY” to live on! For every page of this story that I write and illustrate I think of my baby girl and that’s why ATLEA.

So I took all of the characters I read to her every night and put them in one drama driven world full of new off the wall situations. It's a mash-up of the goodie two shoes fairy tale characters we all grew up knowing and your typical Daytime Drama on CBS

Another reason for ATLEA to exist is that I wanted to give my son a chance to be a part of his sister’s legacy.  I wanted him to have a hand in always keeping her spirit and smile alive

That's my WHY for ATLEA. I'm hoping it resonates with you and you'll give us a chance.


Risks & Challenges

The risks are pretty low. I've run one previous successful indiegogo campaign (HELL & HOLY WATER #1) with 100% of backer rewards being fulfilled.

The only challenge was actually a lot of fun and that was finding ways for all the characters to intertwine with each other in some way shape or form.

Should an unforeseen obstacle arise (which would have to be like ARMAGEDDON since there's no other reason to not fulfill pledges) every possible action within my power will be taken to make sure backers get their rewards!


Other Ways That You Can Help ATLEA!

I understand that there are moments where some of you just aren't able to  contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help SILVERBACK COMICS to get the word out about ATLEA and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ANDTHEYLIVEDEVERAFTER

Thank You for your support!

Glaister " SILVERBACK" Ormsby

story:
The Story

A lotus blossom drifted down to rest on the frozen battlefield. Kido's breath looked like billowing smoke as he awaited at the forefront of the remaining defenders. His head was bloodied but unbowed. 

The attackers did not fear death. They charged without thought - or armor - into walls of thrusting spears, and continued their raging assault even as their lifeblood soaked the frozen ground. He had never seen anything like these Vikings. The Satsuma Shogun had fallen without their neighbors knowledge, and at first word, their rivals had considered it a blessing. It was not so. 

Kido knew that should he survive, and the Vikings be driven back, he must learn the secret to their sublime, un-heeding rage. A rage born of something so primal that all else fades behind a haze of single-minded purpose. 

For now he would rely on the discipline of the Samurai to conquer these foes - but without the Shoguns united, his thoughts were shrouded in doubt. He drew his sword and shouted for his men to plant their spears as the ground began to shake. The time for thought was over. The second wave was approaching. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Baransu is an epic story following the life of Kido Nobuyasu - a troubled samurai warrior who wants nothing more than to find peace, but can't seem to find it. 

With the Vikings invading Japan, the clash between these two warrior cultures creates a great deal of turmoil in the mind of Kido Nobuyasu. There is wisdom in both cultures that we are excited to share. 

  • Writer: Kimball Coffin
  • Artist: Sebastián Piriz

This story is intended to be a prequel to a video game sharing the name Baransu - that picks up where the story leaves off, allowing readers to assume the role of Kido Nobuyasu as he attempts to bring balance to his life through violent and vengeful means. 

What We Need & What You Get
We will be using a web based development tool to make this into a motion comic with music and sound effects. Each month, we will do our best to release a chapter with 4-8 pages of awesome moving art over the course of one year. At the end of the year, funding and development of the Baransu game will begin and the story will continue from the player's perspective. 

The funding will go toward development expenses, and paying Sebastián for his epic artwork. Backers will be given a link to the comic as soon as the first chapter is available.

Help spread the word!

Sharing this campaign with friends/social media goes a long way toward making this a reality (Look for the Indiegogo share tools on this page). We appreciate all the attention we can get! Check out our facebook page!
story_txt:
The Story
A lotus blossom drifted down to rest on the frozen battlefield. Kido's breath looked like billowing smoke as he awaited at the forefront of the remaining defenders. His head was bloodied but unbowed. 

The attackers did not fear death. They charged without thought - or armor - into walls of thrusting spears, and continued their raging assault even as their lifeblood soaked the frozen ground. He had never seen anything like these Vikings. The Satsuma Shogun had fallen without their neighbors knowledge, and at first word, their rivals had considered it a blessing. It was not so. 


Kido knew that should he survive, and the Vikings be driven back, he must learn the secret to their sublime, un-heeding rage. A rage born of something so primal that all else fades behind a haze of single-minded purpose. 

For now he would rely on the discipline of the Samurai to conquer these foes - but without the Shoguns united, his thoughts were shrouded in doubt. He drew his sword and shouted for his men to plant their spears as the ground began to shake. The time for thought was over. The second wave was approaching. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Baransu is an epic story following the life of Kido Nobuyasu - a troubled samurai warrior who wants nothing more than to find peace, but can't seem to find it. 


With the Vikings invading Japan, the clash between these two warrior cultures creates a great deal of turmoil in the mind of Kido Nobuyasu. There is wisdom in both cultures that we are excited to share. 




Writer: Kimball Coffin


Artist: Sebastián Piriz



This story is intended to be a prequel to a video game sharing the name Baransu - that picks up where the story leaves off, allowing readers to assume the role of Kido Nobuyasu as he attempts to bring balance to his life through violent and vengeful means. 


What We Need & What You Get
We will be using a web based development tool to make this into a motion comic with music and sound effects. Each month, we will do our best to release a chapter with 4-8 pages of awesome moving art over the course of one year. At the end of the year, funding and development of the Baransu game will begin and the story will continue from the player's perspective. 



The funding will go toward development expenses, and paying Sebastián for his epic artwork. Backers will be given a link to the comic as soon as the first chapter is available.
  Help spread the word!

Sharing this campaign with friends/social media goes a long way toward making this a reality (Look for the Indiegogo share tools on this page). We appreciate all the attention we can get! Check out our facebook page!

story:
CHECK OUT OUR ANIMATED SHORT FEATURING PURGE!


  

PURGE: PAST UNSPOKEN ISSUE ONE


What is the premise of the story?

In Purge: Past Unspoken, Purge comes face to face with his questionable past and the hidden truths that lie within the city he protects.  Overwhelming odds mount, when a genetic agent is created with the potential to eliminate two tenths of the world's population.  With the fate of the world at stake, and a clandestine group bent on his demise, unsavory alliances are forged that will forever challenge his beliefs of what it means to be a hero.

Who is Purge?

Purge aka Richard Kincaid encompasses everything his name stands for....Purification.  Purification of the city he helped create and the near endless struggles he faces within.

As a youth, Richard was abducted and subjected to experimentation involving lobotomy and surgical implementation that left him in a state of near retardation.


As years pass, he recovered with heighten senses, and the ability to control his bodily functions to increase his strength, agility and memory. 

 


His love for all things tech, led him to create one of the largest technological firms in the world.  His philosophy, “ Build to teach, and teach to build."  As one of the leading and most prolific corporate leaders of the world, Richard understood the importance of creating an environment for success and prosperity through solidarity.

Together with numerous world leaders he ushered in the world's first mecha city, New Salem.  A city where technology grows at an alarming rate.

Purge struggles to protect, contain the growth of New Salem, and to come to terms with his past, that has been hidden from him by the very technology that made him who he is today.

Flashback Page Purge: Past Unspoken By Larry Stroman Colors By Mshindo Kuumba


 YOU ASKED FOR QUALITY!  YOU GOT IT!  MEET OUR TEAM!

Roosevelt Pitt, Jr.  (creator, publisher, writer): I am the creator of Purge, and a thirty year plus veteran in the comic book industry. I publish under my company's banner AMARA Entertainment.

Larry Stroman (artist): Larry Stroman truly needs no introduction;  for he is a pioneer artist of great notoriety, whose accolades include Todd Johnson and Larry Stroman's Tribe, Black Panther, Alien Legion, X-Factor, and What If?  X-Men.  I am very proud to have his talent showcased.  Larry along with Mshindo Kuumba will be providing the flashback opening sequences that will unlock the past of Purge, and reveal much about the man behind the mask.

Krishna  & Balram Banerjee (artists,colorists, lettering and character design): Hailing from India, these twin brothers have given Purge new life and a style that befits a hero who is a master of the martial arts and a techno genius.  Together they have revamped his world for a whole new, more savvy generation of fans. Check out their stunning work here: http://xong.deviantart.com/

Mshindo Kuumba (artist, lead character design and art director): Mshindo is arguably one of the most prolific visionaries, and a true leader of the black indie comic movement. His years of leading the charge to showcase African imagery to the forefront of our consciousness has never been matched. He has lent his design talents for Purge, and many of his weapons and vehicles. You will find his long list of accomplishments and work in Electro X, DC's Batman Chronicles, DC's Impulse and Sectonauts. Mshindo's talents have flourished over the years as he has worked with companies such as A & B, ANIA, Brainstorm, Continuity, Defiant, Valiant, Broadway, Crusade, Kevlar, AMARA and DC comics. Mshindo will also be the lead artist and writer of the Crimson Seed prelude, due out next year. You can find more of Mshindo's awe inspiring works here: http://mshindo9.deviantart.com/

C.R. Ward (editor): C.R. Ward, writer and creator of the super powered detective Vegas Baby, and The Stronger, brings his expert editing skills to the project, giving the Purge story strength and cohesiveness.  His guidance has proven to be invaluable as it has given the project a boost of confidence in story direction and character development. C.R. Ward's work can be found here: http://www.kid-comics.com/

Appreciation and thanks goes out to Richard “Uraeus” Tyler, Vince White, and Victoria Pittman for lending their design and layout skills to the project. I thank Thom Burgess of Captcha Stu Dios for producing the campaign video and Baz Hendrix for providing a superb narration.

Their contact info is provided below.

Uraeus https://twitter.com/JaycenWise Mr. Baz Hendrix Voice Over www.bazhendrix.com Ms. Vicki Pittman http://vickibewicked.deviantart.com/ Mr. Thom Burgess http://captchastudios.co.uk/ Mr. Vince White http://willpowercomic.com/

Special appreciation goes out to Mshindo Kuumba, Larry Stroman, Sanford Green, Mohammed Agbadi, and Jose Luis for providing incentive art for the campaign!

Interior Page by Krishna  & Balram Banerjee,

Our Goals

Our initial goal is to print a minimum of 1000 copies of a twenty-four page softcover book, depending on our backers.  Funds will go to production and editorial of the book, printing and delivery through Global PSD, shipping through Amazon fulfillment and production of incentives. Wide distribution will once be handled by AMARA Entertainment. If funding stretch goals are met we will produce the book in an hardcover format.

PERKS

STRETCH GOALS


Unlock this Stretch Goal and Expand  Purge: Past Unspoken Issue One to Forty Three Pages!

Unlock this Stretch Goal and Receive a Hard Cover Edition of Purge: Past Unspoken Issue One!

Unlock this Stretch Goal and Receive a Hard Cover Edition of Purge: Past Unspoken Issue One and a New One Minute Digital Animated Short!


Unlock this Stretch Goal and Receive a Hard Cover Edition of Purge: Past Unspoken Issue One & Two

WHO IS AMARA?

Formed in 1993, AMARA was formed to produce and distribute ethnic superhero comic books to fill the void left by the lack of positive African American heroes in the market place. AMARA seeks to be the voice of African Americans in the comic book industry. For many years a majority of the mainstream comic book companies have portrayed Black heroes as side-kicks and or minor characters. AMARA realizes and sees the inherent potential black heroes have to be more.  AMARA feels that it's their mission and responsibility to give the comic book market positive Black heroes.  Within a span of twenty years, AMARA has created numerous properties and brands to fulfill its goal, such as PURGE, DYNAMO AZAAN, POWERKNIGHTS -Armored Sentinels, ERASTO and countless others.

Risks and challenges

Creating a book like this is a time consuming and expensive process. Please be aware that there will be a one year production period, this includes printing and shipping of the book from the printers. The goal is to have the book in hand by May of 2016, for shipment to backers before it's scheduled wide release date of July of 2016.

if you pledge to a copy of the completed book and additional rewards, you will receive all the included rewards as a single shipment with the book in 2016. It's less expensive to ship as a single package than individual rewards.

Also, Shipping for all backers will be billed to the backers at the time of delivery, in order to compensate for the fluctuations in shipping costs. All shipping will be handled through Amazon fulfillment, and charged by Paypal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get The Word Out! Share! Share! and Share!  And dont forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The title says it all: The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel.  

Hebrew and transliteration on the right; comics and English translation on the left. 

Everyone who hears the concept immediately gets it — and loves it.

About the Project

The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel  will be a beautiful and functional full-length graphic novel version of the traditional Passover Seder table “guide book” that is both dynamic and accessible, combining:

• Unabridged (i.e., fully kosher) Hebrew text and transliteration;

• Fully illustrated graphic novel incorporating unabridged, brand new, modern, colloquial English translation;

• “How To” instructional graphics depicting rituals and customs

The text of The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel is like a "SparkNotes" of Judaism: a sprawling, anachronistic overview of the entirety of Jewish heritage and experience, sampled from 4,000 years of scholarship and philosophy, suffering and success — sometimes all on the same page! — with a festive meal in the middle.

Icons placed in the margins will help you mark your place when you have to get up and go to the kitchen to check on the brisket. Big moments like the Ten Plagues will feature spreads. And the long, dense later sections will feature thematically linked stories to keep the participant involved through the end. 

We’ll use every tool in the comics kit, including humor — a staple of Jewish tradition — to make even the most esoteric and/or non-linear sections engaging, as we bring history alive, making it relevant with the action, drama and excitement that’s always been inherent.

How Is This Haggadah Different from All Other Haggadot?

The majority of Haggadot (plural for Haggadahs) on the market are straightforward treatments emphasizing text and commentary.  Amidst the myriad varieties — which includes no-frills giveaways, organizational editions, coffee table versions, and 60- or even 30-minute abridgments — there is no graphic novel adaptation. 

There are many illustrated Haggadot. They range from illustrated manuscripts — some dating back decades and even centuries — to children’s storybooks. They place illustrations or photographs next to the text. But they do not fully illustrate the text — whereas our graphic novel will fuse words and text together into sequential storytelling. 

Is the graphic novel an appropriate medium for such reverential material? Absolutely! (What were hieroglyphics if not ancient comics?) In modern times, Jews practically invented the comic book. Telling the Passover story in sequential art is a natural: What is described or implied by the original text will be illustrated verbatim, and dialogue spoken by historical figures will be spoken via word balloons.

In this way, The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel will resonate with people of all backgrounds, religious affiliations and demographics, regardless of how much Hebrew they know or tradition they observe, and appeal to the casual buyer and collector alike. 

To borrow from the Haggadah’s parable of the Four Sons —  Four Children: whether you’re “wise” and knowledgeable from birth, or “simple” and want the basics, The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel will play a central role in guiding you from slavery to freedom authentically and entertainingly.

Our research with experts in the publishing field indicates that schools, libraries and Jewish institutions will be interested in procuring multiple copies. This book will be an evergreen product that will sell year after year, for educational, theological and ecumenical use, for personal enjoyment, and as a treasured gift.

In sum: we’re creating the first and only fully functional, artistically stunning, modern yet timeless, educational and entertaining graphic novel for the authentic ritual observance of the Passover Seder. (Matzoh sold separately.)

The Team Behind The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel

I'm Jordan B. Gorfinkel, known as Gorf. Having managed the Batman franchise at DC Comics, I am blessed to be one of the unique few in the world with the highest possible level of graphic novel creation and production experience. My creations, such as Batman: No Man’s Land and Birds Of Prey, have resulted in critically acclaimed and commercially successful comics (more than 2000 publications), film (The Dark Knight Rises), television series (Cartoon Network, The WB), toys, games, merchandise and more. 

I love comics and Judaism (in alphabetical order). I practice Judaism as a Torah observant Jew, and I’ve both learned and taught Judaism from and in all major Jewish denominations. As a kid attending Jewish day schools and Ramah and Moshava sleepaway camps, I doodled Batman on lots of desks and bunk walls. Little wonder that today, I apply my professional Batman storytelling skills to producing mainstream and Jewish content, including illustrated storytelling, music, TV/film, and, of course, comics, such as my weekly cartoon strip JewishCartoon.com.

So: why a Haggadah? I recall when the Munich Jewish Museum contacted me to commission a series of my JewishCartoon.com comic strips on the Holocaust for their permanent exhibition, complete with humorous punchlines… The Holocaust! Initially I considered turning them down. What if I screwed it up? Then I realized, if I don’t undertake it, someone else might screw it up!

Adapting the non-linear Passover Haggadah story into comics will be the greatest challenge and most joyous achievement of my career — and one that I believe will have lasting impact.

For The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel, I’ve commissioned an original, easy-to-follow and immensely readable translation from David Olivestone. Beloved as  the editor and translator of the immensely popular NCSY Bencher (Grace After Meals Book), he has a proven ability to bring the text alive by finding just the right English word or phrase to fit the Hebrew idiom. Recently retired from his position as Senior Communications Officer at the Orthodox Union in New York, David now lives in Jerusalem.

It took me several months of global networking to identify the best young Israeli comics talent to draw the Haggadah.  Erez Zadok is a graduate of the renowned Bezalel Academy of Art in Jerusalem. He is a Godsend! His immense talent, devotion to his craft and tireless work ethic need no further introduction than his evocative artwork for this Haggadah.

Rounding out our team are accomplished project managers, designers and publicists. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation will fund the production of The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel, which is a not-for-profit educational project. If we reach our goal, we'll be able to cover the costs of  the interlocking production components, including:

  • Writing/Editing
  • Illustrated Storytelling
  • Graphic Design 
  • Hebrew/English texts of the highest quality scholarship

If we exceed our goals, we'll be able to finance the next stage of the process, and get the Haggadah into print and to market. 

With this crowdfunding campaign, my team and I invite you to join us in bringing the Haggadah to four-color life. Your tax-deductable donation promises to engage generations of people of all ages and backgrounds, now and to come, in the traditional story and storytelling rituals of the Passover holiday, as told through the quintessential modern Jewish sequential storytelling medium: comics.

To thank you for your generosity and support, different pledge levels will receive copies of The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel,  limited edition artwork prints from the Haggadah, signed bookplates, printed acknowledgements, and more, such as the opportunity for you to literally be drawn into the story. If we're successful, we'll add stretch goals, like fold-out artwork spreads that expand the scope and depth of the publication.

Risks & Challenges

We have an excellent team in place, and we are committed to each doing our jobs, with the goal of releasing in time for Passover 2017. 

The main obstacle to reaching our objective is financial. We have a lead funding family who generously donated the seed money for production of the sample art and layout spreads gracing this page, as well as the accompanying video. At the same time, we want to open up the project to widest possible audience, both to fund and to publicize the book, and maximize its impact and inspiration.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Spread the word about The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email, and old-fashioned schmoozing. If there's someone you think would love the Haggadah, let them know!

If you would like to make a larger contribution, or to dedicate the entire Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel in honor of or in memory of a loved one, please contact Gorf via the contact link at the top of the page.

Donations are tax deductible pursuant to IRS code 501(c)(3).

So: why a Haggadah? I recall when the Munich Jewish Museum contacted me to commission a series of my JewishCartoon.com comic strips on the Holocaust for their permanent exhibition, complete with humorous punchlines… The Holocaust! Initially I considered turning them down. What if I screwed it up? Then I realized, if I don’t undertake it, someone else might screw it up!

Beloved as  the editor and translator of the immensely popular NCSY Bencher (Grace After Meals Book), he has a proven ability to bring the text alive by finding just the right English word or phrase to fit the Hebrew idiom. Recently retired from his position as Senior Communications Officer at the Orthodox Union in New York, David now lives in Jerusalem.
It took me several
months of global networking to identify the best young Israeli comics talent to
draw the Haggadah.  Erez Zadok is a graduate of the renowned
Bezalel Academy of Art in Jerusalem. He is a Godsend! His immense talent,
devotion to his craft and tireless work ethic need no further introduction
than his evocative artwork for this Haggadah.


Rounding out our
team are accomplished project managers, designers and publicists. 


What We Need & What You Get

 
Your donation will fund the production of The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel, 
which is a
not-for-profit educational project. If we reach our goal, we'll be able to cover the costs of  the interlocking production components, including:



Writing/Editing

Illustrated Storytelling
Graphic Design 

Hebrew/English texts of the highest quality scholarship


If we exceed our goals, we'll be able to finance the next stage of the process, and get the Haggadah into print and to market. 
With this crowdfunding campaign, my team and I invite you to join us 
in bringing
the Haggadah to four-color life. Your tax-deductable donation promises to engage generations of people of all ages and backgrounds, now and to come, in the traditional story and storytelling rituals of the Passover holiday, as told through the quintessential modern Jewish sequential storytelling medium: comics.
To thank you for your generosity and support, different pledge levels will receive copies of The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel,  limited edition artwork prints from the Haggadah, signed bookplates, printed acknowledgements, and more, such as the
opportunity for you to literally be drawn into the story. If we're successful, we'll add stretch goals, like fold-out artwork spreads that 
expand the
scope and depth of the publication.
    
Risks & Challenges



We have an excellent team in place, and we are committed to each doing our jobs, with the goal of releasing in time for Passover 2017. The main obstacle to reaching our objective is financial. We have a lead funding family who generously donated the seed money for production of the sample art and layout spreads gracing this page, as well as the accompanying video. 
At the same
time, we want to open up the project to widest possible audience, both to fund and to publicize the book, and maximize its impact and inspiration.Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Spread the word about The Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email, and old-fashioned schmoozing. If there's someone you think would love the Haggadah, let them know!

If you would like to make a larger contribution, or to dedicate the
entire Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel in honor of or in memory of a loved one,
please contact Gorf via the contact link at the top of the page.
Donations are tax deductible pursuant to IRS code 501(c)(3).

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
POP! Sign Display is a stylish idea we came up with a while back, to showcase our POP! Collection but its really expensive to get  a lot of them produced to launch the line. That is why we ask for your support, to help us OFFICIALLY launch our first series of POP! Sign Display. - Thank you.

 

The goal of this particular campaign is to successfully fund the production and shipping of our first batch of POP! Sign Display. We have the ideas, we have futures designs ready. All we need now is people who love our product and believe in what this brand stands for. We're hoping to raise at least $5,000 for production costs, but of course, if we exceed that goal, that just means we'll produce more for you guys. 

The shelf is design to display 4 POPs, but that can change to more.

The shelf and sign is expected to be made of acrylic.

Risks and challenges

The design for this project is complete and ready to be made as soon as funds become available from this campaign if it's successful. keep in mind that final product may look a little different from the picture above. If a delay occurs in production it will be corrected and shipped ASAP.

story:
WELCOME TO THE WORLD OF THE

 

On the strange world of M'yltos, a race of techno-organic creatures rule a portion of the planet.  They are called the Techno-Mechs.  The ruler of the Techno-Mechs, Shiandra, is constantly granting herself more and more power against the wishes of the race's council.  Another large portion of the planet's population are a race of rock people called the Stone Warriors.  The two races are separated by a large ocean of lava.  Shiandra plays into the xenophobia of the Techno-Mechs and has declared the Stone Warriors an enemy of the state.

A group of renegade freedom fighters called the Apostates risk their freedom and very lives to smuggle the Stone Warriors into the city state Command Star-1.  The Stone Warriors are ruled by an evil dictator who causes warrior rights atrocities. The Apostates are sympathetic to the Stone Warriors problems and believe the Warriors can have better lives in Command Star-1.

Shiandra has erected a wall that she believes will help to prevent the immigration of the Stone Warriors.  She has dispatched her elite guard, the Wardens, to patrol the wall and keep the citizens of Command Star-1 safe.  The leader of the Wardens, Solitaire, is very loyal to Shiandra.  He and his two top Wardens, Vyper and his brother, Rozzik, have uncovered a plot to overthrow Shiandra. 

During a battle between the Wardens and the Apostates, Vyper is gravely injured saving the life of Solitaire.  While Vyper is recovering he investigates the Apostates and learns that the leader of the Apostates, Pandemonium, is taking her orders from a member of the Wardens!  This news will send ripples throughout the Techno-Mechs, even reaching the leader Shiandra herself!

 

Meet The Two Main Characters:

 

Some Pages From The Book:

These are a few pages from the first issue of the Techno-Mechs.  The book will be in full color.  These pages have not yet been colored.

 

 

 

 

Original Concept Art:

Solitaire

 

Pandemonium

 

Shiandra

 

Canon

 

Ostego

 

Ostegaard

 

 

Meet The Creative Team:

 

 

 

Satyrn Studios is an entertainment media company based out of Eau Claire, Wisconsin.  The company is focused on creative storytelling using compelling characters.  Satyrn Studios started with a zombie story called Arise.  The book has had many various products released to support the franchise.  The book is distributed throughout the United States.

SOME OF SATYRN STUDIOS PUBLISHED WORKS:

Arise Issue #1

 

Arise #2

 

Arise #3

 

Arise #4

 

Arise #5

 

Arise #6

 

The Fundraiser:

This fundraiser is for the first issue of Techno-Mechs to be completed.  This is a six issue series.  We are asking for $6,000 to get the book finished.  This will pay the entire creative team plus manufacture of the products listed in the perks section.

If the fundraiser goes beyond the $6,000 asked it will continue into the remaining five books.  If all six books gets funded through this one fundraiser then everyone who donates will get a copy of the graphic novel upon its completion. 

Additional perks will be added as the campaign gets funded.

 

Why You Should Care:

The story of the Techno-Mechs is an all inclusive story that focuses on modern topics of debate.  The story touches on immigration, the LGBTQ community, and the power of a political figure that can affect the lives of others.  The characters in this story have very real problems and consequences for their actions.  It shows the devastation of outing specific minority groups in a community.  It shows that all sentient beings deserve freedom and love.  And most importantly, it shows the need for compassion for those that get trampled on by the powerful.  If you've ever been brought low by people because of the way you dress, the way you behave, the who you love, or the way you look, then the story of the Techno-Mechs is for you.

 

The Perks:

Lots of great things are being given away for those that contribute to the Techno-Mechs fundraiser!  Digital and signed physical copies of the first issue, mp3s from the score of the upcoming Techno-Mechs video game, posters, mousepads, shirts, and more!

$10 - DIGITAL PDF

A digital copy of the first issue of the Techno-Mechs comic book emailed directly to you as soon as the campaign begins fulfillment!

 

$20 - PDF AND MOUSEPAD

A digital copy of the first issue of the Techno-Mechs comic book emailed directly to you and a Techno-Mechs mouse pad delivered to you as soon as the campaign begins fulfillment!

 

$30 - PDF AND T-SHIRT

A digital copy of the first issue of the Techno-Mechs comic book emailed directly to you, and a Techno-Mechs T-shirt mailed to you as soon as the campaign begins fulfillment!

 

$50 - MULTIPAK

  • A digital PDF copy of issue 1
  • A physical copy of issue 1
  • A mouse pad
  • A T-shirt!

A digital copy of the first issue of the Techno-Mechs comic book emailed directly to you, a physical copy of the first issue of the Techno-Mechs comic book, a Techno-Mechs mouse pad, and a T-shirt delivered to you as soon as the campaign begins fulfillment!

 

$100 - SATYRN STUDIOS ULTIMATE PAK

The ultimate Satyrn Studios package!  Digital copies of the first issue of Techno-Mechs and all six issues of the Arise comic series, physical copies of Techno-Mechs 1, and all six issues of the Arise comic series, an Arise DVD two-pack, a Techno-Mechs mousepad, and both a Techno-Mechs shirt AND an Arise shirt!

  • Digital PDF of Techno-Mechs issue 1
  • Digital PDFs of all six issues of Arise
  • Physical copy of Techno-Mechs issue 1
  • Physical copies of all six issues of Arise
  • Techno-Mechs T-shirt
  • Arise T-shirt
  • Techno-Mechs Mousepad

 

$200 - HAND DRAWN BIO PIC - SOLITAIRE

This is a hand drawn 11" x 17" pic by Steve Kurth.  This image will be used in a future "world of the Techno-Mechs" book.

 

$200 - HAND DRAWN BIO PIC - PANDEMONIUM

This is a hand drawn 11" x 17" pic by Steve Kurth.  This image will be used in a future "world of the Techno-Mechs" book.

 

$200 - HAND DRAWN BIO PIC - VEHICLES

This is a hand drawn 11" x 17"pic by Steve Kurth.  This image will be used in a future "world of the Techno-Mechs" book.

 

$350 - HAND DRAWN ISSUE 1 PAGE 10

This is a hand drawn 11" x 17" pic by Steve Kurth.  This image is page 10 for issue 1 of the Techno-Mechs comic book.  You'll also get an autographed copy of issue 1 signed by both Steve Kurth and Jay Reiter.

 

$500 - HAND DRAWN ISSUE 1 PAGE 4

This is a hand drawn 11" x 17" pic by Steve Kurth.  This image is page 4 for issue 1 of the Techno-Mechs comic book.  You'll also get an autographed copy of issue 1 signed by both Steve Kurth and Jay Reiter.

 

$750 - HAND DRAWN ISSUE 1 PAGES 2 AND 3

This is a hand drawn 11" x 17" pic by Steve Kurth.  This image is page 4 for issue 1 of the Techno-Mechs comic book.  You'll also get an autographed copy of issue 1 signed by both Steve Kurth and Jay Reiter.

 

$1,000 - HAND DRAWN ISSUE 1 COVER

This is a hand drawn 11" x 17" pic by Steve Kurth.  This image is cover for issue 1 of the Techno-Mechs comic book.  You'll also get an autographed copy of issue 1 signed by both Steve Kurth and Jay Reiter.

 

MORE PERKS TO BE ANNOUNCED AS CAMPAIGN PROGRESSES!

 

 

All Shirts Printed By Terminus Tees

 

All shirts from this campaign will be printed by Terminus Tees, so you know the quality will be the best there is!

story:
'BIN KITTY', the bloodstained story of a violent anthropomorphic cat!
A new comic series by Australian artist/writer Duncan Pranevicius.

'Waking to find she has a bullet in her skull and all her memory has been completely wiped, our mysterious protagonist tries to piece together what life she's lost...and find whoever is responsible for taking it from her, even if she needs to burn this city filled with murderous psychopaths to the ground!'

​

Issue #1 is already completed at 28 pages, and issue #2 is almost finished currently on 40 pages, which may grow to 44 before completion. So that's 68 pages currently between both issues.

The reason I'm including both together is due to not being 100% happy with issue #1, both in terms of art quality and page number, and i believed that it'd be more worth the value to include the much higher quality and larger issue #2 with it.

Money raised is going towards printing costs and postage for both issues, both of which aren't in physical print yet, and any excess going towards future issues (30+ issues are being written!), extra pages, and variant covers.

Any support is greatly, fully appreciated!

This project is totally independent and 100% done solo, from writing to covers to lettering, all are done by myself during any time i get between general parenting duties, just trying to get a foot in the door of the comics industry. From monetary backing to just sharing this campaign, everything means something and i thank you.

For any backers, I'd love to hear from you about what

you'd like included in this campaign, so don't hesitate to let me know.

THANK YOU!

story:
A dark Sci-Fi saga

In the year 2179 an epic journey unfolds.

Zithara, an alien hybrid, has hollow bones and the ability to form red crystal structures at will into various forms of weaponry, thus allowing her to become an acrobatic blade of death. She comes face to face with a pack of horrible mutant abominations, awful life devouring beasts dubbed as Dreadfiends.

As she fights for her life to escape from being eaten alive by them, she remembers her past horrors, a dark childhood bathed in pure hatred and prejudice simply for being what she is. She is hunted down by the technologically advanced and militant trained hate group known as The Order of the Purging Hand. This hate causes her to embark on a journey that unlocks her true potential...

And leads her to join a ragtag super team called The Crimson Flame.

The Dreadfiends have grown and spread at such a rapid rate that they have become a plague that threatens the very existence of humankind and most of all other life on earth. The Crimson Flame is humanity's last hope, but a genocidal dark entity that calls himself Malakar is determined to make any hope impossible.

Go to SharpEdgeComics.com, my production company, for even more on the series.

Including a full 10 page preview. Chaotic Flux #1 is 26 pages long. Plus 2 pages of extras.

 

 

 

The Mind behind the madness

My name is Scott Payne. I have been a huge comic book fanatic for most of my life. I've wanted to be a comic book creator ever since I can remember, but I've always felt that if I'm going to do it, I'm going to do it BIG.

So I have been building on this story and world for 20 years now and I'm finally ready to share it with comic book fans all over. Chaotic Flux is a passion of mine and that I want nothing more than to get it into reader's hands.

I love stories such as X-Men: Age of Apocalypse, WATCHMEN, Avengers, Battle Chasers, Evangelion, Battle Angel: Alita, Game of Thrones, Batman Returns, Guild Wars 2, and Resident Evil. The drama, high stakes, and larger than life feel of these stories is what you will get from Chaotic Flux.

 

 

The rest of the creative team

Illustrator: Brian Balondo - Brian is a very talented and versatile up and coming artist. It has been said many times that his art would fit wonderfully in the books of the big 2. Some of his other works include Star Burn and Rising Sun.

Colorist: Bryan Arfel Magnaye - Bryan is a genius when it come to his coloring techniques. He makes that art just jump right off of the page every time. Some of Bryan's other works include The Mighty Titans, War of the Independents, Rising Sun, and the greatly successful IndieGoGo comic, RAVAGE.

Letterer: Matt Bowers - Matt is really creative with his word balloon placements. He's also wonderful with creating eye popping word effects. Matt has been the main letterer for Short Fuse Madia comics since 2015. Some of his past works include The Volunteryst, The Globalists, Pink Wing, and Controller.

Matt also has a series that he has created called Memphis.

I am so lucky to of found these awesome dudes to of helped me make this comic look so damn good.

 

 

Give rise to an epic comic book event

My biggest dream is for this series is to share it with as many people as possible. I truly believe this is a story worth telling and sharing. With your help I plan on getting Chaotic Flux into lots of comic book shops and comic conventions, thus distributing the book to more readers. The more this insane series is seen and known the more it will continue to grow!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $6000.

This is to cover the cost of paying the talented artists that made Chaotic Flux #1, which is more than half of what we are asking for. As the comic is already finished, the rest of the $6000 goes towards printing 1250 copies of the non-metallic version of the book as well as making all of these additional awesome rewards, and shipping them all out to you.

Any money raised beyond the set goal will go on to help fund additional issues in the Chaotic Flux series. Issue #2 is in the works now.

So the more money raised means more Chaotic Flux gets out and into your hands!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

None really. The book is finished and just waiting to be printed and shipped out to you.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Remember, IndieGoGo has a share tool just for that.

Please share anywhere and everywhere you can. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and any place else you can think of.

Every little bit goes a long way!

Please, help us to make Chaotic Flux a big success!

 

Campaign exclusive T-shirt design!!!
story_txt:
A dark Sci-Fi saga
In the year 2179 an epic journey unfolds.
Zithara, an alien hybrid, has hollow bones and the ability to form red crystal structures at will into various forms of weaponry, thus allowing her to become an acrobatic blade of death. She comes face to face with a pack of horrible mutant abominations, awful life devouring beasts dubbed as Dreadfiends.
As she fights for her life to escape from being eaten alive by them, she remembers her past horrors, a dark childhood bathed in pure hatred and prejudice simply for being what she is. She is hunted down by the technologically advanced and militant trained hate group known as The Order of the Purging Hand. This hate causes her to embark on a journey that unlocks her true potential...
And leads her to join a ragtag super team called The Crimson Flame.
The Dreadfiends have grown and spread at such a rapid rate that they have become a plague that threatens the very existence of humankind and most of all other life on earth. The Crimson Flame is humanity's last hope, but a genocidal dark entity that calls himself Malakar is determined to make any hope impossible.
Go to SharpEdgeComics.com, my production company, for even more on the series.
Including a full 10 page preview. Chaotic Flux #1 is 26 pages long. Plus 2 pages of extras.
 

 





 
The Mind behind the madness
My name is Scott Payne. I have been a huge comic book fanatic for most of my life. I've wanted to be a comic book creator ever since I can remember, but I've always felt that if I'm going to do it, I'm going to do it BIG.
So I have been building on this story and world for 20 years now and I'm finally ready to share it with comic book fans all over. Chaotic Flux is a passion of mine and that I want nothing more than to get it into reader's hands.
I love stories such as X-Men: Age of Apocalypse, WATCHMEN, Avengers, Battle Chasers, Evangelion, Battle Angel: Alita, Game of Thrones, Batman Returns, Guild Wars 2, and Resident Evil. The drama, high stakes, and larger than life feel of these stories is what you will get from Chaotic Flux.
 

 
The rest of the creative team
Illustrator: Brian Balondo - Brian is a very talented and versatile up and coming artist. It has been said many times that his art would fit wonderfully in the books of the big 2. Some of his other works include Star Burn and Rising Sun.
Colorist: Bryan Arfel Magnaye - Bryan is a genius when it come to his coloring techniques. He makes that art just jump right off of the page every time. Some of Bryan's other works include The Mighty Titans, War of the Independents, Rising Sun, and the greatly successful IndieGoGo comic, RAVAGE.
Letterer: Matt Bowers - Matt is really creative with his word balloon placements. He's also wonderful with creating eye popping word effects. Matt has been the main letterer for Short Fuse Madia comics since 2015. Some of his past works include The Volunteryst, The Globalists, Pink Wing, and Controller.
Matt also has a series that he has created called Memphis.
I am so lucky to of found these awesome dudes to of helped me make this comic look so damn good.
 

 
Give rise to an epic comic book event
My biggest dream is for this series is to share it with as many people as possible. I truly believe this is a story worth telling and sharing. With your help I plan on getting Chaotic Flux into lots of comic book shops and comic conventions, thus distributing the book to more readers. The more this insane series is seen and known the more it will continue to grow!
 

 

What We Need & What You Get
We are asking for $6000.
This is to cover the cost of paying the talented artists that made Chaotic Flux #1, which is more than half of what we are asking for. As the comic is already finished, the rest of the $6000 goes towards printing 1250 copies of the non-metallic version of the book as well as making all of these additional awesome rewards, and shipping them all out to you.
Any money raised beyond the set goal will go on to help fund additional issues in the Chaotic Flux series. Issue #2 is in the works now.
So the more money raised means more Chaotic Flux gets out and into your hands!

 

 
Risks & Challenges
None really. The book is finished and just waiting to be printed and shipped out to you.

Remember, IndieGoGo has a share tool just for that.
Please share anywhere and everywhere you can. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and any place else you can think of.
Every little bit goes a long way!
Please, help us to make Chaotic Flux a big success!

story:
ABOVE: Finished cover art for the comic.

UPDATE: (01-14)
Now, when you back The Current Plane, you can get yourself an amazing APEX collectible figure! It’s the big bad guy from The Current Plane, in all his chimpanzee glory!
This is a keshi-style figure, standing about two inches tall. It is a highly detailed 3D sculpt that will be pressure cast in a durable orange plastic rubber resin.
Expertly crafted by Rad Plastic Studio, maker of Nano Battle, these amazing figurines are only available with this campaign. (Go to @radplasticstud on Instagram for more from Rad Plastic Studio.)

To get this amazing figure, back us at the new “Apex” level, or get it as a stand-alone add on.
Images below.

UPDATE: All art for the comic is done and the file is ready for print. If you back this campaign, you will get your rewards.

Summary

I'm Chad. A professional illustrator and lover of sci-fi. More than 20 years ago, I came up with the concept of The Current Plane; an underwater world where fish are turned into cyborgs.

It’s basically: "In a cybernetic underwater parallel dimension, a group of aquatic freedom fighters, led by a dolphin, have to take out a despotic chimpanzee overlord."

See? Yeah.

After a few months of prepping, now seemed like a good time to go ahead and begin to tell this story in comic form. So, I'm putting this campaign out there to launch the very first issue of the 4-part Current Plane storyline. (Three more issues will follow. This campaign is for issue #1.)

The foreword of the first issue says this:

In the 1970’s a secret mission to outer space went haywire, and the space vessel crashed into the Atlantic. At hull-crush depth, the vessel imploded, somehow creating an interdimensional doorway below the ocean's surface. Since that time, oceanic life has passed through the door, being assimilated into an alternate dimension. This dimension, called The Current Plane, is run by a mysterious being called The Apex. What’s more, an electromagnetic current pervades the Plane, bending the minds of all of its cyber-aquatic inhabitants to its maniacal will. 
Recently, though, the very first dolphin passed through the Atlantic door and into the Current Plane. This creature was able to overcome the current and gain sentient liberty. Having formed a small strike force, dubbed The Cloaks, they made an attempt to depose the Apex. However, Sonar the dolphin was taken captive. Now the rest of the freedom force must stage a daring rescue mission to free their new leader. Or risk losing it all...

 

ABOVE: Back cover art.

 

The Specs

The comic is standard American comic book dimensions, with full color interior art, and a full-color cover.  It is 22 pages in length. It introduces readers to the world, and takes you along on the journey of the Cloaks' first daring rescue mission. It also sets up the second comic's premise.
 

The Risks

Art for the book is done. That's 22 full-color interior pages, and a color cover. The printer is a US-based printer that specializes in printing comic books. I used to manage a print shop, so the files I'm creating will be perfect for printing. The book will be beautiful. As for additional assets like stickers, these are items that I have created and had produced many, many times. I foresee no issues. There is little-to-no risk, in my opinion.
ABOVE: The comic has "inset" pages which give readers a peek at the Current Plane Bios files which contain details about the Cloaks (the good guys).
 
ABOVE: Promotional image.
 

More about Chad

I make art, professionally, every day. I've done a few projects for Marvel, Disney and Walking Dead, too. But, I always wanted to launch my own book. I began as a technical illustrator, then a web designer, then I worked as a creative director in video games.  These days, I'm a freelancer and video producer. For this book, I distinctly wanted the art to have an indie flair.  I'm excited about this book and this world (the back story will have you like "whuuuuut"), and I do not think there's much out there like it. 
ABOVE: An inked page. All pages will be in full color.

story:
Order the Book at my Website

If you missed the campaign, don't fret! You can still order the book at my website JANTZE.COM via a secure PayPal button. Head on over! The perks and levels are the same they were here.

 

Some Backstory

THE NORM® comic strip ran in newspapers worldwide for a decade. "THE NORM® 4.0" was a result of folks wanting new  strips. In 2014, I started publishing it weekly on GoComics.com. Norm is now married with two kids (there's four of them, get it?). He's the boy who DID grow up. 

 

What's Cool About This Project

"The Norm 4.0" book is ready to go to the printer...it's done! It's presently a 176-page, soft-back book in full color featuring more than 150 comics. The initial funding will include French folds like on my previous book "Knocked Out Loaded." If we surpass that goal, the stretch goals will keep giving you more for your money. All of you! 

What I Need & What You Get

Your contribution will go towards paying the costs for printing, shipping and any stretch goals perks. You'll get an ebook and/or limited edition print book containing:

  • The new THE NORM® comic strips published on GoComics since Jan. 2014.
  • An introduction by one of my cartoon mentors/heroes
  • Stretch goals that would expand the book to 200 pages with more content
  • Extras like stickers, bookmarks, museum prints as we reach stretch goals

If we go to hardback, I'll have those files finished by the time the money is dispersed. This book will ship within a few months of this fundraising. The printing in/shipping from China will be the biggest delays in the turnaround.

    Your Impact

    As with my last book, I am planning a limited run of "The Norm 4.0", making your copy a veritable collector's item. Here's how your contribution will make a difference. It will:

    • Put Norm's new adventures in your hands as a print book.
    • Allow you the choice of a signed book or doodled and signed book
    • Give you the chance to get extra copies at a discount for later gift-giving or eBay profit
    • The cost also covers supplies, my sweat equity, income taxes, and processing fees.

    Risks & Challenges

    With any project there are bumps along the road, but here's how I plan to deliver this book to you on price and on time!

    • I learned a lot with my first IGG, any mistakes made then won't be made again.
    • I now work as an art director for a book publisher, the art files are correctly formatted.
    • No adventurous stretch goals or rewriting the book this time!

    Where Your Money Goes 

    Here's a breakdown in more detail, the first three items will be the bulk of my expenses:

    • Pay for ebook production.
    • Pay for the exclusive Indiegogo print book -- a FULL COLOR softback with French folded covers and special effects. It will be an objet d'art!
    • Pay for shipping and shipping materials.
    • Pay for any production and design needs above my own expertise.
    • Pay any Indiegogo, Paypal and other partner fees.
    • Pay taxes (boy, I didn't plan on that last time).

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can’t contribute, I still love you, and you can still help this campaign. And there's still a way for you to get a book:

    • Get the word out about my campaign and its unique rewards.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools to link up with your social media friends. You could still win the contest for most shares and most conversions!
    • If you have a talent that would help the campaign, let me know, and we can think of a fair trade.

    And please share this page with all your friends!

    – Michael Jantze
    The Norm®: It's a Serious World, Someone Has To Make Fun Of It!

story:
WHO ARE WE:

We are SP COMICS

Creators of the award winning indie comic CANADA BEAR.

THE TEAM:

Creator & Artist - Paul Farris

Artist- Matt Critchfield 

Writer/Letterer – Sean Wilson

Marketing- Scott Wilson

OUR STORY:

Paul and Sean have been friends since childhood. When teenagers they wrote and drew comics for fun dreaming one day they can make it big. After graduating high school Paul attended Edinboro University to study 2D animation, and Sean attended Bowling Green State to study film. While studying animation, Paul met Matt Critchfield, a fellow student animator. Became friends through college and by their senior year, they decided to do an animated short based off Paul's character:

With the help Matt's amazing talent, Canada Bear won silver at the schools film festival 2011.

CLICK LINK FOR ANIMATED SHORT ON YOUTUBE:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-wKUvACqg3k

Forward years later, 2017 to be exact. Paul had an idea to make Canada Bear into a comic book series for all ages. He felt like it would bring a Saturday morning cartoon feel to comics. That's where childhood friend and writer Sean Wilson came into play. With his help Canada Bear comic book series became a reality! 

DID I MENTION WE WON AN AWARD:

ALL ART DONE BY MATT CRITCHFIELD & PAUL FARRIS

The Characters:

           CANADA BEAR                              BEAR TRAP                           DR. KNUMBSKULL

THE STORY:

CANADA BEAR  is a story about an ordinary Canadian Zoo bear, whom gains his powers during the Swiss/Canadian Cold War. Now he must defend Canada from the brink of destruction! 

COVERS ISSUES 1-2

PREVIEW PAGES ISSUES 1:

Our Goals!

The goal of this campaign is a whopping $2000! That’s a lot of canned tuna.  Where’s are the funds get allocated to? All funds that we receive will be put towards the development of Canada Bear 1-3  for print and distribution and future issues in the series.

Issue #2 will be black and white style comic. Here are examples:

ISSUE #3

We are happy to announce to add Issue #3 to the campaign!

If we don’t reach our above goal we are still committed to providing the perks to our backers.  We will provide the product mention in our perks at the best of our ability but may face short delays.  If you have any questions or need updates on the perks please contact our team email: spcomix@gmail.com

Are goal for this project and have perks in backers hands by October of 2020.

story:
The Bubba Files: Grayson's Tale

My name is John Anthony Chihak Soltero and I am the creator of the Bubba Patrol, an all-ages comedy adventure about my dogs as superheroes.

  • I am a Tucson, Arizona native and have been drawing for almost my whole life. I fell in love with comic books when I purchased a copy of the Punisher War Journal issue 44 from a local convenience store while in junior high.
  • During my senior year in high school, I created Nash and Agnew J. Pennyworth, the first two characters of the Anti-Hero Brand Universe.
  • A life-threatening illness in my early twenties propelled me to actually go after my dream. So I went to art and design college and got a Bachelor's Degree in Animation. A year and a half later, I self-published my first comic book.
  • After a decade creating mostly grim and gritty stories, it took the death of Grrry, the Space Dog, on May 27, 2017, for me to begin to the journey in telling the legend of the Bubba Patrol.
  • While working on the third issue of the Bubba Patrol, I produced a Free Comic Book Day "bio" ashcan, that I want to expand on that with a complete offering of the Bubba Files.
  • This is the single best, most personal and organic story I have ever had the pleasure to work on. And I hope you will join me for a spectacular jumping on point to the legacy of the Bubbas.

The Campaign

  • Our goal is to raise $1,000 towards the printing of the Bubba Files: Grayson's Tale and create posters, prints, and signage for upcoming events.
  • Perks include signed and remarked copies of the Bubba Files by me the creator; hand-drawn sketch cards of the Bubbas; special advertising options for retailers and some stretch goals when we break our initial goal of $1,000.
  • This is a great opportunity to not only support an independent creator but a great jumping on point. And don't worry, when we hit that initial goal you'll see some great opportunities to get even more.

What this means to me and the Bubbas

  • Everyone knows a superhero. And in these times when all we seem to see is terrible news headlines and stories that are just dark and depressing, we need a beacon of light and hope. That beacon is the Bubba Patrol. That hope is that all it takes to change the world are a few small dogs with big hearts. Everyone who contributes to this campaign helps make it possible for me to bring that legacy, that dream to the world.
  • I have run three straight successful campaigns on another platform but have decided IndieGoGo is the place to be for comic book funding. IndieGoGo will allow more flexibility and opportunities for both me as a creator and you as fans and supporters of the Bubba Files.
  • Everyone who has contributed to any of my successful campaigns (and filled out the backer surveys) have received their perks, even if it meant multiple trips to the post office and repaying for postage. It may take a little time to fulfill all our pledges, but you will get everything you contribute towards.

Risks & Challenges

  • I do my very best to be upfront about any hurdles that may occur during the creation of the project itself, the campaign, fulfillment or changes to the product or timeline.
  • Creating a comic book as one person from start to finish can be difficult, time-consuming, and sometimes filled with back pain and tendonitis from clutching the stylus too tightly. It is an emotional journey, filled with ups and downs. This means some days it is harder to create than others.
  • But because this project is so important and personal to me, it will get completed. As Master Yoda says, "Do or do not. There is no try."

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially you can share the campaign. Tell your local comic shop about it, tell friends and family, share it on social media, tweet, post, repost, blog or even shoot a quick video about what you find special about this project.
  • Please remember to use the built-in Indiegogo share tools!

Our goal is to raise $1,000 towards the printing of the Bubba Files: Grayson's Tale and create posters, prints, and signage for upcoming events.
Perks include signed and remarked copies of the Bubba Files by me the creator; hand-drawn sketch cards of the Bubbas; special advertising options for retailers and some stretch goals when we break our initial goal of $1,000.
This is a great opportunity to not only support an independent creator but a great jumping on point. And don't worry, when we hit that initial goal you'll see some great opportunities to get even more.

What this means to me and the Bubbas

Everyone knows a superhero. And in these times when all we seem to see is terrible news headlines and stories that are just dark and depressing, we need a beacon of light and hope. That beacon is the Bubba Patrol. That hope is that all it takes to change the world are a few small dogs with big hearts. Everyone who contributes to this campaign helps make it possible for me to bring that legacy, that dream to the world.
I have run three straight successful campaigns on another platform but have decided IndieGoGo is the place to be for comic book funding. IndieGoGo will allow more flexibility and opportunities for both me as a creator and you as fans and supporters of the Bubba Files.
Everyone who has contributed to any of my successful campaigns (and filled out the backer surveys) have received their perks, even if it meant multiple trips to the post office and repaying for postage. It may take a little time to fulfill all our pledges, but you will get everything you contribute towards.


Risks & Challenges

I do my very best to be upfront about any hurdles that may occur during the creation of the project itself, the campaign, fulfillment or changes to the product or timeline.
Creating a comic book as one person from start to finish can be difficult, time-consuming, and sometimes filled with back pain and tendonitis from clutching the stylus too tightly. It is an emotional journey, filled with ups and downs. This means some days it is harder to create than others.
But because this project is so important and personal to me, it will get completed. As Master Yoda says, "Do or do not. There is no try."


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially you can share the campaign. Tell your local comic shop about it, tell friends and family, share it on social media, tweet, post, repost, blog or even shoot a quick video about what you find special about this project.
Please remember to use the built-in Indiegogo share tools!

story:
“Hello, my name is Daniel, I am 12 years old and live in England. I would like to present my first comic strip, The Final, created to support the fight against cancer”

 

Dear friends, we're ready to announce the relaunch of "The Final" project - a comic book created by a 12-year-old boy in support of anti-cancer organisations. The first launch was at the end of 2020: 30 people supported us, which helped us raise about £500! 

In 2021, we plan to publish the comic in other languages, such as Russian, Uzbek, Tatar, Kyrgyz and Kazakh, so that as many people as possible will be able to know the author's story and support the project. 

According to Daniel's story, his grandfather, Ismail Akhmedjanov, was involved in the construction of the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan to help launch the spaceship that took Yuri Gagarin into space! As at that time there was no equipment to protect him from the radiation of the rocket fuel, Ismail was affected by a rare type of cancer called Thyroid. Three years before Daniel was born, Ismail died without even a chance to meet his grandson.

Daniel decided to create a comic book, raising money from the sale of which would allow cancer charities to cope with the disease and enable guys like him to be in touch with their loved ones for as long as possible. 

Let's help Daniel fulfil his dream! Even a small contribution to The Final project makes a huge impact. We believe in your support! 

___________________________________________________

 

«Всем привет! Меня зовут Даниель, мне 12 лет и я живу в Англии. Я хочу представить свой первый комикс  “The Final” созданный чтобы поддержать борьбу с раком». 

 

Друзья, мы готовы объявить о перезапуске проекта “The Final” - комикса, созданного 12-летним мальчиком в поддержку организаций, занимающихся борьбой с раком. 

Первый запуск был в конце 2020 года: нас поддержали 30 человек, что позволило собрать 500 фунтов (50 000 рублей)! 

В 2021 году мы планируем издать комикс на других языках, таких как русский, узбекский, татарский, кыргызский, казахский, чтобы как можно больше людей узнали историю автора и смогли поддержать проект.     

По рассказу Даниеля, его дедушка, Исмаил Ахмеджанов, был задействован при строительстве космодрома Байконур в Казахстане, чтобы помочь запустить космический корабль, доставивший Юрия Гагарина в космос! Так как в те времена не существовало средств, которые бы защитили его от радиации ракетного топлива, то вследствие радиационного излучения Исмаил заболел редкой формой рака щитовидной железы. За 3 года до рождения Даниеля Исмаил умер, так и не познакомившись со своим внуком.

 

Даниель решил создать комикс, сбор средств от продажи которого, позволил бы благотворительным организациям, борющимся с раком, справляться с этим недугом и давать возможность ребятам вроде него общаться как можно дольше со своими родными. 

Давайте поможем Даниелю осуществить его мечту! Даже небольшой вклад в проект “The Final” имеет огромное значение. Мы верим в вашу поддержу!

story:
Blackberry Cheers

Hi everyone, my name is Edo Brenes, I'm a Costarican graphic novel artist living in the UK; and I have been experimenting with abstract storytelling and screenprinting for the past year.

I came up with the idea for my abstract comic "Blackberry Cheers" after spending 2 years drawing my first graphic novel Lobster Paradise. There was a spark inside which wanted to stir away from traditional storytelling for a while, and further explore the possibilites that the page could bring me. That is how I came up with the first few pages and since then I have been working on y spare time to draw and screen print all the other pages. 

After all of this, I will still need to bind the 10 limited edition copies I am creating.

How to help me

I have been having a lot of fun in the print room, but it takes a lot of time just to do one page; so what I am asking is for you to help me fund a month and a half's worth salary to take some time off from my freelance work and jump into it a 100%. I also have to contemplate materials such as paper, inks, binding materials, etc.

  • All of the $3000 I am asking for will go into supporting me to finish the book as a complete project with no interruptions.
  • Right now, 5 images have been finished, and 19 more plus the cover remain to be screen printed, so it will take a lot of time!
  • If I don't manage to get the whole amount of money, the project will still be finished as I am doing this as a challenge for myself; and although it will take longer my excitement will not cool down.

If you like the project, but don't have the opportunity to contribute, you can still help spread the word out and share this campaign through your social media platforms, I'll be more than grateful.

Thanks for reading, 
Edo.

story:
"UNCUT" Sketchbook

Artist Mike Stewart brings you a special collection  of his best work from the past couple years; illustrated using the best quality pencils, inks, and copic markers. This art book contains uncensored stylized artwork of the human figure and pinups in an acclaimed comic book style.

Stewart started his professional comics career drawing backgrounds for Top Cow's The Magdalena. Since then he has gone on to other published works such as Unite and Takeover, ImagineFX Magazine, KIKS TYO, and more. 

This campaign is for the special OVER-SIZED HARDCOVER edition of "Uncut" a previously funded artbook that did well enough to warrant this special edition and to help propel us into the forthcoming graphic novel campaign. It will feature more pages and printed on higher quality papers with a special glossy hardcover. Each physical order comes with a glossy bookmark.

Book is ready to print, fulfillment will be fast and this campaign is a limited print run.

Warning: This Art book will contain depictions of mildly nude female figures which may be offensive to some people and inappropriate for children. The artist and parties involved in production are not responsible for any demonstrations or sensitive feelings an individual may have. It is not pornographic.

story:
IS PROUD TO PRESENT

"They’re just there, in a gloomy world, living their life. . .struck a real chord with what is likely to happen to us in the future."

–The Comics Beat

"Justin Madson’s Breathers is an Indie Masterpiece"

–Monkeys Fighting Robots

This one caught me by surprise. . .if you are looking for something different, this might be it."

–Pastrami Nation

"I LOVED Breathers by Justin Madson."

–Wandering Nerdgirl

"Much like Jeff Lemire’s Sweet Tooth, Breathers is a story set after everything has good and gone to hell."

–MTV.COM

 

 

The story of BREATHERS follows a small cast of individuals as they struggle to make sense of the dystopian world they live in, as a virus is unleashed into the air, rendering it deadly to humans. Among them: a detective whose addiction to the drug known as "Filter K" takes over his life; a brother and sister who, due to recent events, start to wonder if the air really is deadly, or if it's all just a conspiracy; a mother and daughter who will do anything to keep their family together; and a breather salesman who is looking to make amends for his past mistakes. They are all survivors of this virus-plagued world. They are all ‘breathers’.

IMPORTANT: if you missed the first five issues of BREATHERS, you will be able to pick them all up (variants included) from this campaign!  Each issue has over 40 pages of full color story and art!  Here are the books available from this campaign:

 

BREATHERS #6 (standard cover)

 

BREATHERS #6 (variant cover)

 

BREATHERS #6 (INDIEGOGO cover)

 

 

You can also pick up BREATHERS original art, BREATHERS 5" x 7" sketches by Justin Madson, signed comics, and more!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

BREATHERS SKETCHES

 

SIGNED BREATHERS COMICS

 

The following preview is just one of the incredible interconnected stories you will find in BREATHERS #6!  As this series continues to progress, you will see how all these different stories will eventually intertwine with one another.  Enjoy!

story:
Hi!
Our names are Alyssa and Meghan and we are starting a sketch comedy web series called "Pantiless."
Pantiless focuses on Alyssa and Meghan's life in NYC. In some of the episodes we play ourselves and in some we play different characters.(Similar to Broad City/Inside Amy Schumer humor)

We will be graduating from the Stella Adler Studio this April. Throughout our three wonderful years at school we have been taught the importance of knowing what  inspires you and creating your own work - not just waiting around for someone to cast you (although that is nice too *wink* *wink*)

In the fall we started to write sketch for fun and decided that we really want to make this into a web series. We created a Facebook page and posted two videos that we filmed with an iPad. We got a great response from our friends and family - so we want to continue making these sketch videos! But we want to make them with better quality.

And that's why we made an indiegogo page... Cause we gots to raise some monaaaaaye!!

Our plan is to get a director on our team and rent professional equipment. 

We want to film these Pantiless episodes the first two weeks in June.

Our goal is to raise $2,000 by May 16th and it would mean the world to us if you could donate anything at all. 

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this and have a superb day!

Love,

Alyssa Abraham & Meghan Cashel

story:
The next issue of Warriors Amongst Realms by Christian Espiritusanto!

Up and coming New Jersey artist, Christian Espiritusanto, is a student of Joe Kubert School of Cartooning and his work has been showcased in The Official Walking Dead Magazine. 

It was like a dream come true when he published the first two issues of W.A.R. in 2018. Creating a story filled with INSANE ACTION, OTHER REALMS, POWERFUL RELICS, and SAVAGE WARRIORS is what he always wanted! Now he’s ready to continue where we last left off with ISSUE #3!

Our heroes Keith, AJ, and Will are still learning their new powers with the crystals of spirits when they come under threat. The most dangerous and ruthless warrior of Lord Agnes has arrived...NAZZAR!

The Story

A huge explosion in the middle of New York City heralds the arrival of Nazzar. He has come to wreak havoc in his pursuit of the staff of realms. Then he plans on claiming Earth as a realm for Lord Agnes. The only ones who can stop him are three life-long friends Keith, AJ, and Will, who face a more powerful and more experienced foe. With the odds stacked against them, they must work together to take him down, or else their realm will be lost.

The written script, drawings, and coloring are all finished! Funding will go to lettering and printing costs of the 3rd issue of Warriors Amongst Realms. 






We have awesome perks for you to choose. From issue #3 of W.A.R. to exclusive perks like original cover artwork and more! We even have a digital video of issue #1 with actors voicing the characters.

We understand if you’re unable to contribute, but you can still help by sharing this and getting the word out there! Thanks for taking the time to look at our campaign!
