story:
The ultimate comic book store! 

  • My name is Wesley November and I am a comic book enthusiast!
  • I've been buying and selling comic books since I was a child and now it's time for my own shop.
  • Our building is in need of some major renovations and we need raise some money to really make this shop the best store anyone has ever seen!

We need to raise about $20K

  • We will be selling mystery boxes full or comic book Radness! Every box is different and you can buy as many as you would like.
  • Each box for the fundraiser is $30 dollars and will have an equal value of comic book coolness inside or more!
  • We will be building a FULL SCALE CASTLE GREYSKULL our of concrete! inside the shop. We will have a giant millennium falcon busting through the ceiling too! Plus a bat cave computer playing superhero movies all day! 

The Action Plan!

  • Every dollar raised goes to getting this shop open as fast as we can. We are working on this every day and staying focused. 
  • The first few thousand will go into ceiling repair and wall repairs (building walls). Then: paint, art work, window graphics and so much more! 
  • The opening weekend we will have food trucks and free food for all of our comic book buddies to show up and enjoy the day with us. This is a store for the community and a store for fans new and old of comic books. 

Risks & Challenges

With our risk and taking chances... No day can be won. We know this isn't easy, and if it was everyone would do it. But! With an overactive imagination and the skills and tools to make it happen. We mush make Strange Cereal the shop for generations to love and enjoy. 

  • I have over twenty-years in design and build careers and will fully be able to create the ultimate comic book experience.
  • There are always challenges, and there is always a risk. But I am a risk taker and have a powerful background in success! Lets make this shop for you too! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you don't have the money or desire for comic books in your life, share this with someone who loves the comic book life. Everything helps and we just want to reach our goal. 
  • Indiegogo has some amazing share tools and they make this easy for you to share.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money or desire for comic books in your life, share this with someone who loves the comic book life. Everything helps and we just want to reach our goal. 
Indiegogo has some amazing share tools and they make this easy for you to share.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Steven Sweeney. I have written a sci-fi horror crime comic book series called 'The Brink'. 

The Brink issue #1 is a 24 page black and white comic in high contrast art with cover by Marcelo Simonetti. All the art work is complete and the issue is complete.

The goal of this campaign is to help fund a print run. I am committed to continue the story so I'm looking for that leg up to get the ball rolling at comic conventions and online sales.

The Brink is a dark sc-fi, horror, crime comic book series, set in London in the UK. It's about Detective Inspector Sally Shivers and Detective Sergeant Cameron Beckett who investigate crimes of an unearthly nature.

SHIVERS explains, 'our bosses don't like investigations that remain sketchy or unexplained. it messes with the figures and implies incompetence. They are classified as brink cases.'

BECKETT asks, 'you’re assigned these types of cases?'

SHIVERS replies, 'we both are now.'

DI Sally Shivers heads up the Fringe Services Division (FSD), a unique investigative unit that was set up by the Ministry of Defence (MoD) following an official independent review into the way police carry out investigations into certain crimes. The report identified police failings in cases of a unexplained or abnormal nature.

DS Cameron Beckett is hand-picked by the Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police to work with Shivers. Beckett has been briefed to challenge Shivers and demystify the cases they deal with.

During issue #1 Beckett is continually shocked and surprised by events, but more so by Shivers who is a total face-smashing, Glock-wielding bad-ass. She secretly possesses powers that she cannot control and you see early on that her struggle with heroin addiction could end up being a HUGE problem... 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm keeping this simple, the target is $750 for this campaign. What does that cover? First and foremost that gets this book printed and in your hands. Anything beyond the cost of printing and shipping the comic book goes right into issue number two!

In issue one you get a 24-page story that begins with the murder of a young girl. She has her spine torn out by an unnamed creature. The case is referred to the FSD.. Issue #1 is the start of an ongoing series of comics telling the unfolding circumstances around the story.

 

The Impact

This is the first comic book project for me, Steven Sweeney. I have taken the risk of hiring and paying for an experienced professional to make this comic book in the first place. Making this a success will mean a future for The Brink and more stories for all fans.

 

Risks & Challenges

All the pages are done. This book is finished. If the full goal is not reached, you will still receive your rewards. There is no risk of backing this comic book (unless the creature in issue #1 escapes the pages).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back the book financially then then give it a share on your favourite social media platform. Getting the word out to comic fans, sci-fi fans, and people interested in great new comic characters will help get the comic into the hands of everyone.

story:
We are excited to run the campaign for the launch of Mary Machinegun!  A 34 page monster of a comic book that begins a 3 part series following Mary as she combats the supernatural to help keep humanity safe.  

Check out the first 7 pages below!

** $700 Reached!  Each "naughty" tier now has two prints instead of just one!

**$1000 Reached!  Each "naughty" tier now has THREE prints instead of just one!

**$1500 Reached!  Each "naughty" tier has TWO more prints making a total of FIVE!

MARY MACHINEGUN'S FIRST ISSUE!

Greetings!  We are Max DeVill (writer) and Fern Cord (artist), creators of Mary Machinegun!  Max has been a writer of short stories and tabletop RPG modules for 27 years and Fern has been a professional artist for the last 10 years.

We have decided to crowdfund our first outing as a team so we can REALLY bring you the quality that you deserve when it comes to purchasing a comic book.  Let's face it, paper products have become more expensive to produce ever since the digital age, but nothing beats the smell and feel of an actual comic book in your HANDS.

STORY

Mary, a member of the Templar Order is tasked with hunting the supernatural in order to keep humanity safe.  After destroying a vampire, she is tasked with going undercover in a small town in Kentucky; this time to hunt an entire pack of werewolves.  While she conducts her investigation and hunt, she finds herself surrounded by not only the evil of the supernatural, but the most evil creatures of all - Mankind itself.  Will she accomplish her mission or will she fall under the spell of evil that seems to permeate humanity to it's core?  Find out in Mary Machinegun - issue one of three!

Help us bring this comic book to life with your pledge to our campaign!

COVER A - MARIAH BENES

COVER B - JEFF BATISTA

COVER C - WILL TORRES

COVER D - RARIKS / FERN CORD

COVER X - FERN CORD

Naughty Image - Shower Scene

Naughty Combat

Weapon Maintenance

In the Boudior

(All applicable sales tax is included in all tier pricing).
This project does use Flexible Funding so all orders will be fulfilled if we hit our goal or not.

story:
Join Kitty Jenkins, the three-eyed cosmic cat, as he pops in to your life and sends you on a magical journey through time and meowter space that you don't want to go on.



In the end, you learn nothing.

PURRVANA is a 56 page full color hardcover sci-figraphic novel that is full of cat puns and kitty wisdom.


Each page of the book is a psychedelic water color painting. PURRVANA is designed to be one of the trippiest kitty comics ever made.

PURRVANA has sold over 1,500 copies at comic cons around the world. It is appropriate for ALL AGES and beloved by ALL-CAT LOVERS the world over. 

PURRVANA is already printed and ready to ship as soon as the campaign ends.

Now is your chance to get your copy today. Each copy of PURRVANA comes hand signed by the author with a blessing of luck from the All-Cat KITTY JENKINS himself!
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.


PURRVANA is a series of short comic stories that all connect to tell a larger story of Kitty Jenkins playing in the universe and treating it like his cosmic litterbox. Is the All-Cat trying to help? Is it an eldritch force of fur that knows not what it does? Does it just like messing with us for fun? We may never know the truth.


PURRVANA is 56 full color pages long, hardcover and printed 7"x10"


THE BOOK IS ALREADY FINISHED, PRINTED AND READY TO SHIP AS SOON AS THE CAMPAIGN ENDS.

 


NEED A LITTLE MORE PURRSUASION?


Click here to read PURRVANA for FREE!

Then read the spiritual sequel A SONG OF MICE AND FUR for FREE!

 

 


PERKS:


Every pledge of $20 and above comes with 5 Purrvana stickers and the Catfish and Cat God 5.5"x8.5" art prints.



ALL 3 COMICS IN THE KITTY JENKINS SAGA

The Great Catsby is a 28 page black and white comic featuring the first Kitty Jenkins short stories I ever made. It includes a short story about Kitty Jenkins meeting Nick and Jordan from the Great Catsby. A SONG OF MICE AND FUR is a full color 136 satirical fantasy epic about Nyania, a magical land shaped like a pooping cat where dog and cat kings fight each other for the right to rule the rodent peasants. All three books are key to understanding the All-Cat mythos.

 

ORIGINAL WATER COLOR COMMISSIONS

7''x7'' Original water color commission! I can draw a portrait of your cat, your D'n'D character, you, or any character of your choice!

 

ORIGINAL PAGE ART

All original page art is between the sizes of 11''x15'' and 12''x16.5''

Original black and white inked pages


Original Watercolor Pages

SIGHTINGS-
All 4 original water color painted pages of the SIGHTINGS short story from PURRVANA. These beautiful pages depict the various sightings of Kitty Jenkins throughout human history all around the world.

WHO AM I?

My name is Daniel de Sosa and I've worked as a professional indie comic book writer/artist and publisher for over 8 years. I am the creator of fantasy comic series Oi! Tales of Bardic Fury, and have illustrated several coloring books, as well as the graphic novels Purrvana and A Song of Mice and Fur. My books have exhibited and sold at comic conventions around the world including Thoughtbubble in the UK and Wondercon in Los Angeles.
 

 


PURRVANA IS THE PATH TO ENLIGHTENMEOWNT

story:
THE TRANSHUMANS:

A dystopian alternate future where technology and genetic engineering have run amok, after years of battles and wars that have raged through out the solar system unearthing a sick and startling truth that a rouge planet intersects earths path. Horrors from legend and myth will haunt whats left of mankind and usher in a new era.

How it all started

My name is Maurice Dumas, I’m a distant relative of Alexander Dumas the writer of the Three Musketeers, the Man in the Iron Mask and The Count of Monte Cristo. I have always enjoyed reading those tales and would love to one day draw and paint versions of those stories. But for now I want to draw paint and write The Transhumans. I think I have some of his writing genes, and I wanted to tell a story based in an alternate future world with intrigue, romance, and adventure. With high technology and incredible creatures  blended with horror. The Transhumans will immerse you in a deep story with incredible characters and intense world building. 

 

 

The Comic

Fully painted and digitally enhanced interior artwork on every page of the story.

 

The funding will go towards producing THE TRANSHUMANS a 48 page graphic novel painted traditionally with mixed media and enhanced digitally. This will also include shipping and handling.

The total funds are split between printing the comic book, the Indiegogo fee, credit card fees, and the payment to the professionals involved in this launch.

I have planned this very carefully and chose professional partners to make this project as good as possible, but please bear in mind I am not a publisher, I am learning.

Thank you so much for your support and let´s make this happen, together!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

(Noire') Genetic Fantasy Model

 

Color Splash Page

 

Pencil Preliminary for Splash Page

 

 

Alternate Cover / BLUE Variant 

 

Pledge to back this project and if we reach our funding goal, you will receive awesome perks depending on the level of your pledge.

  • $15 backers receive PDF copy  
  • $22 backers receive a autographed copy of the comic.
  • $32 backers receive an autographed comic on the inside front cover a set of 3 exclusive prints, made specially for this.
  • $50 backers receive an autographed comic on the inside front cover a an Ashcan exclusive of character designs and mechanical illustrations. And an original pencil character or tech sketch
  • $90 backers receive an autographed comic, set of 3 exclusive prints, made specially for this. And an original inked character or tech sketch
  • $120 backers receive alternate cover, signed comic with a piece of original hand painted art. receive the signed comic,
  • $200 backers receive the signed comic, and a original hand painted art, and a set of 3 exclusive prints, made specially for this..
  • $1000  The original art from the book is limited so pledge early!  backers receive the alternate cover signed comic, and a original hand painted art and a set of 3 exclusive prints, made specially for this. An Ashcan exclusive of character designs and mechanical illustrations. 
  • $3500 This is the big one! Two lucky backers get the original painted cover art, along with a signed comic. There's only  two covers, The Original and the Alternate Cover so once their  gone, their gone! and a original hand painted art and a set of 3 exclusive prints, made specially for this. An Ashcan exclusive of character designs and mechanical illustrations. 

 

 

You Can Help!

If you can't contribute, you can still help. Spread the word on your own social media channels, like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Youtube!

  • Please  get the word out and make some noise my campaign.
  • Remember use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

 

If I don’t reach my goal I still intend on doing a scaled down version of the book in PDF or a sample portfolio to send to my backers.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN IS FOR BOOK TWO (book 1 also offered)

Blast off and explore a wild and wacky galaxy with Alex and Maddison, two grandkids that discover their Navy Veteran grandfather was really a space explorer for the military. Marooned decades in the past and across the vast cosmos, the kids and their young grandfather must fight against ravenous creatures and sinister aliens while searching for powerful elements that will lead them home.

WHAT'S BETWEEN THE LINES

The Galactic Comet is an exciting kids storybook, perfect for bedtime or just to escape into fantasy for a while. The story promotes family values; highlighting the respect for elders and taking an interest in their wealth of knowledge and experience. For a child, holding a book and delving into the adventure within is a great imaginative and tactile exercise. That connection is priceless. With this story it's my hope to help strengthen family bonds and inspire children's imaginations.

Every Indiegogo Backer Receives a

Certificate of Authenticity

Every Indiegogo Backer's First Name and Last Initial Printed in All Books

 

About the Author and the Storybook

I’m a family man of over twenty years and the father of two children. I’ve spent over two decades in product development/marketing and sales. I’m an artist with nearly thirty years’ experience in animation, special effects, 3D design and dubious voice-over work. I enjoy the creative process and developing projects to their completion.

When my Navy veteran grandfather reached the last years of his life, I visited him and learned more about his incredible life. After he passed, I created a eulogy and poured over 94 years of his life in pictures. It was amazing. Sometimes we don't get to say goodbye to the ones we love, but the time you spent with them is invaluable. Though a kids science fiction fantasy storybook, The Galactic Comet is a tale of two kids learning about their grandfather in ways they never knew and appreciating the man that he is. There's so much more to the people close to us if we only take the time to listen.

Joining in this endeavor allows independent creators to produce art in true free-form. Devoid from corporate thinking and massively funded agendas, stories here can be told with passion and energy. It’s truly exciting when people can come together and be a part of creating something fresh and exciting.

What We Need & What You Get

There is a target goal of $3,000 to complete the SECOND Galactic Comet storybook, part TWO of a four part series. The largest portion of the cost is the printing, binding and shipping of the books to investors. Funding will complete Book TWO and it will be shipped in 1st Quarter 2019. Other funds are needed for hardware and software upgrades to handle the complexities of 3D rendering.

I have operated as a brand executive for over twenty years and have managed the process of many specialized manufacturing supply chains. I bring experience, speed and a successful track record in creative development and production.

Book One of The Galactic was a success and enjoyed by many, we look forward to great things with Book Two!

story:
Through the Woods

I'm excited to launch this campaign, "Through the Woods" a 3 issue mini series for fans who love ghost stories, mystery, & intrigue.  This is a story that's been in the works for a while. I had done a test run, people who got to see it were hungry for more, and its a dream of mine to get this into more hands.. Into your very hands!

This project that was created by the Tartamella brothers. 

  • I'm Vinnie Tartamella, co-creator of this project and comic book veteran. I've worked for Image comics, Todd McFarlane, Devil's Due. I've worked on projects that were covered by CNN, ABC, MSNBC, but its time my personal projects and stories got off the ground!
  • I want to bring a high quality to you the reader! With art and story that I myself have always wanted to see more of in comics again! Rich with detail and as cinematic as a movie!
  • You guys and girls can help me achieve this,  the first of many new projects to come! (some others are already in the works!) This will be the first title under my company "Mella Art World" My  promise is to give you the best quality each and every time!  

What We Need & What You Get

The Break down:

  • The money you donate to this project is for me to do a larger print run for all 3 completed issues of Through the Woods, this comic series will be able to get into more hands around the world! It will also help me launch Mella Art World as a comic company for the fans!  
     
  • With your donations, you'll be getting the completed story, all 3 issues signed by the creators, High quality thick stock paper (unlike the two larger comic companies, we want our books to last!) You get 3 over sized issues of story and art with no advertisements!! 

    Each perk gets better and you'll get  unique items with the higher donation levels, such as exclusive print, sketches, and/or the first volume of my convention style sketchbook!!


     

I value you the fans and supporters!  

        Over the years, I've traveled to many shows, and have met some many amazing people.      Many of you guys encouraged me to take this step, so I thank you in advance!    

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can donate, please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends, share/link on facebook, instagram, twitter, and anywhere else you can think of!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools/links/etc!
story_txt:
Through the Woods
I'm excited to launch this campaign, "Through the Woods" a 3 issue mini series for fans who love ghost stories, mystery, & intrigue.  This is a story that's been in the works for a while. I had done a test run, people who got to see it were hungry for more, and its a dream of mine to get this into more hands.. Into your very hands!This project that was created by the Tartamella brothers. 

I'm Vinnie Tartamella, co-creator of this project and comic book veteran. I've worked for Image comics, Todd McFarlane, Devil's Due. I've worked on projects that were covered by CNN, ABC, MSNBC, but its time my personal projects and stories got off the ground!
I want to bring a high quality to you the reader! With art and story that I myself have always wanted to see more of in comics again! Rich with detail and as cinematic as a movie!
You guys and girls can help me achieve this,  the first of many new projects to come! (some others are already in the works!) This will be the first title under my company "Mella Art World" My  promise is to give you the best quality each and every time!  


What We Need & What You Get
The Break down:

The money you donate to this project is for me to do a larger print run for all 3 completed issues of Through the Woods, this comic series will be able to get into more hands around the world! It will also help me launch Mella Art World as a comic company for the fans!   
With your donations, you'll be getting the completed story, all 3 issues signed by the creators, High quality thick stock paper (unlike the two larger comic companies, we want our books to last!) You get 3 over sized issues of story and art with no advertisements!! Each perk gets better and you'll get  unique items with the higher donation levels, such as exclusive print, sketches, and/or the first volume of my convention style sketchbook!! 

I value you the fans and supporters!          Over the years, I've traveled to many shows, and have met some many amazing people.      Many of you guys encouraged me to take this step, so I thank you in advance!    
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can donate, please help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends, share/link on facebook, instagram, twitter, and anywhere else you can think of!
Use the Indiegogo share tools/links/etc!

story:
Hi my name is Ramel Hill. I'm a writer and illustrator.  I love reading indie comics, and I love creating them as well. 

I am the artist and writer of the series Pinkwing And The Prime-Controller.

I'm running this campaign to get books into the hands of interested readers.

This campaign is for the 4 issue origin story arc "Battle-Tested".

Pinkwing and Prime Controller #1-4 captures the origin story of Ruby and Duncan Pryce and how they become Pinkwing and The Prime-Controller.  They are recruited to become defenders of the planet to fight against an alien invasion of creatures that feed on the natural resources of a planet.

   

Issue 1 Cover by Series Creator and Artist Ramel Hill

I

Issue 2 Cover by Series Creator and Artist Ramel Hill

Issue 3 Cover by Series Creator and Artist Ramel Hill

Issue 4 Cover by Series Creator and Artist Ramel Hill

The Cast-

Ruby and Duncan Pryce

Duncan Pryce aka The Prime-Controller- The 13 year older brother to Ruby. He is a young tech savvy kid very interested in building things.  As Prime-Controller he has access to the Nexus-Gauntlet, and he gains knowledge of an intergalactic understanding of physics. The gauntlet delivers a devastating blow upon impact and generates a power suit that makes the person encased near invulnerable.

Ruby Pryce aka Pinkwing-The 10 year old sister to Duncan. She is a history buff of all things related to martial arts   Ruby picked up the Unbroken Staff.  It also generates a power suit that makes her near invulnerable.  It grants her abnormal speed, leaping abilities and access to the Warriors Vault, an intergalactic fighters guide.

Pinkwing And The Prime-Controller

 

Sage- Alien who recruits Duncan and Ruby to be Defenders of the planet. She has a connection to the alien drones that the heroes will soon discover. 

Sage Meets Ruby and Duncan Pryce

 

The Alliance: Opti-Blast, Sumbo, and Ronan.  These heroes are have each had their home world destroyed by the Evolutionary Drones and have formed an Alliance to defeat the drones when they attack other planets.

The Alliance

The Evolutionary Drone-The alien drone absorbs matter into its core and reforms that matter in the form of alien creatures. The more matter it absorbs the more intelligent and evolved the creatures will be. The actual drone is the unit that controls the creatures. These Drones are sent to planets as a weapons of mass destruction as it salvages natural resources to power its core to create creatures.

 

If you get all 4 of these issues together you get these 2 prints included.

  

If you get all 4 of these issues together you get these 2 prints included.

Free prints if you purchase the complete set of books.

Variant Covers are also available. 

Variant Cover Issue 1 Illustrated by Shoze

Variant Cover Issue 2 Illustrated by Tou Her

Variant Cover Issue 3 Illustrated by Jay Reed

Variant Cover to Issue 4 by Alessandro Miracolo and Colored by David Aravena Riquelme

If you purchase all 4 variant covers you will get these 2 prints included for free.

 

Here is a look at all 8 covers together. Receive all 4 prints plus 2 bonus prints if you get all 8 books together.

           

First Bonus Print

Second Bonus Print

 

Interior Pages of the Book

  

   

   

   

   

   

    

    

    

Issue 3 and 4 need to be colored and lettered. 

 

 

 

The Creative Team 

Ramel Hill (me) - Creator, Writer, Artist (In my natural habitat selling books and meeting new comic book fans!) 

 

On Letters for the series is DC Hopkins- 

 

Besides the books we have a ton of other fun items available as well.

 

The Source Guide

2 six-page stand alone fully  illustrated stories  and 36 other pages of sketches, character notes and  “the making of” pages of how I went from idea to final product.  

48 pages in total. 

Two ways to get this book. 

Selecting the $35.00 perk available that has all the 4 issues-  or adding   $10.00 (5.00 digital version) to any physical reward level.  (please message me if  you choose this route) ***

The cover to the 48 page character Source Guide

 

Sketch Books 

Custom 8 x 10 Wire Sketch Book 108 sheets total. There will be 14  pre-printed art pages. The rest of the 93 sheets will be blank for you  or your child to continue the adventure. 

Interior Illustrations included

 

Stickers

 

 

Additional Posters (11 x 17 Posters) Any cover or print in the this campaign is available for a poster for $10.00 added on.

 

Examples of The Digital Pin Ups Reward

X.O.B. Created by Kyrun Silva- Illustrated by me

Is'Nana The Were-Spider Created by Greg Anderson Elysée- Illustrated by me

 

Custom Cover Art- 

Example Art - (Commission Art) 

 

Become part of the story - 

The entire team of The Alliance and Sage are actually based on backers (or children of backers) from the previous campaign.  They each had a chance to chime in on what their powers would be.  We have 4 slots open to become immortalized in the series.

The Money - Where is it going??

Printing and shipping of books.  I am a comic creator and my motivation is to get my stories into people's hands.  The funds also go towards paying the letterer, paying for the initial print run of the books, prints, sketchbooks and art cards as well as shipping costs. About 10% of that goes toward indiegogo fees and  processing fees. Anything over will be applied to various costs like  replacing lost or damaged books. 

 

Risks & Challenges

I am the creator, writer, and artist for this project. The only risks and challenge is the time line possibly slipping back some but all backers will be notified if that will be the case.

Some of the custom rewards could be pushed back due to any high volume of those pledges.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially share this link to those who would be interested in a great story with great art!

story:
Introduction

Hi! I’m Lowell Dean. Since childhood I’ve been drawing and dreaming about superheroes. I've put that passion into making films (like WolfCop and Another WolfCop ) but some stories are too big for an indie film budget.

Inspired by the likes of Venture Brothers, Bojack Horseman and Rick & Morty, The Atomic Victory Squad  is a globe-trotting, world smashing comic with characters that could only exist in animated form. So, who are The Atomic Victory Squad? 

INVINCIBULL is an alien from a planet where cows are men; think Superman but with a giant udder. Since he's a milk producing male, society at large fears and rejects him. Even when he's saving their life! GARY THE MIME isn't your average mime. His "imaginations" physically manifest, so if Gary points a finger gun in your direction, you'd better duck! ZOOZANNA is a world renowned explorer cursed into the form of several animals... all at once.  BUBBLE MYERS is a recovering drug addict accidentally fused into a billion dollar government super-suit. SHE-GIRL was built as a pleasure-bot then reprogrammed as a sentient, no-nonsense, gadget filled assassin. Lastly there's TRIANGLE MASTER.... he just REALLY likes triangles. 

Say she fights good for a girl. We dare you. 

Click on the PERKS (to the right) to see more details. ↗

NOT Another Superhero Story

Real talk: The world doesn't need more superheroes, but this is no ordinary team. The Atomic Victory Squad  is a very loving satire of the superhero genre. Each team member acts as a metaphor for issues like addiction, race and gender identity, chronic depression and mental health. This series is as much about their personal struggles and relationships as it is about crime fighting... 

On planet Cowtopia, cows milk humans! 

The Team Behind The Team

Superheroes are working behind the scenes, as well: Javier Martin Caba is illustrating & colouring. Andrea Martin Fernandez is assisting with colour. Micah Myers is lettering. Maurice Roy is art directing. Emersen Ziffle is producing hand crafted perks. Joel Hustak is on covers. And more artists, still to come. We can’t do it alone. Hopefully our next member is... YOU?

Friends with facial hair / some of Team AVS: Lowell, Javier, Micah, Maurice & Emersen. 

The Cost of Comics

Think of this site as our official online store. Because that's what it is! A "one stop shop" for all things AVS. This is truly a passion project. All funds raised go directly into production of comics and perks. We need to pay Javier to illustrate and colour the comics and Micah Myers to letter them. Lastly, we've got to print and ship it all to your door! 

Angry Invincibull - Art by Joel Hustak

You Can Be Our Hero, Baby

We wouldn't be here without the amazing support to date. Thanks to you, we get to continue the origin story and ensure it reaches its exciting climax.  

If you can't afford to buy our comics, you are still cool in our books. You can support in others ways like sharing our campaign on social media or by telling your mom and coolest friends about it.  

We’re not just making a comic… we’re launching a universe.

 

ALL backers of our last campaign got bonus mini-posters & trading cards

Thanks for reading. Now let's get the word out and bring these heroes to life!

story:
Please check out the 'updates tab' for more detailed update information.

A huge thank you for all of the support, to our fans who have followed us from the beginning, to new friends and fans who just love the heck out of comics like we do, we cannot do it without you. 

The fun doesn't stop here, Indemand will continue until the print file has been sent off which means our free upgrade goals are still in action, with the next one at $100,00, and remember no matter which perk you selected EVERYONE will receive these upgrades for FREE.

Doomsday Kingdom Volume One follows a mysterious figure in a world long dead. In front of the feeding post, ready to execute his Prisoner in a heinous way, he is forced to face his dark past and relive all of the choices that brought him here.

Having already fulfilled over 3000 website orders, we now bring Doomsday Kingdom to Indiegogo.

Doomsday Kingdom Vol. 1 contains 128 pages for the first time exclusively with Indiegogo collecting Issues 1-5, telling the story of an injured survivor doing whatever it takes to help his family escape a quarantined town overrun by the undead. Caught between gnashing teeth and relocation camps, nowhere seems safe, trapped inside the Doomsday Kingdom! 

Created and Written by Ronny Haze and artist James Milne.

UV BLOODSOAKED COVER UNLOCKED!

(Above: A peek at a page from the latter half of Vol.1  Available in the Original Art Perk)

What's in it for me?

You will receive all the items listed in your chosen perks, along with an exclusive trading card for those who joined the mailing list and backed this campaign. We offer you a premium book totalling 128 pages perfectly bound with the highest quality materials. Your support will also help fund production of Volume 2 and beyond in this on going story of survival with complex characters and passionately crafted plot.

Risks & Challenges

Previously, we have self-published four single comic book issues over the last 2 years, successfully fulfilling over 3,000 individual orders to date! Learning the process along the way we're extremely confident, that we can and will deliver on time. Of course delays with the current situation might come into play but rest assured you will receive it. 

Furthermore, this book is already close to being finished as we launch! By the end of the campaign, our print file will be complete and ready to go for a lightning fast turnaround.

Please note, refunds are automatically granted by indiegogo for up to 14 days. After that period, all sales are final, as we will be going straight to the printers when the campaign closes.

UPGRADES

SECRET UPGRADE #1 *UNLOCKED!* $7500!- Virgin Cover Print for Issue 5. 

SECRET UPGRADE #2 *UNLOCKED!* $8000!  - Virgin Cover Print for Issue 1.

SECRET UPGRADE #3 *UNLOCKED!* $8500!  - Virgin Cover Print for Issue 2.

SECRET UPGRADE #4 *UNLOCKED!* $9000!  - Virgin Cover Print for Issue 5.

SECRET UPGRADE #5 *UNLOCKED!* $9500! - Virgin Cover Print for Issue 4.

SPECIAL COVER UPGRADE *LOCKED!* $10000!

*UNLOCKED!* at $5500 UPGRADED PAPER WEIGHT - All backers will receive their purchased copies of Doomsday Kingdom Vol. 1 with 100lb PREMIUM PAPER, for that high end finish.

*UNLOCKED!* at $7000!  GOLD FOIL STAMPED BOOKMARK- All backers will receive their purchased copies of Doomsday Kingdom Vol. 1 with a beautiful gold stamped bookmark to commemorate this special occasion! 

Artwork may vary slightly plus gold string*

More upgrades to be revealed! We are doing things a little different. Instead of the standard "stretch goals" we will update the campaign with FREE UPGRADES for certain milestones we hit! Leaving some surprises to be revealed, keeping things fresh!

Other Ways To Help Doomsday Kingdom

Word of mouth is equally as important, so get out there, share our URL link on all social media platforms and help us grow our reader base. 

Subscribe to our Youtube Channels:

https://www.youtube.com/user/makeapathpresents

https://www.youtube.com/user/ObservantGames

story:
"There is a universality to this tale of people who feel like outsiders in their own community."

–Graphic Novel Resources

 

 

Welcome to the IndieGoGo campaign to publish Holler #4 by Jeremy Massie!  This fourth issue marks the end of the first major story line.  And if you missed the first three issues, no worries...all four issue are available from this campaign!

Set in the 1990s among the Appalachian Mountains of Virginia, Holler follows the misadventures of four young friends who form a garage band, while navigating the ups and downs of teenage existence. The band is in peril as Mark, Jay, Dave, and Phil are caught up in a beef between their clique "The Grungies" and a clique of rednecks called "The Skanks." The innocent beef escalates into an all out war that threatens the future of the band!

Along with issue four of Holler, you can pick up the first three issues as well!  All with thick card stock covers, with beautiful matte finish.  We are also offering signed comics and original sketches.

Check out these incredible covers for HOLLER #1-4. . .

HOLLER #4 (Cover A)

 

HOLLER #4 (Cover B)

 

HOLLER #3 (Cover A)

 

HOLLER #3 (Cover B)

story_txt:
"There is a universality to this tale of people who feel like outsiders in their own community."
–Graphic Novel Resources
 

 
Welcome to the IndieGoGo campaign to publish Holler #4 by Jeremy Massie!  This fourth issue marks the end of the first major story line.  And if you missed the first three issues, no worries...all four issue are available from this campaign!

Set in the 1990s among the Appalachian Mountains of Virginia, Holler follows the misadventures of four young friends who form a garage band, while navigating the ups and downs of teenage existence. The band is in peril as Mark, Jay, Dave, and Phil are caught up in a beef between their clique "The Grungies" and a clique of rednecks called "The Skanks." The innocent beef escalates into an all out war that threatens the future of the band!

Along with issue four of Holler, you can pick up the first three issues as well!  All with thick card stock covers, with beautiful matte finish.  We are also offering signed comics and original sketches.

Check out these incredible covers for HOLLER #1-4. . .

story:
Short Summary

My name is Michael Adam Jones. I've been doodling and drawing since I can remember and always wanted it to become a career. I co-created a comic series with my sister back in 2001 and it was initially supposed to be a children's book, but turned into so much more.

Now, I love wearing the artist's hat but from time to time, and to get this project off the ground, I've had to wear my business hat and it "doesn't fit well." Basically, all the Library of Congress, ISBN, etc. is a big mess of confusion to be. The good folks at my publisher LuLu will handle all this and turn my work into Book 1! Their Debut Package Program will cover all these bases and be THE final step towards my becoming a published author and cartoonist.

What We Need & What You Get

$2500 is the magic number. It will cover all the legal red tape and get book 1 of Nerds In The Burbs off the ground. With the Debut Package at $2200 and there being minor charges such as taxes, and this kick starter's fees, I've rounded up to a safe $2500. What do you get?! Perks include free shirts, hats, autographed copies, all the way up to being made into a cartoon for a cameo in a future Nerds In The Burbs volume.

The Impact

I think I've put together an entertaining and fun little world, told through drawings. Naturally, I'm biased towards my creation but I'm eager to unleash it upon the world and see where this goes.

Risks & Challenges

What if I don't make my goal of $2500? I'll sell some stuff, take an extra job for a few months - whatever's needed. This project was started by me, it will be finished by me. All perks will still be in effect if the goal is not reached.

Other Ways You Can Help

I fully understand budgets can be pretty tight nowadays, but if you know anyone who had a few bucks to throw around, could you point them this way. :)

Or join the mailing list "The Nerd Herd" at my site www.nerdsintheburbs.com

story:
Vignette

Perchè non pubblichi le tue vignette? Questa domanda è stata - per il sottoscritto - un tormentone per molti anni, finchè un amico, una manciata di mesi fa, non mi ha coinvolto nel suo progetto editoriale www.rovigoindiretta.it, chiedendomi di contribuire come mi pareva. 

Non avendo molto tempo da dedicare ad un'attività giornalistica seria e non volendo sprecare tempo ripassando i comunicati stampa, ho pensato alle vignette. Le vignette sono il mio modo di scrivere editoriali, senza essere prolisso e moralista - due tra i miei peggiori difetti. 

Il libro

Non ho mai attribuito grande valore ai miei sgorbi, tant'è che li disegno su carta da riciclo, che poi finisce, in genere, buttata da qualche parte. Fortunatamente, ho trovato una supplente in autostima nella mia compagna, Francesca, che mi sopporta e supporta da un tot. 

Il libro sarà soprattutto un progetto per fare altre cose, collaborare con persone, generare altri progetti. Almeno questa è la speranza.

Il libro è praticamente finito (speriamo). In questa fase, sondiamo l'interesse del pubblico per decidere quanto diffonderlo. E' tutto nel vostre mani. E a proposito di mani...

Quattro mani

Intanto attorno al libro è nata una nuova collaborazione. Interpellato il mio amico Svarion per chiedergli consigli professionali su come impaginare i miei scarabocchi di merda, si è offerto di farlo lui. Anzi, di ricalcarli tutti in vettoriale. Alla fine, il risultato è stato trasformare degli sghiribizzi frettolosi tracciati su fogli di carta sporchi in disegni perlomeno decorosi. Non è poco: è come, per dire, uno che fa le matite e uno che inchiostra. Per questo, alla fine, il libro uscirà come co-autori. Ne sono molto orgoglioso.

story: Based on the journal of the late Maj. Gen. David Sawyer, Tiger on the Storm honors the 23rd Tactical Fighter Wing and their service in Operation: Desert Storm. A few of the creators responsible for Korean War, vol. 2  and Untold Stories from Iraq and Afghanistan reunited to collaborate on this project- Valerie Finnigan (Hero by Force, Worst Case Scenario: Outbreak), cover artist Dan Monroe (Art of a Dragon, Dennis the Wild Bull), and penciller/inker Richard O'Hara (Second Dawn, Futurians Return). Just in time for the 25th anniversary of Desert Storm, you can also join in, help cover the expenses of creating and printing this book, and see that this part of history is never forgotten. Funds raised beyond what will cover those costs will go to Heroes Fallen Studios, a non-profit dedicated to providing a safe, nonjudgmental forum for veterans and their families to share their stories and educate the general public.

story:
My name is Matthew Brown… I started to get cartoons published and moved to Montreal in the early ‘90s, where I was part of the underground comix scene. After university I travelled to India a few times and became a teacher… I missed comics and made a return to the Toronto zine scene in the early 2000’s.  However, a stint in architecture school completely burned me out, and it took my old publisher from Montreal, Editions TRIP Comix to convince me I was still a contender.  I returned to graphic novels in 2012, and made books 1-4 of THE CLIFF saga, feeling the fire burning again.

This is really my passion.  I’ve got a lot of ground to cover—it’s a different world than when I started—graphic novels are finally being recognized for the expressive medium they are.  I’ve got myself back up to speed and beyond where I was, and I’ve got a lot to share.

There was a break for me to return to architecture school and complete my Master’s of Architecture degree as a graphic novel called ARCHITECTURE DEPARTMENT at the end of 2015…  actually, it's a prequel to THE CLIFF! I've gotten it completed, which was no small task—99 pages of artwork + 9 pages of research notes—now I know I can do it!  And I've got to go on.

My skills honed and my heart is racing—to answer all the questions about Mutt Blue’s quest for meaning which began in THE CLIFF Books 1-4—his apprenticeship under the weird cult icon/private detective Poopsie the Penguin—and Mutt’s penchant for poor romantic choices… as he travels to meet the bearded bureaucrat who runs the universe: “The King,” in this final chapter THE CLIFF. 

The graphic novel is an important medium… a unique combination of words and images with its own language—but it is not yet available to everyone.  I’d like to bring in the comics I loved so much growing up—Charles Schulz’s Peanuts, Frank Miller’s Ronin, Moebius’ Airtight Garage, and the brilliant work of Chester Brown, Robert Crumb and Art Spiegelman and more… but I’d also like to bring in the worlds of painting, architecture, literature, spirituality and psychology to the comics I make.  One day, I’d like to start an educational project bringing graphic novels, all their heritage and potential, to the greater world.

For now, if I could combine the passion and the job into one thing: making comics, then my dream would come true.  And you will have a nice graphic novel to hold in your hands—something like you’ve never seen before!

For anyone donating more than $50, The Book will be sent to them in the mail.

For anyone donating more than $100, The Book will be sent to them in the mail with a character sketch included.

For anyone donating more than $200, The Book will be sent to them in the mail with a character sketch included + one page of original story artwork.

Even if you can’t contribute, please just spread the word!  Keep an eye on my comic book blog, where I post weekly updates –

www.ambientzero.blogspot.com

Thanks!!!

story:
The Styx

My name is AlanaRae VG I am a senior at Southwest University of Visual Arts in Albuquerque, NM. I am focusing my degree of Illustration on Comic Books and Sequential art. I came up with the graphic novel "The Styx" After my grandfather passed away from aggressive cancer shortly after I had a breast cancer scare of my own. This prompted me to question what comes after death, or what the process of dying does to the people around them. 

I created a story in which an 8 year old boy named Wit Mortimer falls into coma after being diagnosed with cancer. He has to meet up with a parent like spirit named Charon while they cross the RIVER STYX to get the mysterious door on the other side. Wit learns to stand up and fight on his own, while Charon learns when it's time to let go.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise money for printing and distribution costs, I am offering some awesome perks to go along with your donations, they range from character sheets all the way to you named as a producer in the book! If I don't reach my goal I will still hope to get my book published and distributed locally.

The Impact

Diseases are heart shaking and impossible to understand. Living with something that impairs your day to day normal life is hard. Understanding death and what it means may be even harder. My goal for this graphic novel is to give hope and inspire people who struggle day to day with mental or physical Diseases, and show them that it's never the end, there's always a way to make the best of a situation, and even save you from it.

Risks & Challenges

I was diagnosed with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome when I was 5 years old, a ligament disability that restricts my movement and can cause serious medical problems, many of which are heart related. When I was 21 I had two breast cancer scares which in turn had me in the hospital for two surgeries, I want to show people that you are stronger that what the doctors say you are. You are capable of beating the odds.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, I GET IT! I'm a poor college student. But please share with your friends, and get the word out.

story:
When you pledge please click "Get this perk" by the reward you would like, if you click "back it" it just counts as a donation!

What is this?

The first purpose of this campaign is to raise money to help fund the launch of Graphic Contents a brand new subscription club exclusively for indie, creator owned and small press comics in exchange for this you will receive early access and comic book rewards! 

The second goal of this campaign is to find like minded people for collaboration, creators, fans, publishers we need and want your input and support.

About Me

Hi i'm Louis Harris I've been a comic book reader, fan & collector for over 25 years, I started out like most British kids reading stories about Dennis The Menace & Desperate Dan in The Beano & Dandy from there I moved on to American comics from Marvel & DC where I would go into the city to the comic book shops and would be amazed by all the different stories I remember the first time I walked in and saw a Death Of Superman TPB and thought "How can Superman die!" I was hooked...

From there I read everything I could get my hands of mostly staying within the confides of characters I knew from the big two, I had been reading for a few years and would spend Saturday mornings going through the discount longboxes at the comic shop to get the most amount of comics as possible with my pocket money, thats where I discovered Image, Vertigo (although a DC imprint had a very indie (and British) vibe in the 90s), Dark Horse and indie comics.

Since then i've always sought out indie comics and graphic novels, as I grew older I became bored with the comics from the big two and now exclusively read indie and creator owned comics. 

So I'm launching Graphic Contents to help others discover comics that are new and different, for some getting to a comic shop is difficult because of distance or accessibility, Graphic Contents will also save time by bringing you the best indie comics has to offer each month as well as providing members great value through group buying and passing on the savings.

What You Get

So what will you get every month? 

5-7 Comics or Graphic Novels/TPBs which will always be from creator owned, small press & indie publishers.

All comics will always be 1st issues (volumes for OGN/TPB), one shots or at the start of a story arc which is a good jumping on point we won't send you books in the middle of a story, ever. 

We will also include bonus items including comic book and geek related trading cards (vintage & modern), Variant Issues, Zines, Stickers, Posters, Keyrings,  Bookmarks, Posters, Toys etc obviously this will be dependent on how much we can raise and how many members we have, the more members we get the greater the buying power so the better the bonus items will be! 

The Perks

We have perks to suit every budget from $20 to try us out for a month to $11,111 for a lifetime subscription!

The first box is guaranteed to have at least 2 full graphic novels/TPBs and the retail value will greatly exceed the cost.

We are starting with shipping being offered to USA & UK but if you are from another country and are interested in pledging just pop me an email Louis@GraphicContents.co.uk and we'll add shipping options/perk for your country.

 

What we need & overfunding goals

The money raised will go towards web design and the cost of the boxes, items included.

If the campaign exceeds its goals then we would like the overspend to go towards review boxes for bloggers & press (because the faster we grow the better we will be for our members), custom boxes, signed items, variants, digital downloads, 

The Impact

Graphic Contents will create another outlet for indie creators to get their work out there, be seen & to sell comic books and actually make a living doing what they love! 

It will also create an outlet for fans who for whatever reason be it time or that they don't have a LCS near to them to get indie comics delivered to their door.

We believe in freedom of speech and expression and will be non partisan, we will allow creators of all political, idealogical or religious (or non) freedom to do what they want we will not edit or attempt to censor anyone, if you are not open to ideas, other points of view and are easily offended we recommend you don't subscribe.

As Graphic Contents grows we want to support indie comics as much as possible so hope to launch a monthly anthology exclusive to our members where up and coming writers and artists will get paid and published.

 

Other Ways You Can Help, join us! 

We would like your money and for you to join us now on this journey, but if you can't support financially right now please support by sharing on your social networks and please go follow and like us on social media at:

Facebook.com/GraphicContentsComics

Twitter.com/GraphicCComics

Instagram.com/GraphicContents 

And if you would like to be involved more hands on we would love some help with:

Web Design

Design

Marketing 

Outreach and going to cons and talking up the greatness of indie comics! 

How to submit your comic to us

We're not a publisher so you would have to already have your book with a publisher or self published, you must own all rights and permissions to sell your book.

Submit via email (pdf) to Louis@GraphicContents.co.uk

Submit physical copies: Graphic Contents, 52 Saxon Way, Bradley Stoke, Bristol, BS32 9AS

We will not be looking for artists or writers to send in scripts or unfinished pages, only fully finished comics that you have the right to sell

If you have any questions or want to get in touch for any reason please contact here, our social pages or email me directly at Louis@GraphicContents.co.uk Thanks! :D

It will also create an outlet for fans who for whatever reason be it time or that they don't have a LCS near to them to get indie comics delivered to their door.
We believe in freedom of speech and expression and will be non partisan, we will allow creators of all political, idealogical or religious (or non) freedom to do what they want we will not edit or attempt to censor anyone, if you are not open to ideas, other points of view and are easily offended we recommend you don't subscribe.
As Graphic Contents grows we want to support indie comics as much as possible so hope to launch a monthly anthology exclusive to our members where up and coming writers and artists will get paid and published.
 

Other Ways You Can Help, join us! 
We would like your money and for you to join us now on this journey, but if you can't support financially right now please support by sharing on your social networks and please go follow and like us on social media at:
Facebook.com/GraphicContentsComics
Twitter.com/GraphicCComics
Instagram.com/GraphicContents 
And if you would like to be involved more hands on we would love some help with:
Web Design
Design
Marketing 
Outreach and going to cons and talking up the greatness of indie comics! 
How to submit your comic to us
We're not a publisher so you would have to already have your book with a publisher or self published, you must own all rights and permissions to sell your book.
Submit via email (pdf) to Louis@GraphicContents.co.uk
Submit physical copies: Graphic Contents, 52 Saxon Way, Bradley Stoke, Bristol, BS32 9AS
We will not be looking for artists or writers to send in scripts or unfinished pages, only fully finished comics that you have the right to sell
If you have any questions or want to get in touch for any reason please contact here, our social pages or email me directly at Louis@GraphicContents.co.uk Thanks! :D

story:
Short Summary

My name is AJ Ryder and I am excited and proud to be heading up the Samurai Cowboy campaign. If you are here you are probably a huge comic book fan just like me. I have done a lot of things (College football player, WWE wrestler, actor, writer) but nothing compares to being part of this team and executing a life long dream of making a comic.  As you can see from what I've done I have a special interest in entertaining others and we've done that so far with Samurai Cowboy.  With your help you can help entertainment continue. I know the story and there is much more the world will want to see. The story as is, is fantastic but with the experience and the great fans comments as well as my angle, this story continues to evolve to something truly special. It would mean the world to me as well as the team involved to be able to keep producing this comic.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise a minimum of 6500$ to get the first graphic novel printed. Anything over that will go towards the ultimate goal of two more graphic novels and hopefully a show or movie. 
  • The perks are great because most of them we already have or (Fingers crossed) will be making. If you make a contribution to us we can be assured you get something that actually exists NOW.  We have cool perks as well such as Skype calls and limited edition things that will only be available for a limited time no matter what.
  • If we somehow do not reach our goals we will fulfill what people ordered and work on a bonus for the people who pledged for a future product.

The Impact

I can't stress enough that I truly believe that this story could be told, printed, or shot over and over throughout the years. You can be part of something that you can not only have an original piece of but look back and say "I helped that, I am part of the Samurai Cowboy Team."  

This is a very tough industry and we all understand that but the team on Samurai Cowboy is filled with hard workers, creative monsters, award winners, and persistent over achievers. Our resumes alone will show you how resilient we are and if we put our mind to something it gets done, or will get close with an amazing product. The problem is money always gets in the way. We all know that we can only do so much with a limited budget.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute. We get it better than anyone. We appreciate anything even if in the form of support.  Here's are other things you can do.

- Post our campaign!!!!  

- Visit the website. Follow us.

-Buy a book (When you can)

- Give us a shout. Sometimes a nice "Keep it up" goes a long way. Believe me!!!

And that's all there is to it.

Thanks again so much.

story:
Gone but not forgotten...would you search the very depths of hell in a quest against evil for the one you love?

 

Harlem a community rich with history in the midst of rebuilding and renewal, a small section of the bustling metropolis that is New York city.

 

A city hit with a sudden rush of missing persons going largely unnoticed among the throngs of society. A mother has spent years relentlessly searching for her daughter, with no one to help. She cries that her child and the other missing were taken by a demon! Has this beast returned or is the women insane? She begs for help, but there is no one who will listen to her...

 

or is there? Let me reacquaint you with Simone Summerton, a hard working nurse from Harlem. when Simone's younger brother Reilly becomes one of the missing the tale takes a twist.

Enter the elusive Blakemore, with his suave charm and sharp perception, almost as sharp as his weapon of choice, can he and Simone solve the mystery?

 

The investigation leads them to dark shadows and secrets, bringing them face to face with a powerful ancient evil...the body thief...

 

What happens next? To find the answer to that, we have to make the book!

Can Blakemore and Simone defeat the Body thief or will they become its next victims? Was tracking it down a really bad idea? There's only one way to find out!

 

20+ Page full color comic book!

  • The Comic will be a direct follow up to the Blakemore film available on Amazon Video
  • Special poster that will only be available in this issue

 

The Characters:

 

BLAKEMORE

A mysterious  alien traveler recognized on many worlds as the greatest living swords-person. He posses powers and physical strength far beyond the reach of regular humans. Through defeating other sword users in combat over the years Blakemore has gained an arsenal of blades, but his greatest is the Sword Bjfor. an ancient and extremely powerful blade of divine origin. It is the influence of this weapon that compelled him to defend the weak and fight for just causes.

 

SIMONE SUMMERTON 

Intelligent, kind hearted and strong willed, the Harlem native could have succeeded at many professions but she chose nursing because of her desire to help others. After tragically losing her parents in an  accident a decade earlier, Simone also became the guardian of her younger brother Reilly . nearly a year ago Blakemore battled evil creatures known as Jvat-ootogs, that were draining life force from a patient at Simone's hospital. It was during this battle that Blakemore and Simone's paths crossed and the two quickly formed a "bond". After that encounter Blakemore invited Simone to join him on his travels and adventures.

 

MILA TURGENEV

The mother of a child who was taken by the body thief. Since the time of her daughters abduction Mila has searched for her daughter and told all who would listen about the true nature of her child's kidnapper, Unfortunately there is no one who believes her story...until now.

 

SNEAK PREVIEW:

 

 

 

Two cover choices

Cover A

 

Variant cover

 

Risk and Obstacles

Whenever you set out to do anything artistic the main obstacle is always yourself, do you have the will to finish? Yes we do! Our team pulled together and overcame every possible obstacle to make the "Blakemore" film, and we have that same determination to continue the story in comic-book form, so in short we are doing this!

 

 

 Ways you can help

The challenge has always been about production and sharing and this is where we are grateful for your assistance. We invite you to become a part of the team by contributing or even just sharing our project with others, together we can make something truly special.

story:
STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED:

$14,000 - Sketches and lore pages added to comic. Lampblack #1 now 32 pages!

$16,000 - Gold foil title for both covers!

LAMPBLACK is a 24-page comic, the first in a limited series written by Camille Longley, with art by Pablo Peppino, colors by Damián Peñalba, and letters by Joel Saavedra. It's an oversized 8.5x11 inch landscape comic in a sweeping cinematic style. Lampblack has everything you expect in a coming-of-age story: horrifying ink monsters, wondrous forbidden magic, American Sign Language, runaways, and a cat (of course). 

Lampblack is a story of friendship, family, and war, set in a fantastical world depicted in stunning detail. If you're a fan of Studio Ghibli, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them, Sabrina, or Pokémon, you will love exploring the world of Lampblack--a place filled with incredible creatures and fascinating magic.

The story follows Mabel Aoki and Sterling Cohen, and is set in a charming early 20th century world.

 

Mabel's immigrant family can barely scratch out a living in their backwater fishing village. When her mother loses her job, Mabel knows their only hope is in the magic they brought from the motherland. 

Mabel is an ink girl, born with the ability to bring anything she paints to life. It's a dangerous gift, one she is forbidden to use. But she can't put down her brush. She won't. She was born to paint, and the ink allows her to create beauty and magic out of her simple life. She will save her family with her art, whatever the cost. 

Sterling Cohen is Deaf, and the only heir to Caraday's largest industrial conglomerate. His father is a tyrant--in commerce and at home. But Sterling dreams of becoming a soldier, and wants desperately to abandon the family business to serve his country.

 Mabel will unwittingly unleash lampblack's dark magic on her world, endangering her family and her home. Together, Sterling and Mabel must find a way to defeat the monsters Mabel has created and make a new, better world for themselves. 

Page One

Page Two

Page Three

LAMPBLACK is like nothing you've seen before.

This enormous landscape comic has a wrap-around cover that measures 22 inches by 8.5 inches. 

 Its cinematic format brings the story to life in stunning detail.

All comics will be shipped in Gemini mailers so they arrive safe and sound. 

Get magic delivered straight to your doorstep!

Shipping Timetable:

May 6- Kickstarter Ends

End of May - Art is completed

June - Book is formatted and printed

July-August - Books ship from China to US

September - Rewards ship to backers

UK Backers: Because of Brexit, all tiers and add-ons will reflect VAT tax which is included in the price of shipping.

$20 11x17 inch 2-ply Cherry Wood Map

Gorgeous wooden paper you have to feel to believe.

 $20 Kawaii Lampblack t-shirt designed by Pablo Peppino and available in standard unisex sizes. 

$12 Poko the Cat Pin (1.5 Inch)

$15 Ink Blot Pin (2 inch)

Both pins are gold hard enamel with double backing so they won't fall off. 

$15 11x17 inch Watercolor Poster by Germán Peralta Carrasoni

Germán is an Argentinian comic artist who has worked for Marvel on several titles such as Totally Awesome Hulk, Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D, Moon Knight, Thanos, and Black Panther. His work with DC includes Green Lantern, Suicide Squad, and Green Arrow.

 $25 ASL Variant Cover

Our variant cover is illustrated by Deaf artist Brittany Castle and features our Deaf character Sterling signing BLACK and PAINT, the ASL equivalent for Lampblack. This is a limited edition variant cover and each copy will include the Poko the Cat pin and a bookplate. Bookplates are hand-stamped world travelers, signed by Camille in the US and Pablo in Spain.

Brittany is the owner of 58 Creativity (www.58creativity.com) which sells American Sign Language art and products. Her artwork is inspired by her Deaf culture and the use of sign language to create a visual, emotional connection in her work.

Camille writes fantastical tales of magic and adventure and is the author of The Flameskin Chronicles. She studied at Brigham Young University and lives in the Bay Area.

Pablo is a comic book artist from Argentina. He holds a degree in Fine Arts and approaches illustration and sequential art in a strongly cinematic fashion.

Damián is a comic book colorist based in Argentina. He's been working in the industry for the last decade in titles such as The Big Idea, Melody Gear Heart, Stardrifter Odyssey, Berserkers, Lovecraft P.I., Coronary, Downcast, Six-Gun Gorilla and Packhound.

Joel is a comic book letterer and graphic designer based in Argentina. He's been working in the industry for over a decade in titles such as Berserkers, Lovecraft PI, Perfect 10, and Yi Soon Shin.

Kelly is a writer with a degree from Saint Joseph's University. She enjoys writing about comics, animation, and movies and has a sincere passion for connecting topics to underlying mythology and folklore.

June Ann, a Deaf native ASL user, is mother of six daughters and works at the University of North Florida as an ASL instructor. She enjoys Florida living and traveling.

He's been working in the industry for over a decade in titles such as Berserkers, Lovecraft PI, Perfect 10, and Yi Soon Shin.Kelly is a writer with a degree from Saint Joseph's University. She enjoys writing about comics, animation, and movies and has a sincere passion for connecting topics to underlying mythology and folklore.June Ann, a Deaf native ASL user, is mother of six daughters and works at the University of North Florida as an ASL instructor. story:
**Updated Title & Synopsis:

Finnian and the Seven Mountains

Terror reigns in Ireland in the ninth century. Vikings continue to pillage the countryside, killing villagers and taking precious treasures back to their homeland.​

Seeking to avenge the death of his parents, a young man named Finnian leaves his monastic school to find a legendary sword that has the supernatural power to defeat all evil.​

To find the weapon, he must travel to an isolated rock in the middle of the sea, known as Skellig Michael. This distant island off the southern coast of Ireland is where it was last seen…

Stretch Goals: If we go above and beyond our goal, it will greatly affect the production of this and future comic books. At 200% ($11,250) the comic book will be delivered 1-2 months sooner. At 300% ($22,500), 2-3 months sooner and we will begin production on the second issue of the series. 

The Comic Book: In the midst of the 9th century a small remote monastic community lives independently from the world atop a rocky island off the coast of Ireland. Life on the island is extremely difficult and few men are admitted to join. Most are turned away upon arrival.

Finnian, a fiery and adventurous young eighteen year old boy from the mainland, rebelliously leaves a monastic school with the intention of joining the monks on the distant isle.

What happens next is most unexpected and through a series of mysterious events the young boy is caught up into an adventure he never thought possible.

The Creative Team: Writer Philip Kosloski and artist Michael LaVoy are teaming up to bring you THE LAST MONKS OF SKELLIG MICHAEL. Philip Kosloski is a writer well known for his accessible articles on topics of spirituality and Church history at Aleteia.orgas well as his best selling non-fiction book (The Last Monks of Skellig Michael) upon which this project is based. Michael LaVoy is an up-and-coming artist known for his stunning Living Sparks of God coloring book for kids.

Jim Fern will be designing the cover artwork and is an active adviser on this project, ensuring a quality comic book. Jim became an inker for Marvel in 1983, working on various Spider-Man titles. He later started penciling as a fill-in artist on titles such as Amazing Spider-Man, X-Men Annual #13 (where he co-designed and drew Jubilee in her first story), Transformers, and Wolverine. Fern also started working with DC Comics as an artist on such titles as Legion '90, Adventures of Superman, Batman, Detective COMICS, and co-created the series Scarlett. He is also co-creater and designer for Crossing Midnight with Mike Carey published by DC’s Vertigo line. In addition to his comic book work, Jim has worked as a Walt Disney World artist for the Disney Design Group.

John Webber is a former animator with Walt Disney Feature Animation. He worked as a ruff animation artist for Pocahontas and Hercules as well as a character animator for Mulan, Lilo and Stitch, Brother Bear and other Disney films. John is currently the Associate Chair of the animation department at the Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD). John is an adviser on this project and assists with story development among other things.

Campaign: Money raised during this campaign will go directly into production costs for the first issue of the THE LAST MONKS OF SKELLIG MICHAEL series, as well as the fulfillment of the many rewards. You will only be charged if we hit our target goal. If the campaign is successful, we will dive right into production and work hard to complete this amazing comic book so that you can have it in your hands in a very short time.

Page 3

Concept Art

Concept Art

story:
Il fumetto e la musica si sono sempre intrecciati tra loro.

Innumerevoli musicisti hanno collaborato con altrettanti fumettisti per creare la loro identità (basti pensare ai Gorillaz). Numerosi sono anche gli autori che hanno realizzato graphic novel dedicate a gruppi musicali, cantanti e cantautori che hanno plasmato la loro visione artistica. E infine, quanti fumettisti sono anche musicisti e dividono il loro tempo tra chine e concerti?

Nasce così l’idea di realizzare una sorta di featuring tra 11 artisti che renderanno omaggio in modo unico a tutte queste relazioni che intercorrono tra il fumetto e la musica, creando così la prima PLAYLIST a fumetti:

 

This is PLAYLIST

 

_______________________________

 

This is Playlist è un volume di 160 pagine a colori, in formato 16,8x24, nato da una collaborazione tra Amianto Comics e Lorenzo Ferrara, musicista e fumettista.

Dopo il successo del crowfunding BOLIDE e 5 anni di attività nel circuito dell'autoproduzione a fumetti, Amianto Comics ha deciso di scommettere ancora una volta sul potere e l'autonomia dei lettori.

Tutti gli 11 autori, elencati sotto, hanno già consegnato i loro fumetti, ma dopo un anno in cui le fiere del fumetto sono state annullate a causa della pandemia, la realizzazione dell'antologia non è per niente scontata...

Infatti, This is a Playlist vedrà la luce SOLO se raggiungeremo l'obiettivo fissato di 5000€.

L'unico modo per ottenere una copia di THIS IS A PLAYLIST è quello di sostenerci attraverso questo crowdfunding e di farlo entro 30 GIORNI.

Se raggiungeremo il goal, il volume verrà recapitato direttamente a casa tua entro fine 2021.

Ma quali sono gli autori e le storie racchiuse nella prima Playlist musicale a fumetti?

__________________________

 

REGULAR SIZE MONSTER

LA MERAVIGLIOSA FIGLIA DEL BOIA
OTTOBRE 1973 - Emilio, Lindo, Giorgio e Daniele Caramella sono in pellegrinaggio con un furgoncino Alfa Romeo lungo il leggendario hippie trail. Destinazione: Kathmandu. Viaggiano assieme a Penelope e Loretta, rispettivamente sorella minore e fidanzata di Giorgio, Rossana, la ragazza di Daniele, e Topochech, un misterioso viaggiatore ucraino che faceva l’autostop in Libano...

 

BENNI

COMICS AND BISCUITS
In un mondo dove esseri umani e animali antropomorfi convivono, un gruppo di giovani punk si ritrova un venerdì sera a bere. Dopo aver letto un fumetto iniziano a suonare come non mai, ma a un certo punto qualcuno bussa alla porta...

 

ROBERTO D'AGNANO

VILLAGGIO DI RIABILITAZIONE PER CHI ASCOLTA LA MUSICA MALE
"Avete presente quando state andando ad una serata con i vostri amici, siete in macchina, volete pompare la musica a palla per caricarvi ma uno di loro ABBASSA LA MUSICA? Oppure, quanto sono fastidiose quelle persone che mettono una canzone e dopo pochi secondi la cambiano, magari proprio sul ritornello? ARGH!
Beh, il nostro villaggio turistico di riabilitazione per menomati musicali è ESATTAMENTE ciò che fa per voi..."

 

LOUSEEN SMITH

VELOURIA
Lidia ha 17 anni e fra poco dovrà decidere cosa fare della propria vita. Attorno a lei tutto sembra avere così tanto senso, tutti cercano una risposta, una motivazione, tutto ha uno scopo preciso. Tutto è al proprio posto e la cosa la irrita. Non vuole vivere così, ma non sa come fare...

 

ALBHEY LONGO

APPUNTAMENTO AL LUX MAJESTIC
Italia anni 60. Un giovane uomo ben vestito scappa tra la folla mentre alcuni uomini in completo lo inseguono...

 

FAT GOMEZ

POP IS DEAD
In un seminterrato disastrato di una imprecisata metropoli un gruppo hardcore sta provando, annoiando i vicini del piano di sopra. Tra questi c'è una vecchia che, come ogni volta, scende le scale incazzata per cercare di farli smettere. Questa volta però le cose prendono una piega molto differente...

 

NICO ROSSETTI

EXTREME DAMAGE MECHA
In un Giappone futuristico, il malefico professore Jin Fukamachi sfida il dottor Tatsuro e il suo assistente e nipote, Hiro Yoshimura, a una battaglia tra mecha. I loro robottoni però non sono ferraglia qualsiasi: sfruttando le frequenze inserite all’interno della loro CPU possono infatti sferrare colpi letali...

 

LUIGI ZITELLI

UNA GIORNATA STORTA
Marco sta tornando a casa sconfortato dopo una giornata in cui tutto sembra
andare nel verso sbagliato. Mentre sta scrivendo un messaggio alla compagna, inizia a sentire una musica che risuona in lontananza...

 

THOMAS KIKU

STORIA BREVE DI UN ARTISTA VERO
Daniel Johnston non era intonato, non sapeva suonare e non faceva parte della scena musicale. Proprio per questo Daniel Johnston era un artista vero...

 

NOVA

LEGGE DELL'ATTRAZIONE
Il simile attrae il simile, i pensieri diventano cose e tutto ciò che otteniamo nella vita, lo attiriamo noi stessi. In tutto questo, che è la meravigliosa legge dell'attrazione il cantante di Satan Nostrils (death core scontento da Malmo), trova un tenero cucciolo. 

 

AMIANTICI

(Alessandro Benassi, Matteo Polloni, Federico Galeotti)

MORTO DI NOIA
Luigi Tenco, un artista che fino alla fine ha cercato di farsi conoscere attraverso le sue canzoni, inutilmente...

_______________________________

 

This is Playlist Digital Edition

Per chi ama il proprio tablet.

Questo perk contiene la versione digitale del fumetto e ti permette comunque di sostenere il progetto.

This is Playlist Standard Edition

Per chi non ama i fronzoli.

La versione cartacea base di This is Playlist. [Spese di spedizione comprese nel prezzo]

This is Playlist Deluxe Edition

Per chi non si distingue dalla massa.

La versione cartacea di This is Playlist con Variant Cover di Regular Size Monster, spilla e stampa in edizione limitata e in più tutti gli eventuali stretch goal. [Spese di spedizione comprese nel prezzo]

This is Playlist Blu Edition

Per chi ama le antologie a tema.

La versione cartacea di This is Playlist con Variant Cover di Regular Size Monster, spilla e stampa in edizione limitata, tutti gli eventuali stretch goal e Amianto BLU, l'ultima antologia targata Amianto Comics. [Spese di spedizione comprese nel prezzo]

This is Playlist Absolute Edition

Per chi vuole solo il meglio.

La versione cartacea di This is Playlist con Variant Cover di Regular Size Monster, la t-shirt da concerto targata This is Playlist, spilla e stampa in edizione limitata e in più tutti gli eventuali stretch goal. [Spese di spedizione comprese nel prezzo]

This is Playlist Vinyl Edition

Per quelli che "Se sali da me ti faccio vedere la collezione di vinili".

La versione cartacea di This is Playlist con Variant Cover di Regular Size Monster, la t-shirt da concerto targata This is Playlist, spilla e stampa in edizione limitata e in più tutti gli eventuali stretch goal. E in aggiunta un limitatissimo VINILE di This is Playlist.  [Spese di spedizione comprese nel prezzo]

___________________________

Se insieme riusciremo a superare l'obiettivo dei 5000€, in serbo per tutti i nostri funder dal perk Deluxe in su, ci saranno delle GRANDI SOPRESE.

Per scoprirle non dovete far altro che sbloccare gli STRETCH GOAL che abbiamo progettato!

____________________________

La maggior parte dei fondi servirà a pagare gli autori, a coprire le spese di stampa e la produzione dei gadget che allegheremo ai vari perk. Il resto verrà speso in tasse Indiegogo, packaging per la spedizione e spese promozionali sui social network. Una quota coprirà le spese di contabilità e amministrazione di Amianto Comics.

____________________________

Idea di : Lorenzo Ferrara

Realizzazione Crowdfunding: AlMaFè (Alessandro Benassi, Matteo Polloni, Federico Galeotti) e Lorenzo Ferrara

Progetto grafico: Lorenzo Ferrara

 

____________________________

Per qualsiasi dubbio o domanda consultate la sezione FAQ, in alternativa potete contattarci durante e dopo la campagna attraverso la sezione COMMENTI, all'indirizzo email amiantocomics@gmail.com, tramite il nostro sito www.amiantocomics.com e i nostri canali social.

 

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/amiantocomics/

INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/amiantocomics/

TWITTER: https://twitter.com/amiantocomics
