story:
All items are now IN STOCK and NOW SHIPPING!

2019 marks the 10th anniversary of the Tara Normal webcomic, and to celebrate I’ve collected the complete series into a beautiful, 152 page full-color book.

Written and illustrated by Howie Noel. Howie is a professional freelance illustrator and writer. His works include the popular paranormal comic series, Tara Normal, his graphic memoir about anxiety, Float and his first graphic novel Mr. Scootles. He recently colored the tribute to Stan Lee published in the New York Times. Noel's freelance illustration clients include T-Mobile and Medicare and is an award-winning graduate of Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, NY.

Tara Normal is a paranormal detective who solves supernatural mysteries with the help of her potato chip loving, interdimensional traveling, best friend – Shadowman.

Tara Normal: The Complete Webcomic Series includes 5 of the most thrilling cases of Tara's investigative career. From creepy talking dolls to adorable zombie dogs, Tara bravely battles every bizarre challenge that comes her way. 

There's even an alternate timeline version of herself: "Evil" Tara Normal!

Inspired by all the spooky movies I watched growing up in the 1980's on Up All Night with Rhonda Shear, Commander USA's Groovie Movies and USA's Saturday Nightmares, Tara Normal features creepy stories but told with tons of humor and colorful art. Our hero isn't afraid of the monsters hiding under her bed.

The spirit of Tara Normal is that anything can - and does -happen in this book. If I thought of it, I put it in there.

That’s why Tara encounters such fun characters as Baby Cthulhu, Painbow Fright, the Goatman, Frankenstein Lawyer, a cemetery filled with the zombie versions of 80’s celebrities, and a 70 foot tall Teddy Roosevelt…who carries a trident and lives under the Baltimore Harbor. 

Below are a few pages from the collection. You can preview more art pages from the book at my website.

Thank you.

I couldn’t create my book - and have copies to sell at the shows to new readers -without your help. Through the past 3 successful Kickstarter campaigns, you’ve helped me continue creating and drawing original, independent comic book stories.

Thank you for celebrating 10 years of Tara Normal with me.

story:
What's it about?

Angry Squad is an action, adventure, superhero story featuring Angry Fred, a grumpy old “go-to-guy” and his team of trigger-happy counterparts.


What do you Exactly Get?

  • 40 pages in full color
  • Saddle-stitched printed on high-quality gloss paper
  • A choice of 2 variant covers
  • Digital Deluxe PDF
  • The book is 100% complete!
  • Bonus goodies available when checking out!

 


Readers with their Angry Squad Books and Angry Merch!
 


 

 

Creative Team



Creating stories is in Lucas Scheffel's blood. He's an Australian-based filmmaker who has a hunger for creating comic books. The Angry Squad comic is his debut comic, which introduces Angry Fred, a character Lucas' late father Fred played in some of his early filmmaking exploits. Lucas loves spending time with his family and enjoys watching and listening to his idol, Elvis Presley.



Nikita Vasilchuk hails from Kyiv in Ukraine. He’s a passionate illustrator who works with a variety of international advertising companies. He loves exploring and learning new creative processes, such as painting with oils and illustrating Vikings. His hobbies include playing tabletop RPGs and hiking in the alps.



Martin Pouso is a freelance illustrator who loves everything 80s in comics and movies. He publishes and participates in as many indie comics as he can, loves following his favourite wrestling champions as well as skateboarding his way through the streets of Uruguay.
 

    Why am I making this book?

    Creating stories has always been a love of mine, I've made various films over the years, but comic books felt like the next natural step to keep my creative juices flowing. I grew up reading comics, I'm a lifelong comic book collector, and I've always wanted to create a comic book.

    I come from a diverse and creative family, and telling stories is in our blood. I created the Angry Fred character with my late father through a series of film projects that hit a high point with a zombie action epic called 'The Counterpart'. 

    My father was my hero, and he encompassed a larger-than-life personality that all great action-adventure heroes have. Angry Squad is a love letter to honour my late father's creative legacy; it's a story I'd like to keep reinventing and share with the world.


    Risks & Challenges

    As you are already aware, this project is close to my heart. My goal is to make sure that every backer leaves this experience satisfied and excited about the next installment of the Angry Fred universe.

    The Angry Squad: Code Angry is 100% COMPLETE!

    The biggest risk is an unforeseen delay in shipping to our international backers from Australia, especially as we're in the middle of an epidemic.

    If you have any questions or concerns that I may not have covered, please feel free to message me. I want to make your involvement in my project as rewarding as possible.

story:
Who am I?

Hey all, the name's Andre.  I'm a 25 year old guy with Cerebral Palsy, a physical disability that affects my muscles. I am also a blogger, writer, video game lover, and the creator and artist of Starkeeper, a new series of sci-fi comics. Starkeeper is about Cal, a bullied and disabled teen, and his story is so damn important to me. It's my way of showing people that it can get better!


What is our campaign all about?

Richard and I are hoping to raise $5000 for promotional purposes. Even if we don't get to our goal, all funds received will go towards  advertising on websites such as Goodreads and in international magazines, funding to attend book fairs, (hopefully.) and share my message with as many people as possible.


At its heart, Starkeeper is a story of acceptance and discovering oneself. I think a lot of people, especially young adults, will relate to Cal's story regardless of their physical ability,  He is a protagonist that isn't seen a lot in popular culture, and I wanted to express a story that is very close to my heart but was not yet told by someone with a similar perspective. I also want to help give people hope. This is why I donate a percentage of the proceeds from Stakeeper to The It Gets Better Project.

What do you get for your money?

All contributions are appreciated, and you can also choose from a number of perks, ranging from as little as $5 for a personalized thank you or even become a character in my upcoming comic(s) from $50. A phone case for most  smartphones, a  poster, or Starkeeper T-shirts for $75 all printed with the following art. Check out the full list of perks on the right.






How will you help to spread my message?
With your contributions, we can get Cal's story out to a wider audience, and spark off further conversations about bullying, how lonely it can be for anyone who is different, and thus help more people by showing them that there is beauty in uniqueness. Due to the lack of publicity since Starkeeper's publication, generating these conversations has been difficult. I've got to speak in public on said topics which were very successful, and I'm truly grateful for that however they were very localized and not very many.


Risks & Challenges

As you can see, your money won't go to waste. Like everything there are risks and challenges in any new venture, however, I'm committed to making this work out. When I finished the script for the first part of Starkeeper: Longing, I looked for a comic artist and I eventually found one, but things didn't work out in the end and I discovered a way to do the artwork on my own with my computer. That is why it is not in the traditional comic book style which later made it more difficult to get it published, as I was rejected by many recognized publishers but finally found WoolysWagon ePublishing, who agreed to invest in my novel and idea.


Although I had challenges that seemed insurmountable, I've always found a way to overcome them and funding the promotion is just another hurdle you can help me get over. However if you can't afford to donate, I totally understand but there are other ways you can help, like spreading the word about my campaign and using the Indiegogo share tools.


Thanks all!! 

Get a sneak peek of Starkeeper: Longing Part Two right here!!
story_txt:
Who am I?

Hey all, the name's Andre.  I'm a 25 year old guy with Cerebral Palsy, a physical disability that affects my muscles. I am also a blogger, writer, video game lover, and the creator and artist of Starkeeper, a new series of sci-fi comics. Starkeeper is about Cal, a bullied and disabled teen, and his story is so damn important to me. It's my way of showing people that it can get better!


What is our campaign all about?
 Richard and I are hoping to raise $5000 for promotional purposes. Even if we don't get to our goal, all funds received will go towards  advertising on websites such as Goodreads and in international magazines, funding to attend book fairs, (hopefully.) and share my message with as many people as possible.



At its heart, Starkeeper is a story of acceptance and discovering 
oneself. I think a lot of people, especially young adults, will relate 
to Cal's story regardless of their physical ability,  He is a 
protagonist that isn't seen a lot in popular culture, and I wanted to 
express a story that is very close to my heart but was not yet told by 
someone with a similar perspective. I also want to help give people 
hope. This is why I donate a percentage of the proceeds from Stakeeper 
to The It Gets Better Project.


What do you get for your money?
All contributions are appreciated, and you can also choose from a number of perks, ranging from as little as $5 for a personalized thank you or even become a character in my upcoming comic(s) from $50. A phone case for most  smartphones, a  poster, or Starkeeper T-shirts for $75 all printed with the following art. Check out the full list of perks on the right.

 With your contributions, we can get Cal's story out to a wider audience, and spark off further conversations about bullying, how lonely it can be for anyone who is different, and thus help more people by showing them that there is beauty in uniqueness. Due to the lack of publicity since Starkeeper's publication, generating these conversations has been difficult. I've got to speak in public on said topics which were very successful, and I'm truly grateful for that however they were very localized and not very many.

story:
*Update*

All Perks backed at Heroic level and above will include everything from the Bounty Hunter level.

VileLegend.com

The Story

Vile Tells the tale of Hard-Pants, a young Native American mother trying to live her life in a brutal world. Her life is interrupted when the serial killer "Vile" Clem Stlyes wipes out her tribe, and kidnaps her. Clem Styles renames her and attempts to break her spirit. What will she do? What can she do? The murderer Clem Styles is kept alive by several curse-spirits that ensure that only a fitting and horrible death will suit Clem Styles because of the nature of his crimes. Will Hard Pants escape? Will she be the one to bring an end to "Vile" Clem Styles' killing?


Thunder-Valley 1890

In the pristine and bountiful heart of Thunder Valley, a tribe of Indians is attempting to find their own place within the natural way. Made up of several different tribes and bands, they’ve left the reservation’s confines and attempt to live on the land as their ancestors once did. 

The mysterious forces that swirl and pulsate in Thunder-Valley can give great gifts, but they can also spawn the most horrible creatures and tragedies imaginable. The Thunder-Beings, the spirits tasked with overseeing this rift, this churning fountain of creation, have become complacent. Their neglect of the order has left the great machine of life unattended. Energy slips out and sometimes pours into the valley. Thoughts and hopes, fears and desire gift life to evils that never knew life. Long dead gods find power.

The gods here are as real as the horrors and triumphs in and around Thunder-Valley. In fact, through the dreams and nightmares of the living, new gods are born everyday. One of those creatures, and tragedies, is “Vile” Clem Styles. However, this is the story of one of the lost souls that encounters him. About her uninterrupted spirit and will. Her name, people and loved onesare robbed from, her and still she fights.


Creating Vile
My name is Richard Paul Davis, or Crowsong. I'm a songwriter, composer and creator. Although I identify as Native American, I don't want this to an exclusive comicbook, or to use my heritage to sell books. I've written most of my life, and Ihave branched out into comicbooks because of my love for the medium and the stories I have to tell.

I am fortunate to have on my creative team for Vile the incredible and creative coloring and lettering skills of Carl Bolton. Though previously an amatuer inker, colorist and letterer, Carl has honed his skills via other projects and through Vile.

We also are fortunate to have the incredible talents of Francis Nuguit. In addition to his amazing work on Vile, he drew for the Robert Jordan "Wheel of Time" series and is currently working for Take-Two comics.

For all of us, this is a labor of love. Without funds however, our goal isn't able to be realized. I have been self-funding for over a year and it is time to see if we can find community support for our project.

What We HAVE

A top-notch team of creators working on the project, and the first chapter of the comic finished. We've proven ourselves to each other and can meet deadlines, put out a great comic and be easy to deal with. This isn't a hobby, and we take creating this comic and meeting our publisher's guidelines and deadlines very seriously. Speaking of publishers...

We HAVE one. That's right. We have Alterna Comics on board, and Peter Simeti of The Chair fame is waiting for our finished comic to bring it to the masses. We're not just out here on a wing and a prayer hoping we can get interest. We have had great interest from several comic companies and we chose Alterna because they get it, and they know how to operate. We only need help getting off the ground. We can get the comic, and its sequel and hopefully (fingers crossed) an entire world and ongoing world in the future.

What we need

Quite frankly, we need money to pay our amazing artist and hopefully have the funds to start work on the second issue. He has bills to pay (as we all do) and to secure his skills, we want to be able to pay him as he goes for incredible art. We don't want to skimp or compromise on quality. We need to be able to get the comic printed if it's successful as well. We're shooting for 32 pages, as a first installment of a 2-part series to tell this fantasy/western tale.

What is in it for you?

Well, since you don't know Vile, or us for the most part, we want to offer great artwork. Until you read the story, you don't know that it's a great story. So, we're offering some of the fantastic artwork of Vile. We don't want to do merchandise-we want to send you collectibles that you can cherish, regardless of the outcome. We're offering the comic once finished as well. We've complied, what we think, is a great package at every level for contributing to Vile.

*Update*

All Perks backed at Heroic level and above will include everything from the Bounty Hunter level.

The Impact

What will happen if we meet our goal, is pay to create this story. We have the "demo" or first chapter created to show we can do this. If we meet our funding goals we will have the entire story, both books, created. We can also say that the comic WILL see the light of day. It WILL be published. We have a contract to publish the series with Alterna Comics. We've received tremendous interest in the comic from several publishers, but we're choosing to go with Alterna. They get it, they work hard and they know their audience. In this day and age, other than Marvel and DC, companies do not pay you to create your comicbook. You have to show you have what it takes to meet deadlines and create that comicbook first. We get that. We can get this book out and to the public. We just need your help.


Risks & Challenges

Sure, this part. I love honesty. I can say, with certainty, that the risk is quite low here. I know everyone likes to say that, but, we can back up that, if funded, this comic will be published. You will be able to meet me at a convention and talk to me about the comic. You will be able to download your copy once it is done. And, if we're all super boys and girls, and get other super boys and girls to contribute, we will be able to hold a physical copy of Vile in our hands. That is another goal that we can go over if we meet the funding goals, however. So, the challenges are ours to face. We must put our nose to the grindstone and finish the book, we must send it to be published and we have to get the word out. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money to send, you can send ideas. You can let others know about Vile. You can go to or call your local comics store and ask them to carry our comic. You can also go to change.org and follow something that you truly believe in.  You don't just have to contribute; you can become involved to make a change for the better in our shared world.

VileLegend.com

@rpdgame

story:
" High-flying. Soul searching."

Equal parts smart and smart aleck, Eli St. Rose was gifted with a genius-level intellect at an early age. After inventing a proprietary form of kinetic propulsion called SkyGear, Eli dons the persona of Silverstreek: Guardian of The City of Angels. Though he's adjusted to his new found fame and celebrity, there's more eyes on Silverstreek than ever before.



SILVERSTREEK was a character that I’ve had in my head for the better part of a decade. I wanted to create a ‘fun’ superhero comic book as a response to the needlessly ‘dark,’ conflicted heroes of the modern age. For the record, I love “M Rated” comics as much as the next guy but I realized the gap between “family” books and mature titles was widening by the day.

The short story was fine for a time, but after a while there was the itch to make Eli St. Rose a comic once again. This time, I bootstrapped the funds to hire an artist with the goal of not stopping production until SILVERSTREEK was completed. On January 3, 2015 the SILVERSTREEK: One Shot was born!

Soon after, it became apparent that a one time appearance just simply wasn't going to suffice. SILVERSTREEK's story just couldn't be confined to twenty pages and so we need your help to make that a possibility. Here's the breakdown of costs:

$2400 will go to artists' fees.

$300 Printing Costs

While we will cover any extra costs beyond that.

SILVERSTREEK is a independent superhero story (a mild controversy in its own right) that is a satirical take of the modern day culture of celebrity. It's a balanced mix of action and humor, and will appeal to all ages.

story:
'A Dream' is a 32 page, fully coloured stand alone comic about young Victoria who must journey across a fantasy land, filled with wonder and adversity, in aid of a new found friend.

'A Dream' is the meeting of my love for comics and literature. I often times find that many great scribes have already said what I wanted to, and in a much more eloquent way, which inspired me to create a series of poetic comics. However, while 'A Dream' is wholly narrated by a poem from a rather famous writer, what you see will be my own little interpretation of the poem, my story, embedded within the artwork and symbolism which I storyboarded into each panel.

                             


                          





Rewards

- Physical Copy of 'A Dream': USD $10
- 'A Dream' Theme Song (Symphony) and (Ivory): USD $2 each
- 'Cloud' Print: USD $10/AUD $15 each
- 'Season' Print: USD $15/AUD $20 each (Your choice of Spring, Summer, Autumn or Winter)
- Black and White 'Season' Colouring Print: USD$15 each (Spring or Autumn)

(Please add USD$5 for tiers which do not already have prints in them for shipping)


  • 'A Dream' Comic: Please note there will be no more gold signatures for now, but if you are really interested, drop me a message.

  • ‘Clouds’ by Serene Lau (Concept Art from ‘A Dream’) (20*20cm)

                                                          

  • ‘A Dream’ Theme Song, Symphony (Full Orchestra) and Ebony (Original Piano Solo) Variants were composed by Jon Ong, to heighten the experience of 'A Dream' and to give you a little something to carry with you through your day. (Short looped sample in video above)
  • 'Season' Prints: The 'Seasons' prints are the artistic interpretations of other creators for a sequence in the book known as 'The Seasons'. Future reprints  will not have the same level of quality paper stock. There will also be black and white variants of Spring and Autumn for those who like to colour. All prints in A3 size.

    2 'Season' Prints get you 'A Dream' Theme (Symphony) for free.
    3 'Season' Prints get you both 'A Dream' Themes (Symphony and Ivory) for free! For 4, check out 'The Dreamworld' reward tier!


               

             Spring                          Summer                         Autumn                            Winter 


Commissions
Serene Lau and Héctor Barros will be doing commissions, take a look what you could get!

                                   
       Héctor Barros Dreaming (Full Render)               Serene Lau Dreaming

        
                                                                      Your Dream!



About the Writer

Hi guys, my name is David Goei, an aspiring comic book writer. In Melbourne, Australia, I was first introduced to the world of independent comics where my mentor noted my storytelling ability by accident.

‘A Dream’ will be my first self-published comic and it has been a 2 year long labour of love and research. Thus far, early test readers have enjoyed both the story and the art, with a few surprisingly pleasant comments too!

I am currently working on several other scripts at the moment so if you wish to keep in touch with all I do, feel free to follow me!

Tumblr: http://davidgoei.tumblr.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/DavidGoei
Instagram: @DavidGoei (BIIIG surprise, huh? ;) )


About the Artist

Serene Lau is an artist based in Melbourne, Australia. She recently showcased her works at her solo exhibition 'Sewer Princesses' at the Hawthorn Arts Centre. 'A Dream' will be her first foray into comics but keep an eye out for her, she's going places!
http://serenekitchen.tumblr.com


About the Creators

Jon Ong is a talented composer/multi-instrumental musical genius based in Los Angeles, California, where he has worked on soundtracks for movies such as 'Ruby Sparks' and 'Paddington'. He has also performed with numerous artists such as JoJo, Michael McDonald, Guy Sebastian and Jorge Drexler.
http://www.jonongmusic.com



Héctor Barros (Spring) is a Spanish illustrator/colourist who has worked on projects like fanzine INSOMNIA as a cover artist and writer. He coloured for The Poincare conjecture for Diabolo and has exhibited his watercolour art on two occasions (Chimaeras 2011/Metamorphosis 2012). Hector is currently colouring for LGBT superhero comic book, 'The Pride', as one half of super arts duo, H+M.
http://snibbits.tumblr.com



Maxime Garabarini (Spring) is a French illustrator/writer whose first comic, 'Premier bebe: Lannee ou tout a change' six years ago. He is the founder of online comic label closecallcomics.com and published 'Heroic Patrol', which he wrote, scripted and illustrated. Maxime is currently illustrating for LGBT superhero comic book, 'The Pride', as one half of super arts duo, H+M.
http://melovecomics.tumblr.com


Sabrina Cotugno (Summer) is an American illustrator and storyboard artist living in Los Angeles. She is the creator of the webcomic The Glass Scientists and has worked on Gravity Falls and Star vs. the Forces of Evil. She enjoys cooking, needlefelting, and sleeping.
https://www.facebook.com/arythusa
http://www.theglassscientists.com


Gary Choo (Autumn) is a Marvel cover artist and ex-LucasArts illustrator residing in Asia. His notable works includes concept art for LucasArt’s 1313, Monkey Island 2: Special Edition and cover art for Image Comics Liquid City 3. Currently he is a Senior Concept Artist at a local start up, Booster Pack along with other Ex-LucasArts members.
https://www.facebook.com/gary.choo01


Matty Taylor (Winter) is a comic illustrator and colourist, who works mainly in the medium of traditional watercolours. When not working on his personal projects, Matty is also the bassist of the Melbourne Metal band, Winterun.
https://www.facebook.com/ArtOfMattyT?fref=ts

She recently showcased her works at her solo exhibition 'Sewer Princesses' at the Hawthorn Arts Centre. 'A Dream' will be her first foray into comics but keep an eye out for her, she's going places!http://serenekitchen.tumblr.comAbout the CreatorsJon Ong is a talented composer/multi-instrumental musical genius based in Los Angeles, California, where he has worked on soundtracks for movies such as 'Ruby Sparks' and 'Paddington'. He has also performed with numerous artists such as JoJo, Michael McDonald, Guy Sebastian and Jorge Drexler.http://www.jonongmusic.comHéctor Barros (Spring) is a Spanish illustrator/colourist who has worked on projects like fanzine INSOMNIA as a cover artist and writer. He coloured for The Poincare conjecture for Diabolo and has exhibited his watercolour art on two occasions (Chimaeras 2011/Metamorphosis 2012). Hector is currently colouring for LGBT superhero comic book, 'The Pride', as one half of super arts duo, H+M.http://snibbits.tumblr.com

Maxime Garabarini (Spring) is a French illustrator/writer whose first comic, 'Premier bebe: Lannee ou tout a change' six years ago. He is the founder of online comic label closecallcomics.com and published 'Heroic Patrol', which he wrote, scripted and illustrated. Maxime is currently illustrating for LGBT superhero comic book, 'The Pride', as one half of super arts duo, H+M.http://melovecomics.tumblr.com





Sabrina Cotugno (Summer) is an American illustrator and storyboard artist living in Los Angeles. She is the creator of the webcomic The Glass Scientists and has worked on Gravity Falls and Star vs. the Forces of Evil. She enjoys cooking, needlefelting, and sleeping.https://www.facebook.com/arythusahttp://www.theglassscientists.com




Gary Choo (Autumn) is a Marvel cover artist and ex-LucasArts illustrator residing in Asia. His notable works includes concept art for LucasArt’s 1313, Monkey Island 2: Special Edition and cover art for Image Comics Liquid City 3. Currently he is a Senior Concept Artist at a local start up, Booster Pack along with other Ex-LucasArts members.https://www.facebook.com/gary.choo01



Matty Taylor (Winter) is a comic illustrator and colourist, who works mainly in the medium of traditional watercolours. When not working on his personal projects, Matty is also the bassist of the Melbourne Metal band, Winterun.https://www.facebook.com/ArtOfMattyT?fref=ts

story:
There we were having a perfectly normal morning when Lisa posts a story about men dying hair & beards vivid colours, see "Merman Trend". She posted to John wondering if he, like always, will be following the swings of fashion.

As John's response was not full blown refusal, all saw this as acceptance. Thus the campaign was born!

Oh and like everything, we have to have stretch goals ....

- £500 for beard
- £1000 for beard and hair
- £1500 for beard, hair & eyebrows

All money raised will go to the Macmillan Cancer support

story:
A love letter to the classic British telefantasy of the 1960s.

UPDATE!!! We’ve reached our minimum goal to create this pilot.  What we’re stretching for now is to make it as AWESOME as it can possibly be, by increasing the page count to tell a truly breath taking version of our story!

Created by Stefano Cardoselli and Tzvi Lebetkin - The team behind the popular Ice Warriors fan strip. The Imperium takes iconic characters and deconstructed them to their roots, reassembles them in modern form – and then dumps them all into a super group with a stonking, mind bending action and adventure.

We sat down and thought about what IS the 1960s, as it now exists in the media-sphere. For us it’s all about Patrick Troughton charging up and down monotoned corridors. It’s monkeys in space suits. It’s sexy cat suited super spies. It’s opening doors to the windows of perception…and just so much more.

We sat down and thought what would an alien ‘cosmic hobo’ be like? What would a womanising government assassin with no conscience be like? Why would a gorgeous and insanely talented woman be a super spy, and what’s with all that tight leather?

And most importantly, how would they all play together?

And How would that even happen?

These are the questions we address and answer in the Imperium – and at the same time stuffing it as full with as many cultural references as could possibly fit on a page.

But isn’t this just fan fiction?

Well…yes, it is.

But then we thought we live in a new era of professional fan fiction. Bryan Fuller’s take on Hannibal Lecter is nearing it’s end as I write this. Russell T. Davis ripped all our childhood’s wildest imaginings into reality when he breathed new life in to Doctor Who (FINALLY – Daleks and Cybermen fighting each other – but couldn’t the steel giants have taken down at least one pepper pot, I complained to myself). Guillermo del Toro sat in his bath as a child and played with dinosaur and robot toys, like we all did – but then thirty years later spent millions of dollars and made it a celluloid reality with the wonderful Pacific Rim.

Is it fan fiction – yes – unashamedly so! Almost as much as JJ Abrams take on Star trek was, and I think (and hope) Star Wars episode 7 is going to be!

But of course, we want to be saying something new as well – and hope you’ll all be along for the ride.

Here are the first few pages from this pilot:

Inside The Creative Process

This is the perk we're most excited - 'Inside The Creative Process' - where you get intimate access to the book as we create it.  You see us come up with great ideas, and then throw them out when we come up with something better on the fly. For example the driver of the yellow sports car in the beginning only ended up shouting at the Agent 'I've got your number, sonny' at the very last minute as it was being lettered. That's where the best stuff always comes from - out of nowhere in the final moments.

So, that's what we're offering - exclusive, interactive access to us as we make the book.

If we raise enough money to bring in an editor, then you'll see the notes on the scripts - which normally tear them apart. And then see them put back together again.

The Different Editions of the Book

Vanilla - This will be just the comic, and little to no extras.  The comic will be minimally a 22 page standard US colour comic book. What does minimally mean? It means it'll be as big as we raise money for. If we're lucky enough to meet and break our goal then the comic will grow exponentially.

Deluxe - This edition will be PACKED with tons of extras. Our fan Ice Warriors web strips will be be in there (click here to check them out at). An extensive making of section with scripts, sketches and any other cool stuff we can come up with or YOU can suggest to us. A directors commentary and annotations - you name it, or we think of it - and in it goes!

Supersized - A large, lavish 8 1/2x11 inch edition of the Deluxe version.  If there's enough of a demand for this one it'll get it's own unique cover.

Supersized sketch - A personalised hand drawn cover by artist Stefano Cardoselli.  That is we'll print some with blank covers - you tell us what you'd like on the cover (within reason - you're not going to get 50 of your favourite characters fighting for space. More what you'd expect from a convention sketch).  

This reward requires $20 shipping, as we need to ship the comics to Stefano in Italy, and then ship them from there to you.

A directors commentary and annotations - you name it, or we think of it - and in it goes!Supersized - A large, lavish 8 1/2x11 inch edition of the Deluxe version.  If there's enough of a demand for this one it'll get it's own unique cover.Supersized sketch - A personalised hand drawn cover by artist Stefano Cardoselli.  That is we'll print some with blank covers - you tell us what you'd like on the cover (within reason - you're not going to get 50 of your favourite characters fighting for space. story:
THE BERZERK DEATH DEALER is an over the top, ultra stylish action gore fest written and created by Vishal Rajput. KILLER features: A Gothic style similar to the epic film THE CROW fused with a punk rock look, brutal John Woo style gun action,  and Vicious hand to hand combat in the vein of the Anime FIST OF THE NORTH STAR. 


The Story: Young Diablo is one bad-ass dude that is armed to the teeth with his scythe guitar and punk rock guns killing in style with his loyal dog, Rockabella. As the number one assassin for the Demon Clan, he's got 99,999 heads to prove it. He can smoke a joint in one puff, drain a beer bottle in one gulp, and talk trash better than anyone. When he gets going, his blades sing, his fists fly, and his enemies' heads explode.

His demonic master, Basilisk, has plans for Diablo -- but everything changes when Diablo discovers his humanity after saving the life of a young mother. Now Basilisk is out to destroy Diablo, with the help of a new protégé -- Amon, a ruthless assassin formed from the souls of 1,000 serial killers.

My Story: Hey guys! My name is Vishal Rajput. I'm an artist and writer living in the suburbs of Illinois. I have a strong passion for the arts and I'm insanely addicted to anime.  After my internship at the indie company, "Smooth Sounds Multimedia," I had a strong passion to go out on my own and start my own production company, "Planet Boom Boom Pictures Ltd.," that is dedicated to making live Anime style films encompassing all genres. Stories about revenge make great movies since you can approach them anyway you like. At a personal level, I have approached "The Berzerk Death Dealer" artistically and include a huge fan service that Anime fans always want. AN ANIME STYLE MOVIE DONE RIGHT WITH ALL THOSE CRAZY BACK DROPS, VELOCITY LINES, AND GRAPHIC NOVEL STYLE SEQUENCES.

The teaser trailer version of "The Berzerk Death Dealer" is based off of the 20 minutes prototype I shot with some friends and to show case our talent. The prototype version is about Diablo fighting the 24 killjoy clan that betrayed the demon clan and stole their drugs and the fight against the Mad Goat is to test strength against man vs. beast.

Here's a little Fatality Story Board Sequence of the Mad Goat. 

I'm currently rebooting my project in a 6 part Manga graphic novel form to tell the whole story of The Berzerk Death Dealer from start to finish since it is much cheaper to make and I can get my full vision out without any limits. The story is all finished and many of the artworks as well. Also, I'm getting the help with another talented artist ASHLEE VAREKOIS to help me work the interior of the comic. 

Here's a link to her work. (Show artist work - http://www.akoisart.moonfruit.com/digital-illustration/4589739339)

Another thing that sets this comic apart from most other comics is that we have two award winning leading actors from Hollywood to actually star in this comic. We give you MICHAEL EKLUND (films: The Divide, The Call, Eadweard, and Bates Motel) who will be the face of the main character, DIABLO and TRISTAN RISK(films: American Mary, Call Girl, Frankenstein Created Bikers, and The Editor) who will be the face of the main character MAZ LATEX for issue one.

 

Michael Eklund's IMDB http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1002664/?ref_=nv_sr_1


Tristan Risk's IMDB http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2021381/?ref_=nv_sr_1
In addition, we have TABITHA BASHORE. An upcoming make up artist, prop, and mask creator straight out of Chicago. She has been dominating the horror scene with her mad skills in make up and mask creations.

Tabitha has created a special mask, which is Diablo's Mask from the comic reboot just for you mask fanatics out there that want to cosplay my character. Take a look at this beast!

If you guys have loved this already, take a look at her other works as well https://www.facebook.com/TabithaLoveNoelBashore?__mref=message_bubble
The first issue. The Berzerk Death Dealer: DEATH REIGNS STYLISH is about Diablo, the assassin for the Demon Clan, who goes after the Da' Fetish Queenz that are trying to take over Gothic Town. Da' Fetish Queenz head honcho is Maz Latex who's objective is to destroy all males in Gothic Town and let woman power reign supreme. (This issue will be 48 pages total.)
COVER OF THE FIRST ISSUE DRAWN BY JEFFERY MOY. A TALENTED ARTIST WHO HAS WORKED ON MANY SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS, TAKE A LOOK AT HIS WORK ON HIS WEBSITE http://www.jeffreymoy.com/ :

ANATOMY OF DRAWING A COVER. (DRAWN BY JEFFERY MOY)


SAMPLE PAGES FROM THE COMIC DRAWN BY ASHLEE GALLOWAY:

THE ALTERNATE COVER CREATED BY ERIK WILSON: 

Challenges: Funding is the main challenge for niche comics out there since so many comic book writers and artists want to get their product to shine. The worst case scenario if the comic does not get it's funding, we will still try to make the graphic novel with whatever money was donated.  But no challenge is too difficult as long as we work together to make everyone's dreams come true!
Where the Money goes: The supporters that will help to make this project come alive can know that their money is safe and sound. We are going to use the money to pay our artist for the interior work and the perks. 
Why help fund The Berzerk Death Dealer: "The Berzerk Death Dealer" is a breath of fresh air of blistering originality that most comic book lovers hope to see. A true work of artistic talent with mind bending explosive energy and entertainment from start to finish. This will definitely quench the thirst of hardcore R rated lovers around the world. So come on all of you HEAVY METAL AND ANIME LOVERS!!! Donate today so you guys can see a new breed of Insane action!

If any questions please email at planetboomboompicturesltd@gmail.com

story:
Join us in our cause! 

Let's all ban together and send legal rape advocate "Roosh V." some glitter bomb mail. 

Daryush "Roosh V" Valizadeh, a blogger and known misogynist, has quickly made his way into the public spotlight as of late.

Roosh is the founder of "Return of Kings" a "neo-masculinity" group that has been labeled "pro rape", advocated anti-gay beliefs, as well as, seemingly having an overall hatred for woman.  

Here are just a few examples of what Mr. Valizadeh has to say on the matter:

  •  "Gender equality is a myth that has no scientific basis"
  • "My default opinion of any girl I meet is 'worthless dirty whore until proven otherwise'. When so many girls have opened their legs up for me so quickly and easily, it's hard for me to respect them [and their opinions or ideas] like I would a family member or close friend."
  • "Gay marriage is a part of a long war that will eventually criminalize or socially forbid certain aspects of heterosexual behavior at the same time it overly sexualizes young children in order to introduce them to homosexuality."
  • "I propose that we make the violent taking of a woman not punishable by law when done off public grounds. If rape becomes legal under my proposal, a girl will protect her body in the same manner that she protects her purse and smartphone."

While we refuse to stoop to Roosh V's level, we can still show him what it's like to be a victim.  

That's why it is our goal to send a glitter bomb letter to his home address every day for one year.

story:
What's the idea?

We are Deadpool biggest fans. We also know things in design & knitting. And then there was Instagram post by @vancityreynolds and we told ourselves "hey, we're not his Nana but we can do it!"

And so we did. Meet Deadpool Turtleneck Pullover Sweater Limited Collector's Edition. It sounds quite complicated (even for a big comic fan) so we used to call it simply DeadPull :)

Why should I get it?

First of all ask yourself why not. It's fun and it's also cozy. It's one of a kind and not a mass-market.  In case you dig one of those things then go on. Pick a perk. Or spread a word to participate in our referral program (see below).

Will I get any superpowers?

You've got sense of humor and style if you are considering this. What else one might need in this crazy world? You already have them!

What else should I know?

We've spent hundreds of hours and pounds of yarn to prototype this sweater. We think it's just amazing and we are very fond of idea that we can make this project alive, produce and dress you or your friends in these amazing sweaters. We are so into it that we made the campaign flexible and any amount of contributors will get their perks as scheduled and promised.
Give me some specs.

Deadpool (real name Wade Winston Wilson) is a fictional character, an antihero\superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics. Created by writer Fabian Nicieza and artist/writer Rob Liefeld, the character first appeared in The New Mutants #98 cover-dated (Feb. 1991)...

Or you mean the pullover specs? Then we are glad you've asked. We use the highest grade hypoallergenic polyacrylic yarn produced in the EU for these seamless knitted sweaters. Like original Deadpool they are very soft (we know he is... deep inside) yet very durable. Machine wash ready. The actual color is offwhite. Turtleneck goes in 4 regular sizes and is unisex.

We also post pics to the Gallery tab for your convenience. 

What about risks?

We are confident in what we are doing and did our best to cut out any risks. We have designs ready and estimated cost-wise, as well as evaluated in terms of timeframe required for implementation. Being very responsive to any issues that might arise, we guarantee real support to our contributors. We will communicate with you and answer any questions. Also feel free to subscribe to campaign updates.

Are there any ways to participate other than contributing?

Thanks for asking! Sure there are. Spread the word, share this campaign and become a referral. It's easy.

  • If 3 of your referred friends get the pullover, you get to buy one for 50% off
  • If 5 of your referred friends get the pullover, you get one for free

In either case, if you reach the referral level, we'll contact you with more instructions on how to claim your 50% off or your free vibrator.

Anyone who you refer through your share links when logged into Indiegogo. You'll be able to track referral progress through your personal account dashboard on the site. See Indiegogo's official guide on referral programs for more details.

Be cool. But also be warm. Peace & love.

Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Pinterest and here is the link with all the media content in case one might need them. 


Deadpool is a property of Fox. Deadpool trademark belongs to Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation and\or it's affiliates. wnb.design is not affiliated to Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation.
story_txt:
What's the idea?We are Deadpool biggest fans. We also know things in design & knitting. And then there was Instagram post by @vancityreynolds and we told ourselves "hey, we're not his Nana but we can do it!"



And so we did. Meet Deadpool Turtleneck Pullover Sweater Limited Collector's Edition. It sounds quite complicated (even for a big comic fan) so we used to call it simply DeadPull :)



Why should I get it?


First of all ask yourself why not. It's fun and it's also cozy. It's one of a kind and not a mass-market.  In case you dig one of those things then go on. Pick a perk. Or spread a word to participate in our referral program (see below). 

Will I get any superpowers?

You've got sense of humor and style if you are considering this. What else one might need in this crazy world? You already have them!

What else should I know?

We've spent hundreds of hours and pounds of yarn to prototype this sweater. We think it's just amazing and we are very fond of idea that we can make this project alive, produce and dress you or your friends in these amazing sweaters. We are so into it that we made the campaign flexible and any amount of contributors will get their perks as scheduled and promised.


Give me some specs.

 Deadpool (real name Wade Winston Wilson) is a fictional character, an antihero\superhero appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics. Created by writer Fabian Nicieza and artist/writer Rob Liefeld, the character first appeared in The New Mutants #98 cover-dated (Feb. 1991)...
Or you mean the pullover specs? Then we are glad you've asked. We use the highest grade hypoallergenic polyacrylic yarn produced in the EU for these seamless knitted sweaters. Like original Deadpool they are very soft (we know he is... deep inside) yet very durable. Machine wash ready. The actual color is offwhite. Turtleneck goes in 4 regular sizes and is unisex.
We also post pics to the Gallery tab for your convenience. 
What about risks?
 We are confident in what we are doing and did our best to cut out any risks. We have designs ready and estimated cost-wise, as well as evaluated in terms of timeframe required for implementation. Being very responsive to any issues that might arise, we guarantee real support to our contributors. We will communicate with you and answer any questions. Also feel free to subscribe to campaign updates.
Are there any ways to participate other than contributing?
Thanks for asking! Sure there are. Spread the word, share this campaign and become a referral. It's easy.


If 3 of your referred friends get the pullover, you get to buy one for 50% off
If 5 of your referred friends get the pullover, you get one for free


In either case, if you reach the referral level, we'll contact you with more instructions on how to claim your 50% off or your free vibrator.
Anyone who you refer through your share links when logged into Indiegogo. You'll be able to track referral progress through your personal account dashboard on the site. See Indiegogo's official guide on referral programs for more details.
Be cool. But also be warm. Peace & love.




Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Pinterest and here is the link with all the media content in case one might need them. 



Deadpool is a property of Fox. Deadpool trademark belongs to Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation and\or it's affiliates. wnb.design is not affiliated to Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation.

story:
KreeKraw and Kris are two Alien creatures with a rare gift for stumbling into trouble .
Lost in the void with no friends and a galaxy of hostile strangers.
They must rely on each other and extreme and sustained ultra violence to solve there problems.

With any luck they'll find home before there enemies catch up with them.

After visiting an Aquatic planet ,Kris is framed for murder .

He and his squiddy friend must stage a prison break ,fight off an army of police officers

and infiltrate the conspirator's lair to expose their evil schemes.

24 Pages of violence ,mayhem and sex,all a young lad needs to further his education.

 

If funding allows the second story below will also be included in the comic

otherwise it will be included in the second comic book

When there stolen mining ship ,the Saucy Susan, is damaged in a battle with the Ultra Bastard           our dirty duo must set down to make repairs ,but can only find a colonised asteroid filled with "ladies of negotiable affection".

A gang war is brewing between the various leaders of each  "Pleasure Palace" and kreekraw and kris must find a way through the madness without getting shot ,stabbed,lasered or vaporised.

12 Bonus Pages of Violence and whores ?what more could you ask for?

 

Cover of The First Explosive Issue

One of my earliest memories is reading one of 2000AD's science fiction stories about  a serial killer aboard a space freighter.The Twist ending  blew my tiny 6 year old mind .

I've loved comics my entire life ,from making my own at age seven

(they were somewhat derivative) to now ,when I require a few lorries to move my collection from house to house.

 

As for the campaign I would like to get full funding for the artist ,printing and shipping costs                  and more importantly establish a relationship with similar minded fans who might like to read the future adventures of a Cowboy Space Squid and his tubby Human friend as they kick ass across a hostile universe.

Estimates for an artist who will also ink and colours are coming up to £2000 UKP.                                 

Shipping all over the world can be up to £10 each even for a small package

Printing will be done abroad in china to save as much money as possible for my people.

As a contingency for failing to reach the funding goal i will prioritise the art and self fund completion and send every backer a PDF.

 

Kris (pictured Below)Considers Not using violence for once

I have 8 stories written ,Hopefully Spread  Across 4 books.I dont intend to go on for decades with the same characters .There will be a definitive ending and a fleshed out back story for how these people came to be emotionally damaged Anarchists.I do want to spend the rest of my life making fun comics for everyone.

 

 
If money is tight in this crazy work-a-day world please consider giving me a boost on social media twitter,youtube  etc
 
god bless
Mike.A Swan
 

Other Sources

blog

https://creatingcomicsatlast.blogspot.com/

youtube channel

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIz35mA3mdzXrk...

Twitter

https://twitter.com/GateComics

 

Credits

Cover & Promo Art :JustSomeGuy

Interior art :Samuel Owen

Colours: Rodrigo Ybañez
